Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: britt84
Reviews.Content: I looked for several days for a hotel to stay 1 night and all seemed overpriced. I came across the Coral Princess and called and gave me a great rate. The hotel is just a few min walk to Condado beach. Nice beach to take your family! The hotel decor was very nice and modern. Loved the courtyard with plants. Had a nice breakfast in the morning. It was nice to get away from the hotel chains and try a boutique hotel. I would definitely come back and stay if we ever make it back to San Juan. This hotels gets 5 stars from us!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: SINN
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a night after a cruise. Very clean, spacious and with many tasteful flourishes. We ended up in a very spacious and light-filled penthouse. An immediately noticeable feature of the hotel is a presence of multiple common living-room-like spaces. All nicely arranged and decorated. There is a piano, should you want to make your kids catch up on their lessons after a week-long cruise. :). Staff was very helpful. We originally made the reservation for a wrong day. They worked with us on the day of our arrival and worked it all out without any penalties, even though is was completely our fault. Location is good, but not perfect. It's a 5 minute walk to the beach and a $14 dollar ride to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night in San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Sims3
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff. Comfortable room and beds. Hot tub, pool, 24 hour coffee and juice bar and continental breakfast. Very close to the beach. Only about 5 parking spots in front of the hotel. If these are not available you have to park a few blocks away in a 24 hr parking lot for $13. I would stay again although I am not sure I will visit San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: philthesailor
Reviews.Content: What a lovely, small boutique hotel with lovely coutyards and outside apace. We stayed pre and post cruise. Situated in Condado. Comfortable beds, Free coffee ( good coffee as well ) and fruit juices all day. Fruit and crackers available at reception. Continental breakfast included. 2 blocks from beach. Staff really friendly and on both occasions able to leave our cases in storage after checkout and prior to boarding ship / leaving for airport. Thus able to enjoy the day without worry about luggage. A small pool that looked inviting but never used as so busy. Kids seemed to enjoy it though.Truly a gem and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful overnight before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea2bk
Reviews.Content: Awesome rates. Staff very friendly, courteous and informative. Wonderful facilities! Continental breakfast was quite tasty. Loved the help-yourself coffee machine. Great addition. Reserve a penthouse for yourself when you make a reservation. Very roomy!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, comfy botique hotel with great value!”
Reviews.Author: CheneyBr
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a four-night stay at the Coral Princess and we loved it! The hotel itself has a quaint, cozy feel. The rooms are immaculately clean and we found the bed to be very comfortable. We stayed on the first floor, close to where hotel breakfast is served- if you are a very light sleeper and are hoping to sleep in, you may want to stay on the second or third floor to avoid the sounds of hallway traffic. Other than breakfast time, our room was very quiet! The staff at the front desk were eager to help us with everything from calling taxis for us to giving us clear directions to take the city bus to Old San Juan. Though the hotel is not directly on the beach, the walk is very short and takes less than 2 minutes! The hotel will supply you with extra towels to use at the beach if you ask for them. Beach chairs can be rented for $3/day. Overall, I think the Coral Princess is amazing for the price you pay. If you are looking for a beach-front hotel with a fancy pool, this isn't the place for you. But if you don't mind a short walk to the beach, the value is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night pre cuirse...it was a great location. The room was a bit on the small side but still ok. the bathroom was well appointed but a bit dark. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. Continental breakfast was adequate and the usual find in my most hotels. Located within a 5 minute to Condado beach and several restaurants and small shops. Overall a great find and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bargain. I almost don't want to review it to keep it to myself;-)”
Reviews.Author: CamWingate
Reviews.Content: My first time in PR and this hotel was recommended. I love it! The rooms are small and quaint. Very well decorated and kept clean. Make sure you check out the third floor. I love all of the sitting areas that are available just to hang out! The staff is friendly, welcoming and accommodating. Really close to everything even though we had a car. We walked to the pricy hotels for restaurants and casinos but return to our lovely relaxing nook to unwind. Perfect for relaxation. Couldn't ask for a better trip and I will return here on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: dramaq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night following a week-long tour of Puerto Rico. It truly lives up to it's claim of being a small, friendly boutique hotel. Although our flight was scheduled for the late afternoon (several hours after the check-out) and we'd done all of the exploring we wanted to do, the staff urged us to just stay and relax in their charming public areas - drinking the complimentary coffee and juice and catching up with work and emails via their WiFi. They made us feel like their personal guests and it was a great way to unwind after a busy week of touring. Sometimes its what a hotel staff does after the check-out that leaves the greatest impression!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: emseetee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night with my parents after flying into San Juan. The room wasn't quite what i was anticipating from the pictures on their website, but it wasn't bad either. The staff is very nice and the facilities are pretty good too. I just wasn't a fan of the neighborhood and the price seemed a little steep for what we got. If I had to do it again, I would have booked a room in Old San Juan - but Coral Princess is a pretty good spot if you end up in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Roadking55
Reviews.Content: Our group of 2 couples stayed at this hotel overnight on our way home from the BVI. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The rooms were good, but not great. The things we enjoyed most were the good location and the courtyard in the middle of the property where you could meet and have a casual breakfast and enjoy the tropical feel. We'd recommend this hotel to anyone that likes the feel of smaller, unique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel061788
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess in January for our honeymoon and cant wait to go back. The location of the hotel is perfect, near all kinds of restaurants, bars and casinos. The beach is just a short 2 minute walk away and there is a 24 hours walgreens around the block (thats always handy). The hotel itself is beautiful, clean, well kept with very cozy common areas. The rooms are not huge, but they sure are very confortable. It has a mini cooler with water, sodas, beer and wine for what In my opinion are great prices for a hotel. Breakfast is perfect! A lovely spread with more than enough food to get your day going. The unlimited juice and coffee was very convenient. My favorite part? The 3rd floor outside hot tub!! Very relaxing, romantic area. I Loved it!! As for the staff they were amazing! Very helpful, cheerful and welcoming. With the exception of this one lady at the front desk who was not that nice at all, everyone else made us feel at home. They were very acurate with their restaurant recomendations and helpful when it came to tour reservations. Over all we had a wonderful stay at The Coral Princess, they made of our honeymoon everything we expected and more. We WILL defenetly be back to Puerto Rico and this WILL be the place for us to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Coral Princess!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckTraveller5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coral Princess for 5 nights in January 2012 before a cruise and just loved it. It's in a very nice area of Condado, close to the beach, with lots of very good restaurants within walking distance. You can also walk to a huge grocery store within 15 minutes. The hotel itself is really pretty with lots of beautiful little sitting areas and our room was big and very clean. The staff was welcoming, professional, friendly, and very helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there on our next visit to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a "boutique-y" hotel”
Reviews.Author: xj6jj
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Coral Princess. The hotel describes it self as a "boutique, art deco" hotel. I have to agree. It isn't your Holidy Inn. It is small, has a nice ambience with several courtyard areas to relax in, the rooms are comfortable, and the bathrooms nice. Each room has a small flat screen TV, a wine refrigerator stocked with water, pop, beer, and wine, and a steamer instead of an iron. The prices for water, pop, and beer in the wine fridge are very reasonable. Continental breakfast available until 10:00AM. Still just a chain to "secure" the door. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Loved the location. We felt very safe walking the sidewalks around the hotel. This will always be high on our list of places to stay when in the Condado area.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable but not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ashes26_12
Reviews.Content: In the Condado area this is a reasonable hotel-----$155. But.......small closet, tv did not work, inadequate breakfast---the only good things were the coffee and yogurt. The bed frame, footboard, juts out at an angle---I broke my toe. It was the last day of our trip so the limping wasn't too terrible.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: littleoven582
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a hotel room in Condado on the fly and after reading the great reviews on TripAdvisor about the Coral Princess we decided to book their last room available. We absolutely loved it! The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and modern and it was just a short walk to the beach and casinos. Next time we are in PR, we'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little inn”
Reviews.Author: DeeP23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during the first few days of our vacation to be close to his family and we enjoyed our stay. It's an INN folks and you cannot expect the luxuries of a five star hotel! It was clean, staff was very friendly, great free breakfast, and close to all shopping and restaurants in the Condado area. Beach is just a walk away. So if you want the great experience of a smaller hotel, this is it....

Reviews.Title: “Great location & roof deck”
Reviews.Author: pantone808
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were shown our room - the smallest, and only room without any window - per the floor plan on the door. We asked for another room, and were shown a better one with window. The interiors are newer, comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was just passable, you can get better food elsewhere. There is a hot tub on the roof deck and nice terrace and planters at street level. There is a lounge and 24/7 coffee available. The location, in the Condado area, was on a quiet street, and easy walking distance to the shopping area, coastline and across the bridge is Old San Juan, walkable but does take some time. If you have rental car, you can find parking within a few blocks, but it's not easy. I would recommend this place for a good value and the roof deck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, small room”
Reviews.Author: Pablo B
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is perhaps best for its location and its price. We booked our room through hotels.com and wondered if they reserve the smallest room they have for that offer (or if they saw that we had backpacks and gave us that room). It was literally the size of the bed and not much more, a tiny dresser and then a reasonably sized bathroom. But it really didn't matter; it was the last leg of our honeymoon and we were going into Old San Juan every day, basically just back in the room to sleep. The breakfast was ok, nothing special but we did like the machine serving juice and the one serving coffee and hot cocoa. The third floor hot tub and first floor dive pool are decent and the third floor sitting areas are really nice. We walked to Old San Juan (about an hour) and the bus probably would've only taken 15 minutes but we were there during San Sebastien so it was crazy busy. Still, it is significantly cheaper than other options and was clean and good. The hotel staff was also extremely helpful and pleasant. I'd recommend it but just know what you're getting yourself into.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, rooms a bit dirty”
Reviews.Author: malikimkr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess hotel for one night on our way to and from British Virgin Islands (two nights total) in October of 2010. The staff was excellent, very friendly and very helpful assisting us with our needs (arranging taxi rides, dinner suggestions, etc.). It was a $17 taxi ride from the airport and took anywhere from 10-30 minutes depending on traffic. The hotel itself was not that nice. The room was a little cramped and definitely needed a little better cleaning. The pool was pretty small and the whirlpool and lounge chairs on the roof could have used some better cleaning as well. As others have said, the location was a bit on the edge of a not so nice neighborhood which required buzzing in through the front door as well as a protective fence around the property. Though the surrounding area seemed dodgy, it is only a half block from a main drag with lots of places to eat and shop as well as the beach. On our return trip we were booked into a room that had some black â€œdust bunniesâ€� all over the place as well as quite a bit of hair on the bed and floor. I think the A/C unit just needed to be cleaned as it was the source of the dust bunnies but it was spewing them all over the room. We notified the front desk of the situation and they promptly moved us to a different room which was in the same condition as the first time we stayed (reasonably clean) and apologized profusely. The included continental breakfast was nothing special but was good enough for us; pastries, fruit, juices, etc. The price was one of the better ones we found and was in the lower middle of the pack and after reading reviews on Trip Advisor more expensive hotels had similar problems to those described above. Our main issue was the cleanliness. I think if they would give rooms a more thorough cleaning we could have given it 4/5 rating. And although the surrounding location was a little suspect, we never felt unsafe at all. If we return to San Juan we will try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Princess perfect”
Reviews.Author: foodwriter007
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at the Coral Princess and absolutely recommend it. Close to the beach, food, and entertainment, also walking distance to Santruce where there are two Art Museums to visit. Also walking distance to Ocean park area (1.5) miles where there are a few nice places to dine and entertain.,The hotel is located in a safe area for sure, not once was I "a worried traveler" !! The staff was very very very helpful and full of suggestions on how to make my stay more enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast was perfect and more than enough to get you going for the day, with hard boiled eggs, ham, croissants, cereal, fruit, oatmeal, juice, toast, coffee, all was excellent. Very clean and comfortable rooms, small cable t.v., free internet (great signal), safe in the room as well as a desk. and parking for 4 cars in front, If that lot is full than you can either find street non metered parking or have 24 access in a paid lot for $13.00 a night, one block away. Jacuzzi tub and nice shower. I can not stress how nice the staff was, even before I arrived they would email me back with my questions answered immediately. I will ONLY stay here next time I go to Puerto Rico. Just email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel of the trip”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandGirl38
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights in Puerto Rico. We booked the Coral Princess for the first night based on the reviews here, but were staying flexible and booked our other rooms once we were in country. We really liked this hotel. The rooms weren't large but were clean with a comfortable bed. We felt safe there and well taken care of by the staff who gave us lots of travel tips. You can park in front of the hotel (limited spaces) or on the street for free. If there aren't spaces available there, there is a local parking garage that is $10 per night. The "continental" breakfast was great with slices of ham and cheese, boiled eggs, yogurt and fruit. The garden patio where it is served is very nice too. There were also cookies or fruit by the door in the am, encouraging you to take a snack. We didn't end up making use of the pool or hot tub but checked them out and they looked clean and like they would have been a nice place to spend time. There were many good places to eat in the downtown area where the hotel is located and you can take a bus to old San Juan for 75 cents. This is not a luxury hotel but was a great experience for the cost and location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: Malachi51
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a place to stay post cruise but had to cancel due to unforseen circumstances. I sent two emails to cancel three months prior to the booking but was still charged on my Visa. Despite being able to provide copies of these emails the hotel still refused to offer a refund.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Molly H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon and could not have been more disappointed. The service was non existent, the rooms very dirty, and the staff rude. Our plumbing broke down and we had diffuculty getting relocated while it was fixed. We even saw bugs in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Local "bed and breakfast" in a popular area”
Reviews.Author: supercat912
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in the Condado area, which has advantages and disadvantages. The area is very congested with narrow one way roads and limited parking. The hotel has four parking spaces that are designed for small cars, which are first come first serve, but there is a public gated parking lot about two blocks down that costs $13 a day (you just park, and then purchase a parking pass at the hotel). The benefit is that the hotel is only a block away from the beach, shops, several restaurants that are open late, and a casino. The interior of the hotel has almost a european feel, with very tall ceilings and marble tile floors. Most of the furniture is a dark wood, and there are colorful paintings and potted tropical plants throughout. We had a double bed room, which was just the right size for two people. The mattress was a little lumpy, but the linens were very comfortable. There was a whirlpool tub in the room, as well as a minifridge with reasonably priced drinks ($1 for sodas, a couple of dollars for beers, and $25 for a bottle of wine). You had to run the water in the sink for a while for it to get hot, but there was plenty of hot water in the shower. The wireless internet worked great, as well as the air conditioner which got very cold and took most of the humidity out of the room. There were no musty odors or anything of that nature. The complimentary breakfast had limited selection, but there was breads, pastries, yogurt, cereal, canned fruit, sliced cheese, packaged ham, waffles, and juice. The coffee was excellent. We didn't get a chance to experience the pools, but I read that there was a jacuzzi on the roof. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the place was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel in the middle of Condado”
Reviews.Author: RobertoCofresi
Reviews.Content: The small rooms are small, very small, but the price is much lower than the other brand name hotels, and you are near everything in Condado. Great if your attending a conference and don't want to pay the resort prices. Continental breakfast, but there are plenty of restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall. Some quirks to consider.”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a PR vacation where you will be spending the majority of your time away from the hotel, the Coral Princess is a very nice, clean, and classy-feeling place to hang your hat at night in between your day trips/excursions. If you're looking for a "deluxe" hotel experience where you'll be spending lots of time on the premesis, look elsewhere. Pros: Clean & classy- marble floors, etc (see promo photos). Rooms are very nice, but small. Staff was friendly and accommodating (our room was VERY small, we asked if there was anything bigger, and since it was off-season/not busy, they put us in the next size up and didn't charge us extra. Probably won't happen every time though) Free continental breakfast and free 24-hr juice & coffee machines. (don't expect all that much from the continental breakfast though) Good location, safe neighborhood, close enough to airport and Old San Juan. 24-hour Walgreens right around the corner. Cons: The "complimentary wireless internet" was a let down. Might have been a fluke, but none of the available networks had strong enough signals for us to connect to from the room. Staff said it was because of the weather, and we should just go to the common area where the routers are. Rooms are small- FYI if you book the "Double" (i.e. cheapest) room, the room itself is barely bigger than the bed. Maid service is great at cleaning the rooms, not so great at replacing/restocking things like soap, shampoo, etc. TVs in the room are pretty small Parking is interesting...there are 4 free spots at the hotel that are first come first serve. If those are full, there is a $13 per-24 hours lot within walking distance. Make sure to have the hotel validate your parking ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Perfect Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Viajera048
Reviews.Content: I am not a tourist in PR, and I fly there to visit my father- which means I am looking for a safe,clean, budget friendly place to stay during those trips. As usual I read plenty of reviews before making the decision to book 4 nights at Coral Princess. One of the reviewers mentioned that there were no dead bolts on the doors and his girlfriend had been afraid the first night. But since the property has a buzzer to let people in, I felt no major concern with the comment. Well, my room was on the 2nd floor between the stairs and an open door that gave access to a terrace. It made me feel a bit unsafe especially because mine was the only room on that portion of the wall. I went to sleep the first night and maybe 15 minutes later; my room door was suddenly opened from the outside. The only thing that held it from being ajar was the chain. I almost had a heart attackâ€¦I screamed!!The door was closed again from the outside and I jumped out of my bed, made myself a bit presentable and went to the front desk- literally SHAKING. The front desk clerk was a very young girl who said that it was her who opened the door by mistake. All she said was that she started sweating â€“ but no apology or acknowledgement from her part. I asked why she didnâ€™t say anything; at least an explanation / apology through the door would have made a big difference. As a frequent traveler, I take the time to sing praises to front desk staff that shines and makes a difference during my stay, but in this caseâ€¦I was dumbfounded. After the incident, I requested a room with more activity around it, and she gave me a room on the 1st floor, close to the main lobby entrance and it was an upgrade from my original room. But this experience showed me a lack of people skills to handle an unexpected situation and the need for more training for this particular staff member. The two other attendees were extremely professional, seasoned people who showed me the true character of Coral Princess during check in, inquiries and check out. Will I go back to Coral Princess? Not sure based on lack of dead bolts- since I always travel solo to PR. But if you want a property right in the middle of Condado, super clean, with breakfast and common areas to relax plus mini bar in every room, then give it a try. It is a well kept property with comfy beds but small rooms â€“keep in mind it is a boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: BelovedMoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coral Princess from Aug. 27th -Sept.5th 2011 with my parents, husband and 2 year old son. The hotel was small but cozy, our room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and attentive. In the wake of hurricane Irene the hotel was hit and had lost power but they had back up generators and that made a huge difference. The WiFi in each room was a huge plus and when we didn't have plans, Luis helped us coordinate a trip to El Yunque with a local tourism company. At that point I liked the hotel very much but I really appreciated it most when I lost my cell phone on the tour and called the front desk of the hotel to get the info of the company. Nicole sprung into action and contacted the company which she had to call back and forth but eventually she was able to get my phone back! Such excellent service and she went out of her way to help which was amazing. I recommend this hotel highly not so much because of the accommodations which were fine, but because of their exemplary staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Dre22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise. We really enjoyed the hotel and the staff. We stayed in the Penthouse Executive King. The room has a decent view, is very clean, and the bed is comfortable. The hotel is very close to the beach, restaurants, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: TAKS1234
Reviews.Content: We were nervous at first with this hotel since the entry way was not big, and we thought it smelled a little musty. We were greeted with wonderful staff that knew who we were and had everything ready for us to go check in. They were able to give us great recommendations on food and the beach. We went us to our rooms, they were simple but clean. The space they have is limited, but they have done such an amazing job making it look nice for their guests. There are gardens all over the property. We thought it was quiet, but that also could have been because we had the air conditioner running during the night. Their breakfast was amazing! We were expecting rolls and bad coffee. They had an amazing spread of rolls, meats cheeses, eggs, waffles, hot cocoa, espresso, coffee, lattes, fruit, cereal........It was great! The next morning, we left our bags with the staff in their office and came back hours later. They welcomed us back, let us use their restrooms-even though we had checked out, and called us a taxi. They were very friendly and very customer service oriented. No strange bills or additions to our bill that we weren't aware of. I would go back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Uaoh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Coral Princess one night before a cruise. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. The staff is great; our son and daughter-in-law arrived at 5am the day of the cruise and the staff made them comfortable until we awoke. The location is very good; many restaurants close by as well as the Atlantic seawall.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cokesjr24
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are not very large, it fit our trip needs perfectly. The staff was really friendly, we got free breakfast, the location was perfect. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Boricua51
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy access to everywhere, Walgreens 24hr nearby, beach, etc. Very nice continental breakfast in the mornings where you can gather with everyone or take to your room. On the 3rd fl if you like can cook anything you want with it's full kitchen. Love it and will return. If you're looking to escape from everything and have a quite atmosphere this is the place....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Alternative”
Reviews.Author: tdottony
Reviews.Content: Lovely alternative to traditional hotel. Cozy, immaculate and wonderful staff. On a residential street a short minute walk to the beach and restaurant strip. Hearty breakfast served in a green inspired outdoor space. Roof top hot tub and lounge area. Generally a quiet environment. For the (very) light sleepers do ask for a room away from the serving area and/or 1st floor. Not terribly loud, the passing traffic could bother some. Worth an upgrade to a larger room if space is a priority. I'll be back for sure given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BWood40
Reviews.Content: We got married in San Juan and chose the Coral Princess as our hotel of choice for ourselves and our guests. We absolutely made the right decision. If you ever have a problem, ask for Abe - he's awesome. We rented out almost the entire hotel for several nights, including all 3 penthouse suites. The hotel is in the perfect location in Condado in the middle of shops, restaurants and 1 block from the beach. The rooftop terrace has a hot tub and tons of seating. Breakfast every morning was free and filled us up. Rooms were nice, new, and clean. The pool isn't huge, but as I said, you're 1 block from the beach. You can't go wrong with the Coral Princess.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, great service, good value”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler8828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess for two nights prior to our cruise. The room we had had two double beds and was compact but comfortable with good air conditioning. The common areas of the hotel are great from the roof top deck to the breakfast area. The location is very convenient to restaurants and the beach and the front desk staff, particularly Abraham, were very helpful. While the pool is small, it was more than sufficient for our daughter to enjoy. The breakfast was simple but good and it was nice to have access to complimentary coffee and juice throughout the day. The complimentary wi-fi was also appreciated. This is the place you want to stay if you like small boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK for quick overnight”
Reviews.Author: Michele1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights before our cruise. On the upside very nice friendly staff, looked nice and clean, location central in Contado. However as they say you do get what you pay for, we had a very small room (king upgrade), no view, fairly noisy in the halls, breakfast so-so, pool too small. If you want a place to stay for the night this is would be ok, however if staying longer than pay the price and stay at one of the big hotels on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNonna
Reviews.Content: The building is charming, the rooms modern, comfortable and clean. There are inviting patio and rooftop areas where one can rest in the shade or sunbathe. The friendly and accommodating staff made us feel at home, attentive to our needs and cheerfully heeding requests. We enjoyed exploring the neighborhood restaurants and parks, having the beach within walking distance, and easy access to the bus to Old San Juan. Our attempts to obtain day passes (beach chair, umbrella, access to showers) from the large beachfront hotels were unsuccessful because it was such a busy time, but we were content with our small pool. It was a most relaxing week.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ash-in-NYC
Reviews.Content: I live in New York City and have been going to Puerto Rico since the 1960s. I have often stayed in private accomodations. I usually travel alone. I am more of a B & B person than a luxury hotel person, but I have stayed in modest inexpensive hotels as well as luxury ones (usually on guided tours). This hotel is everything the postive reviews say it is: Clean, comfortable, conveniently located and modestly priced. I had room #16 on the second floor for 5 days. I was pleased with everything at the hotel -- from the friendly staff to the nicely appointed accomodations. I like a nice breakfast and this hotel had one every day. One could have juice or coffee around the clock since the eating area is always opened. I was knocked out by the bathroom with the combination jacuzzi bath and shower (I like both when I can get them). The air conditioner was quiet and efficient. And the wifi was perfect for using my laptop. I am baffled by the few negative reviews I have read about this hotel. I guess you simply cannot please some people. It was Trip Advisor that made me choose this hotel. I am very happy that I did.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: suzptaylor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coral Princess for three days in March 2011. I was somewhat concerned about staying at the hotel because its website suggests that it caters to an adult clientele and I was bringing our 4 year son, so I was worried about a frosty reception. However, everyone was wonderful. Our room was quite large ( superior double bed) with a nice walk in closet and large bath with a jacuzzi tub. The hotel is within a few blocks of restaurants (fast food and nicer restaurants), a Walgreens, and a short walk to the beach. The morning breakfast was a modified continental breakfast (cold ham and cheese, fruit, cereal, toast, waffles) but was sufficient for our purposes. The hotel is in a nice part of town. There are only 4 parking spots, but we never had any problems with parking. On street parking is available as well as a pay per night lot. The hotel also had a lovely rooftop living area and jacuzzi and a small ground floor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pams33
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It's small and stylishly decorated. There are no crowds or lines of people at the front desk, breakfast area, pool or roof top hot tub. Its not on the beach but is just a block away. It has wifi in all rooms, a quiet reading room and a beautiful small garden/sitting area. Reasonably priced. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, small very noisy room”
Reviews.Author: johnny1175
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend was scared staying here the first night we were in town. The deadbolt on the door had been removed. Only a 15 dollar doorknob and pushbutton lock were on the door. The door had gaps around it that let in a substantial amount of light from the hallway. Everytime someone came inside the hotel the tile floors outside echoed loudly into the room. When other rooms on our floor shut their door, our door shook noisily. Placing a towel at the bottom of the door seemed to help some. It took my girlfriend several hours to get to sleep. We were both awoken by hallway and front door noise countless times throughout the night. There was a large hair in the bathroom, otherewise the room seemed adequately clean. The common areas were filthy, especially the tile floors where I saw the hugest hairball I've ever seen on the second floor landing. Most of the common furniture was very dirty. The room itself was small, approximately 12 feet by 10 feet without the bathroom. The hottub on the roof was filthy and the terrace to the third floor where the hottub was located was locked at night. The pool was very small. The hotel was located very close to the beach, walgreens, and numerous local restaurants and bars. It was hard to get a feel for the neighborhood. Some homes close by were nice and others were dilapidated. We saw no locals at night on Magdaleena in front of the hotel, and only a handful of tourists. The hotel had a very friendly staff, who were always smiling and courteous as you walked in the door. The outdoor garden patio area was a nice touch. My girlfriend loved the breakfast choices. Although it was not a true buffet, she was extremely excited to wake up and go down there to eat she liked it so much. If we had to do it over, we would have booked a room in advance at the Mariott. The Mariott was clean, had an excellent pool, and was not obnoxiously noisy like some of the places we visited in Isle Verde. The beach was directly out the back door off the pool area. We will not stay at the Coral Princess again. The door problems (no deadbolt, bad lock, no seal around the door whcih let in a lot of noise and light) are unacceptable in our standards, and led to a poor nights sleep. Its too bad, because the staff seemed genuinely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Condado”
Reviews.Author: DandNinSTL
Reviews.Content: First, a few (minor) caveats: This is not a "beach hotel" -- it is a very easy 2-block walk to Condado Beach, but it is not sitting right smack on the beach if that is what you are looking for. Our room (19) was not large, and does not have much of a "view", but it was very clean and pleasant. Mattress was on the firm side, not terrible. And the hotel only has 4 dedicated parking spaces, but we usually had no problem getting one, and there is street parking and a pay lot one easy block away that only charges $13 for 24 hours, with in/out privileges. Those minor things aside, we had a very pleasant stay at the Coral Princess. It is an attractive 3-story building located on a pleasant city street, one block from Ashford Avenue (the "main drag"), two blocks from the beach. It is in easy walking distance of countless restaurants of all types and price ranges (and, I assume, nightlife). (There is a Walgreens right around the corner for those forgotten items.) It has very quick and easy access to Hwy 26 (airport, Old San Juan, etc.). Again, the room is not large and does not have much view, but it was very clean and attractive, with nice artwork on the wall, etc. Big plus for me was the minibar with $2 Cerveza Medalla and $1 soda / bottled water (the $25 bottle of wine on the other hand is a bit pricier, but I don't think PR is exactly known as a wine capital...). The staff was friendly and attentive, someone was on duty / at the desk 24x7. They were always very helpful with directions, recommendations, etc. We had a slight problem with our ceiling fan that did take one reminder, at which time they fixed it quickly and were very apologetic about it. The third floor has a number of very spacious, nicely furnished "common rooms" including a kitchen and pool table, and there is a very cool roof deck with a huge wraparound sofa, assorted chairs, lounges, hot tub, etc., as well as a great view of the surrounding Condado skyline. There are also a number of attractive, shady patio areas scattered all around the hotel. The common rooms plus roof deck plus all of the patio areas could easily accommodate a party for well over a hundred people, even though there are only 20-25 rooms in the whole hotel...! Breakfast is included, buffet-style. Fairly standard fare -- nothing to write home about, but nothing to complain about either. But there is plenty of variety (ham / hard boiled eggs to cereal / yogurt), and certainly plenty of food -- you won't leave hungry. And it is served by one of the shady patio areas, so there are a lot of nice little places to sit and eat. There is a small pool / small pool area -- never had a chance to get in. Bottom line -- if you are looking for a nice, convenient boutique hotel in Condado, close to (but not right in the middle of) the "action", and don't care about being right on the sand, we think the Coral Princess is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL MARRED BY BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: phk123
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Marred by Bad Experience We had a wonderful week at the Coral Princess which was marred unfortunately by a bad experience. The positive attributes of the Coral Princess Hotel are numerous: The hotel is centrally located in the Condado area. It is a small, chic European style hotel with a rooftop garden area that is a wonderful and inviting refuge to lounge and read. The staff is exceptionally charming, friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very clean, well lighted and comfortable with properly working internet access. The hotel does have â€œfree parkingâ€� but there are only 4 spaces allotted for it on the hotel property which is directly in front of the hotel and off the street. It is a on a â€œfirst come, first servedâ€� basis, so if all 4 spaces are taken then you must find your own parking on the street or in a parking lot. Unfortunately our car was broken into while parked in one of the 4 free spaces directly in front of the hotel and its security camera. Our rental carâ€™s back rear passenger side window was smashed and the radio was stolen at approximately 530AM. The Police were called around 7am when this was discovered to file a report. I met with the Police as they filed the report and heard from the Police directly that several cars in the last few months have been broken into, in exactly the same way as our rental car had been, AND in the same small parking area provided by the hotel. The Police complained to me and the hotel staff that they are NEVER able to see the security cameraâ€™s tape recording of the previous nightâ€™s events as requested so that they could possible apprehend the person responsible. I pursued the issue of the security cameraâ€™s tape recording with the hotel staff over the next couple of days, hoping that there would be something on the camera to help the Police find the person or persons responsible for mine and previous break-ins and to eliminate future guests from the hassle of having their cars broken into. Ultimately I found out that the security camera is NOT working! Thus, my complaint about this hotel. The hotel bills itself as an upper-end property with free parking provided by the hotel. The staff and owners of the hotel are aware of theft and vandalism with cars parked on their hotel property. That their security camera is not working and available to the police is not acceptable by a property such as this. Especially since there is a repeated occurrence of break-ins according to the Police and actual hotel staff I spoke to. I lost a day of my vacation dealing with insurance issues and returning a damaged car for a new one, I would hope that the hotel would take this seriously for future guests and for the hotelâ€™s own reputation as a safe and reputable place to stay. From what the room rates charged are at this hotel, it should have a working security camera which is available to the Police if needed. Until their security issues are resolved I can not recommend this hotel, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Debbie154951
Reviews.Content: We would stay at the Corral Princess again and would recommend it to anybody. We had two stays in San Juan and after our first stay at the Corral Princess we cancelled our other reservation and stayed with them for the second stopover. The staff are extremely helpfull and friendly. The hotel is only a short walk to the beach but offer a pool for customer use if they don't want to get sand in their shoes. We had a later flight the day we left and stored our baggage for us, let us use the facilities for the afternoon and had a bathroom (with shower) available for our use before we left. It's like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Galit2010
Reviews.Content: Great location: A nice swimmable beach is only a couple of blocks away and we walked into Old San Juan. There was a Walgreens around the corner and lots of restaurants. It took about an hour but was a nice walk (should only do it in the daytime). The staff at the Colal Princess were very nice and helpful. The breakfast was a bit better than a typical continental. Nice Coffees and juices were available for free 24/7. Another nice touch was that the water and soda in the fridge in the room were only $1 which was very reasonable. The pool is small and not used much but nice for a refreshing dip. The hot tub was quite popular and the guests were friendly. The room was small and basic but had everything we needed. We took the bus back from the main bus terminal of Old San Juan that stopped very close to the hotel. It was mostly tourists who got on the bus. much cheaper than a cab.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel and a Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EABPE
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before choosing to vacation with my wife at the Coral Princess. I am happy to say the good reviews the Coral Princess has received on Trip Advisor are merited. We only found a few minor things to pick at: - Housekeeping was stingy with resupplying the facial and bath soap, but the front desk got us more when we asked - The bathtub was one of those vinyl-cushioned units, and the vinyl had cracked in spots - Our room's window looked out on the dumpster (we kept the curtains drawn) - We didn't find out about the rooftop jacuzzi until the day we checked out -- DANG! On total our stay was very pleasant. Having breakfast in the courtyard was especially nice. The bed was comfortable. The room was simple but modern and clean. The in-room mini-bar was even reasonably priced! The beach, shopping and restaurants were a short walk away. Buses to downtown stopped nearby, and taxis were everywhere. Both buses and taxis were clean, cheap and reliable. There's no need to rent a car unless you are going out of town. On total, a very good value. We would stay at the Coral Princess again, and we would recommend it to anyone except those who want a beachfront hotel or lavish accommodations. Next time we might splurge and try one of the three penthouse rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kdschafer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coral Princess Hotel only one night but tried to enjoy some of what they had to offer. I probably stayed in one of their smaller rooms and found it somewhat confining after staying in another hotel with a balcony. There are many places to sit and relax at the Coral Princess and I did take advantage of their hot tub on the roof. They also supply beer($2), wine($25), soda and water($1) in the room refrigerator for a reasonable price. They are a couple of blocks from the beach and there are many restaurants and other hotels, some with casinos in the vicinity. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “European charm, friendly staff, and good location”
Reviews.Author: joyous-gypsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, as my husband had business and we wanted to do some sightseeing in Puerto Rico. The Coral Princess was a perfect choice for our stay. Room was comfortable and clean with free Internet service. Breakfast was a nicely presented expanded continental buffet. Coffee and juice were available in the lounge around the clock. We did not use the pool, but it looked very inviting on a hot afternoon. The only suggestion for hosts would be to expand the free parking. There were a few spaces in front of the hotel, and if they were full, we were instructed to find on street parking or pay for a local lot. Location was great for walking through the neighborhood to good restaurants, and not too far from Old San Juan (walkable or short taxi ride).

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly, super location, super stay!”
Reviews.Author: raefarms
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the great staff at the Coral Princess! From the welcome when we arrived to the good-bye at our departure, the staff was fantastic. One evening the diamond fell out of my ring, into the sink and down the drain. At 10 PM the hotel maintenance man was called and he came within 10 minutes, took apart the pipes, and found my diamond! The rooms are on the small side but they are very clean ! The location is wonderful, close to a great public beach, many restaurants, and casinos. The morning breakfast was filling and the availability of juice and coffee at any time was appreciated! The rooftop deck and hot tub were a relaxing way to end the day. I would not hesitate to recommend the Coral Princess to any of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “The best part of the hotel is the common areas.”
Reviews.Author: premile
Reviews.Content: The wife and I were here for Xmas 2010 with inlaws. Positives: great value, common areas, jacuzzi, pool, free breakfast with hardboiled eggs, choice of cereal, fruit, good coffee, oatmeal, waffles, croissant, danish, wonderful and helpful staff, free wifi, fridge, good minibar prices, large balconies. Negatives: not on the beach, pool a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!!!......GREAT ROOMS...GREAT LOCATION...GREAT PRICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chriscruz08
Reviews.Content: There is only one word able to describe this hotel...and that is GREAT..... the location of the hotel is right in the middle of el Condado and is a walking distance from everything (except old san juan but its only like a 5 minute drive). The staff was great very friendly and really cared that you where comfortable and felt in paradise. The price is just right compared to the other hotels in the area which are basically right next to it. The rooms were very clean ...very organised and had a modern look. BED = Comfortable.. Only one thing that i have to say the was bad about this hotel is that since its so small, there are only 4 parking spots to park..... I got lucky and got a spot and didn't move the care the whole time i was there.... I just used public transportation which is easy to use and cheap.Love the hotel ...IM DEFINITELY GOING TO RETURN

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better!”
Reviews.Author: tripmom56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights/6 day in San Juan. Absolutely loved the Coral Pricess! It is in the Candado neighborhood. The rooms are clean and more than adequate. Yes, they are smaller than the standard hotel room, but this is a 70 year old facility. If you are a single female this is a great, safe place. You do have to buzz at the door and they let you in.. Our room was large enough that we had a double bed, desk, small table and chairs and wine cooler/refrigerator. Soda and water were a dollar. The wine was twenty five. We went to Wallgreens around the conner and got a 24 pack of water for $3.99. Plent of room left for leftovers or whatever. Bed was comfy. Bathroom was spotless and had a small whirlpool tub. Yes the water pressure and temperature do vary at times, but that was no big deal. They do change out your towels daily. They do not change your sheets daily, but do you do that at home? If you ask I am sure they would do that. Our safe did not work and they were kind enough to bring us another one that did work. Do not believe that breakfast is "meager". It is not. They had croissants, pastries, bread for toast, waffles, fruit, cheese, ham, yogurt, boiled eggs and cereal. The coffee/espresso/hot chocolate machine was wonderful. So were the juices. The pool is about 12 x 25 and great after a hot day. It is in the shade in the afternoon which is so nice after a day of activities to come back and relax in comfortable water in the shade. You will need beach towels. These are not provided. If you forget them, Wallgreens had beach towels at a reasonable price.(prices at Walllgreens are comprable to the home they have everything you could ever want and are open 24/7).) Rooftop lounge area is really nice with the hottub. The beach is a short walk. You can take the bus to other beaches. All are public beaches-even at the hotels.At some you can rent chairs and umbrellas. Ocean Park at Isla Verde is a family beach with jet-skis, para surf boards and wind surfing for rent. Good roadside hot dog/ smoothie vendors as well. You can leave your books there in the reading room if you don't want to tote them home. We took used paper backs and left them. There is a washer and dryer as well. Two dollars to wash and two to dry. Pack half of what you think you will need.The hotel staff was most accommadating and can give you directions to where you want to go. We went to the Marcado on Saturday night, about a 6 block walk (even had to go under I 26 and it was well lit and safe) to see what the residents do to relax. Lots of music and families If you stay out of where you don't belong, you will be fine. Ashford Ave is blocked off on Saturday and Sunday evenings for a food/drink/music fest. Fun to go and wander around.Food prices can be expensive if you add in alcohol.Do try the mom and pop restaurants and try mofongo. Car rental is good at Charlie's (across from the marriott)Recommend that you buy the insurance so you don't have to mess with a mess when you get hit or hit someone. Turn signals are an option and driving is a real trip.Plan to leave the city when thre is the least traffic. We had no problems. Rental for a day was $25.00. Go to the rain forest. A word of caution:do not take small children to the La Mina falls. While it is beautiful and the water is refreshing, you are hiking nearly a mile down a mountain and then a mile back up. Your child will be worn out and you don' want to carry them.Wear sensible shoes and take a pair of aqua socks or sandals for the rocks. Old San Juan is fun as well. The forts are great and the shopping is fun. You can't see it all on one trip. After staying here we will be back. It is the best boutique hotel we have stayed at and we have been coming to the the Carribean for 25 years. Clean, safe, peaceful and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, fair service - not much more”
Reviews.Author: katiec925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay for a week for our honeymoon at the Coral Princess. Originally we booked a resort in the same neighborhood Condado. We switched our reservation to the Coral Princess because of the better price and same location, so we could put our money towards activities like ziplining and snorkeling. The location was good - quick walk to restaurants, Walgreens, the resorts with the casinos, and Condado Beach. Only 4 parking spots for hotel guests for free. Otherwise, we had to park down a little more than a block away for $13 a day. The room was very small compared to other hotels at which we have stayed. It was difficult to unpack our suitcases into the closet without bumping into the stand-up clothing steamer that was ineffective. An iron would have worked better and taken up less room space. However, the hotel and our individual room was very clean and had new furniture and fixtures, flat screen TV, large window, etc. The pool was small as another person commented, but clean and good for cooling down. The front desk staff was average. They were fairly welcoming, and gave us directions on how to get around PR and where to eat. However, one night we were looking for a moderately priced restaurant within walking distance from the hotel and they recommended Miro. Miro was just average, probably would not go back if in San Juan again. They had 2 for 1 drink specials and live music. My meal was good, nothing wrong with it, but not spectacular. My husband's meal was inedible. He ordered a steak and what he got was a flame broiled piece of solid fat. The front desk staff also recommended a restaurant called Marmalade in Old San Juan which was very good - fancy, small portions, contemporary decor, overpriced - but that was kind of what we were looking for that night - to splurge. Overall, if we returned to San Juan we would definitely research other hotels than the Coral Princess. But you can't go wrong with the good price in an area with a lot to do.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Maxim
Reviews.Content: I often have to overnight in San Juan and until now had never found a hotel that I felt was comfortable and reasonably priced. I really loved my room - great bed, interesting touches and very clean and quiet. It had everything I needed and this hotel is one I will most definitely stay at again. The receptionist, Emmy, who greeted me so warmly was excellent at her job and treated me as a true guest.

Reviews.Title: “OUR PARADISE IN PR”
Reviews.Author: Dinah032
Reviews.Content: My Husband Discovered The Coral Princess After Much Research Online In 2004 Since Then We Have Returned 4 Times. We Call It Our Paradise In Puerto Rico.. The Staff Is Friendly And Welcoming, We Always Request The Same Room #2 It Has a Great Flat Screen TV And The Bed Is Extremely Comfortable, I Love The Pool And The Walkway In The Back Is Beautiful, The Breakfast Buffet Is Generouse And There Is Unlimited Coffee,Expresso,Latte And Cappicino And A Array Of Fruit Juice..We Will Return Next Year...

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must!”
Reviews.Author: Ginuzza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a cruise and sailed out of Puerto Rico. We arrived the day before and wanted a clean hotel with breakfast included and not far from the Pier. This hotel is a lovly small hotel but the service, the affordable price including a free buffet breakfast (the best coffee in town is really true), the location (3 minute walk to the beach and close to many restaurants and pharmacy...) makes it an absolute must. In fact, we also stayed 2 nights post cruise. Because I wanted on the beach, I opted for the Courtyard Marriott (almost double the price, no breakfast and not clean at all), which we terribly regretted. We are thinking of returning to Puerto Rico for another cruise next year, and we will definitely stay at the Coral Princess for all the above reasons. It is really a must try - believe this italian who's standards are quite high. You will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “An experience of paradise in a hotel form”
Reviews.Author: Mona1404
Reviews.Content: As I entered the picturesque lobby, with a table filled with cookies, I was immediately set at ease. The terrace, the courtyard and the pool area created a sense of old world charm in the midst of an otherwise inadequate neighborhood. The pool itself is private enough for a romantic night-time swim with a perfect view of the sky and stars. The staff were friendly and helpful, allowing my fiancee and I to linger a bit longer on the terrace after check-out. This is honestly one of the best hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: arq2006
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this place. I didnt want to spend huge amounts of money for a small room at a big hotel. This place is situated close to the beach and all of the casinos. It is also a short cab ride from the night clubs of the old city. Some people i meet and talked to were afraid of the area at night but to be honest if you're the type of person who isn't afraid of locals or your own shadow you'll be fine. The last night they booked all up and only had a sweet left. Me and my roommate got our own beds with a huge tv and AC. The tube was a jacuzzi and we had 24 hour access to the outdoor patio with a jacuzzi. It also came with a pool table and a kitchen with a fridge. Loved this place. The guy who was at the desk was really cool and gave us some vouchers for the casino. I am definitly coming back here. The typical crowd was in their late 50's or older and from Europe but it made it even better since they went to sleep early and we had the pool or jacuzzi to ourselves and the friends and people we brought back. That is one draw back in that we could only bring a few people back. Good experience and great time.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere else...”
Reviews.Author: manalive53715
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few Condado hotels that suffers from a PR sense of service. In other words, they don't have much. They also lied about parking, avoided me for an hour (would have been longer), and in the end refused to fix it - even for $13 measly dollars. No integrity.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Get Away”
Reviews.Author: JotanJotan
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying I read all of the reviews and researched for just the right location. I must say, the reviews lead me to the right place! The moment we walked into the Coral Princess, there were smiles. There were smiles the entire time! The front desk was so helpful. The breakfast was adequate, standard fare, Hard Boiled eggs, toast, waffles, free flowing juices at all times. Cereal, fruit, ham and cheese to make a croissant sandwich. Pretty filling. The neighborhood, was a mix of condos, houses, Don't take the prepaid tours. We took the bus B21 or( C53 )which lets you off right in front of the hotel. Bus Fare is .75 cents, it will take you to the Ferry. The Ferry is .50 which will take you the Bacardi Plant, from there, there were several taxis waiting. It was $3 to the Bacardi Plant Tour. Which is free, and you get 2 drink tickets The tour was great!! We went back the next day to do the tour of the Ponce Fort and found a great Tapas reactant in old San Juan, which is just BEAUTIFUL!!! If you go, to eat, check out D'Bar! They serve GREAT Mofongo, my boyfriend had with Crab and they were very reasonable prices, Walk the picturesque streets of old San Juan. And added, special surprise. The front desk brought up a romantic plate of Strawberries and chocolate cookies twice. I was so surprised. Its just something they do. We were a block from the beach. Don't rent a car!! Driving there is crazy!! We have a Walgrens right around the corner, and several stores and hip restaurants/social gathering sports. Condado is a GREAT place to stay for your first visit, such as ours. Now the down side, I read the taxi trip from the airport should be no more than $15 and first bags are free. NOT TRUE! The jack you at the airport. They charge by zones. It was $18 and $1 for each bag, which we had one each. Cheaper to go back. But we met a wonderful couple who were leaving the same time we were, and they had a friend who offered to drop us for free as well. This was a wonderful wonderful vacation. I cannot wait to go back, and we will stay at the Coral Princes again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Proposition!”
Reviews.Author: Mayabue
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, pleasant; the rooms were spacious and included a stand up steamer. The service was helpful and pleasant. Very centrally located between Condado and Ocean Park. Quick access to the highway. Lots of good dining establishments walking distance and a 24 hour Walgreens around the corner. Only 2 blocks from the beach. This is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TemsyMcTemser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess In for six nights and found it to be quite enjoyable. We chose this boutique hotel after finding the larger resort hotels to be riddled with hidden fees. A quick call to the coral princess inn established that the price on their online reservation system (very convenient) was the only thing we'd pay, minus mini-bar, etc. It's located only about a block form the beach and around the corner from a very convenient Walgreens. It was only VERY brief walk to the main area of Condado, and taxis and buses were in easy reach to enter Old San Juan. Rooms were well furnished, though not especially large. Our room was one of the cheaper ones, but included a queen sized bed, tv with cable (and English channels), spacious mini bar with plenty of room to store your own food, a small breakfast table for two, and a nice bathroom (with jacuzzi jets). Mini bar was well stocked and inexpensive. We were also provided with a few free snacks. Wi-Fi in the rooms was not that great, but public patios and reading rooms had a relatively consistent signal. There was a complimentary continental breakfast with a selections of pastries, Eggo waffles, toast, cheese, ham, fruit, yogurt and juice. There was a small but nice wading pool (not especially necessary given proximity to the beach). Hotel service was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, updated, great amenities, good alternative to typical chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: richellej
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I wouldn't call it a bed and breakfast, but more of a small, boutique hotel. Our room was a bit small, but very clean with simple, modern style. The boutique's common areas were great. Lots of open air corridors, terraces, and patios, lots of beautiful tropical plants. The rooftop suite is accessible to all guests, with a full kitchen, balcony, rooftop hottub, fabulous. The service was great. The front desk, very helpful, good tips. The day of checkout, they let us keep our bags in a secure room while we went to the beach before our flight. They then let us use the penthouse suite bathroom to shower before our flight. I have to say that the area surrounding the hotel was lacking. There were quite a few restaurants, but not much nightlife in the area, walking distance anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking in Condado, good breakfast, pool!”
Reviews.Author: lmeuk
Reviews.Content: Not cheap (but cheaper than most), very well located with some parking space available. Good help-yourself breakfast, all coffee/juice machine open all day/night. Welcome swimming pool after a hot day. Nice rooms. Nice staff. Would go back!

Reviews.Title: “THEY GAVE US A ROOM ALREADY TAKEN”
Reviews.Author: Mocabeach
Reviews.Content: They gave us room #21. When we opened the door, we saw luggage, clothes and shoes on the floor and people talking. We ran to the front desk. They had given our room to another couple. It was embarrassing! The room was nice and clean, we slept well. The continental breakfast was okay. The lady at the breakfast counter didn't even say good morning. Customer service overall sucks! If you don't care about cust serv and a cheap breakfast, then this is the place for you.... Parking place is within walking distance, however, we were afraid of being robbed....

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: jake53-13
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT EMPLOYEES/great location/extremely friendly employees/ /continental breakfast was great,VERY very nice setting/one outstanding employee is abraham , is a gentleman -will be coming back again/thank you on behalf of my wife an inlaws, always JAY

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in fun neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DallasLobster
Reviews.Content: Loved the personalized service at the Coral Princess Inn. Everyone at the front desk was happy to provide recommendations, suggestions and extra service as needed. The Inn is in the Condado neighborhood, just blocks away from the beach and a variety of terrific restaurants, including Budatai, Ajili Mojili, Miro's and Yerba Buena. While the building is old, the interior and rooms are updated with comfortable contemporary furnishings and art. There's a charming patio area filled with tropical plants and flowers. There's some noise from the street at night, but you would experience that at any small hotel in the area. We stayed here prior to leaving for a cruise and had planned to stay at a large chain hotel in San Juan after the cruise, but we liked Coral Princess so much we changed our reservation and spent two more days at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “rotten service”
Reviews.Author: goldengateAustralia
Reviews.Content: No water available for showers then no service from staff who could not help - absolutely disgraceful. Three other couples also had the same problems and were treated as liars!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of rooms that have deferred maintenance!”
Reviews.Author: maydo16
Reviews.Content: I was excited about this small hotel as my dauughter was getting married at the La Concha and this location was close by and less expensive. However, we noticed that the strawberries left for us on our first night were still on the table the next day even after a couple of bites were taken out of them from the night before! Also, our used coffee cups remained in the room after cleaning as well. (Room #25) We were disappointed upon arrival to find a very large crack in our tub. It was peeling and soft so that you could not take a bath and had to be careful where you stepped. I told the manager about this after the first day, and they sent a maintenance man to repair it in the middle of the next afternoon. This was not fun to walk into as I had wanted to take a nap and couldn't. I had to resort to using my brother's room to shower and get ready for the evening. It was also disturbing to walk up to my room with the windows wide open and no one inside. Evidently they left it that way to help with the smell, but anything could have been taken from the room by a passerby. My computer was sitting out in plain view along with some jewelry. I asked the manager for some compensation since I could not use my room for 1/2 day, but instead they offered me a free night on my next visit. I wrote back to tell them I had no plans to return to Puerto Rico, but I have heard nothing again from them. I am in property management and this is something that should have been taken care of before our arrival. $200 a night and not being able to stay in your room for the afternoon is unacceptable in my book. I would not return to the Coral Princess even if I ever did return to PR!

Reviews.Title: “Le Creme of Le Creme”
Reviews.Author: jsal83
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is truly one of the absolute best places to stay. Weather you are staying for business or for pleasure this hotel meets all standards. The Coral Princess is a small private hotel with 3 floors. from it's supurb staff to it's amazing accomidations and artwork throuout the hotel and inside the rooms, this hotel truly left no loophole for me to say one negative thing about them. I arrived in san Juan on the 18th of February with my best frnd at 10pm. We made reservations to stay at the San Juan Beach Hotel on Ashford Ave. in Condado three months prior to our arrival. Once we reached our hotel destination, to our great suprise, the hotel was oversold and took 2 hours to accomodate us in a room. Once we got into our room, it was an insult to any human's nature. from the rust covered lamp shades to the rusted and moldy ceiling, no towels, blood stained sheets, exposed wires, etc, etc. this place was not up to parr for any guest. We checked out the following morning and had to look for another hotel to stay for our remaining 4 nights. After calling almost every hotel in the area from the least expensive to the most expensive, they were all sold out. Right when we thought, we had hit rock bottom, a very nice cab driver dropped us off in front of the Coral Princess and stated that she heard this was a very nice place and because it was a smaller hotel they might have something available. We walked in with desperate faces and were greeted by the Hotel Manager Emmie, Emmie was our vacation hero, she had one room left on the executive floor which contains a jacuzzi, amazing executive lobby and out door veranda to mention the least. The only downfall was, that they too were fully booked for that sunday. She had 3 out of the 4 night available, She was extremely helpful, attentive and truly showed concern for our unfortunate situation. We ended up booking the room and hoping for the best to happen on sunday. To our relief, a room became available on that sunday and it all worked out great!. Overall, My experience at the Coral Princess exceeded my expectations. The price is right, supurb customer service, the hotel is very clean, the rooms are very comfortable, premium quality beds and bedding, Beautifully decorated, conveniently located in the heart of Condado, outdoor pool, complimentary delicious continental breakfast, etc, etc. and the icing on the cake is the extremely attentive, personable, friendly and just plain ol amazing staff. These people have created one of the best team i have ever experienced. I give this hotel 6 out of 5 stars. I will only stay at the Coral princess for all of my visits to san juan, given that i am there 4-6 times a year. *YOU MUST STAY HERE* Please excuse any typos, I am doing this as well as a million other things. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Very Quaint”
Reviews.Author: TainoZam
Reviews.Content: The staff there are VERY helpful and greet anyone coming in the door with a warm smile making any guest coming in feel, immediately, welcomed. Great location, as it's half a block from great dining and a short 10 minute walk from the beach. The on-sight pool was a delight for a casual dip during the day or night. Grab a brochure of things to do that's in the lobby and plan your trip out. My friend and I took this route and in a weeks time, walked through Old San Juan, visited "El Yunque", did some shopping at "Mall de la Americas" and kayaked through the luminescent lagoon with the same tourist company. They'll provide transportation to and from the hotel. The room was clean and cozy and had all the amenities my friend and I needed for the week long trip. About the only negative thing I can say is that if we went out for a morning walk and the room was cleaned, we'd return to find that the floor was still wet from the mopping. Other than that, 2 thumbs up on every other aspect.

Reviews.Title: “nice area, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: whit7
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights. sunday night jazz concert in a park was great. many nice restaurants in condado and close to old san juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Price, Great Manager”
Reviews.Author: usually_happy64
Reviews.Content: We were at the Coral Princess two years ago and returned this year. Obviously we liked it. This time I reserved a room with a king size bed and they upgraded us to a â€œpenthouseâ€� room. It was roomy and had a large enough for two whirl pool. Over all we were as pleased as we were then, with the area, the maintenance of the hotel and the value. Last time we were surprised that there was no fresh fruit for the continental breakfast. This remains true, which is hard to understand since the island has plenty of fresh fruit! They also serve baked goods from Costco and, while they are good, there are lots of great bakeries in Puerto Rico and it would be nice to get something more local. This year we had the pleasure of meeting Emmy, the manager. She was great, full of information, enthusiasm and suggestions to make our trip more enjoyable. Unfortunately, unlike last time, the other staff was not as accommodating. They always did what was requested but rarely offered eye contact and any helpful suggestions. They did not even know bus routes. Fortunately we were pretty independent because of the information we did get the last time. Still, the room offers a good value and is a nice alternative to a mega hotel or a tiny B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Clean-Friendly-Personality”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisJonen
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Coral Princess was perfect ! Our room was clean, comfortable and had personal touches that made you feel you were home and not in a large overpriced hotel. The outside breakfast sitting area was quaint and the food excellant. The staff is so friendly and helpful with anything you need, and stores any luggage until your flight home for you. Lots to do within walking distance (the beach, shopping, restaurants,parks and even Casino's if you want. We highly recommend choosing this quaint hotel for you stay while in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: travel920
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Coral Princess. Styed 2 nights after our Cruise ended. We were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was excellent, helpful and friendly. Very nice area. Felt safe walking at night. Close to bars, restaurants, casinos. Wendyâ€™s is around the corner. This will be the slowest Wendyâ€™s you ever go to â€“ but hey, I was on vacation so what did I care. A taxi to just about anywhere is $15-$20. However if you are patient you can take the bus for $0.75. A taxi is very easy to find. The front desk staff is more than helpful in calling one for you. Make sure you find the 3rd floor area â€“ great sitting area, hot tub on roof. Pool is on the lower level. Both very clean. They close early, probably due to the rooms being so close to them. Breakfast wasnâ€™t much â€“ but it was free. When we go back to San Juan we will stay at the Coral Princess Hotel. It has a nice bed and breakfast feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Comicguide1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn in October. The Inn is a small B&B with three levels, a pool and a hot tub. The Inn is four blocks away from the ocean and the main street where the restaurants and stores are located. We had a small room on the first floor overlooking the small pool. The breakfast consisted of fruit, boiled eggs, several kinds of breads and rolls, and sliced meat. All fresh. There was a make your own coffee and cappuccino machine. We found the Front Desk Team (Palmira and Nicole) to be very helpful with information about restaurants and attractions, and very friendly. We liked the evening treats delivered to the room like small fruit platters and cookies. We were there when a fuel storage facility exploded on the island and smoke could be seen for miles. The manager, Emmy, sent a letter to every guest explaining the situation, and keeping us informed. Do not hesistate to book your next stay at The Coral Princess Inn!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have had it better”
Reviews.Author: hbeale
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay on a budget. Very comfortable, pretty, small, place with excellent helpful staff and good continental breakfast. Did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: moniq123
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this hotel while looking for a place to stay in San Juan. We decided to pop in and inquire about rates and availability. Abraham was extremely helpful in accommodating our last minute reservation. They had a lovely room for under $150. There was a mini-bar too. After check-in we immediately paid a visit to the rooftop hot tub. Lovely! The free continental breakfast in the morning is included as well. There's also a drop off of strawberries and crackers on the night prior to checkout. That's a nice touch as well. The hotel is about a block away from everything including the beach. The staff was very helpful and I would definitely recommend this property for anyone wanting to stay in the Condado area!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value but:”
Reviews.Author: peatman
