Reviews.Content: We booked the Coral Princess after our Travel Agent met the owners at a London trade show. The hotel is in the middle of a busy area and has had a refub recently. The staff are great, friendly, helpful and oblidging but you cant but help feel its over priced for what it is. We were given room 2 which is a windowless cell. Okay there was a small window that looked onto an internal staircase but there was no external view. the bed was a standard size 4Ft 6". the bathroom had a very swish glass sink on a pedestal but nowhere to put your tooth brush. We met an American lady who had refused the room. We tried but the place was full. Our friends were given room one opposite that was fine AND they had a king sized bed. The corridor that runs the length of the groundfloor gives a clue that this used to be a big house that has been divided up. Its very narrow. Buffet breakfast was good. Lots of choice and fresh. The pool is no more than a plunge pool, the roof top terrace is only available when the apartment isnt being used and it isnt raining. There are lots of plants in pots around the place which give it a nice feel. I suppose the review is slightly tempered by the weather which was awful. The staff were fine, they even agreed to look after our luggage when we returned from the cruise we had booked until our onward flight was due at no cost Compared to the hotel on St Lucia, the Coral Princess seemed over priced but I suppose thats what you get for being in the middle of the cruise ship capital. Oh and before I forget, dont wear trainers or shoes with smooth soles in the old town. the streets are cobbled and slippery in the wet. I fell and am still suffering even with a well padded backside.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness - Very clean, with hard working, efficient housekeepers. Location - Close to beach, restaurants, casinos, Starbucks, etc. Rooms - On the small side, as was the bed and TV Service - Afternoon, evening, and night front desk personnel were lovely - contrasted with the morning/day staff who had absolutely NO customer service inclination...if I were the owner, I would fire them immediately because they have no interest in providing service. Value - Fair Breakfast - Fruit always gone by the time I arrived. Preferred to eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint. Great alternative to big hotels.”
Reviews.Author: travelerjones
Reviews.Content: Great alternative to big hotels. Quaint and small, not overwhelming. Quiet, easy stay. Quiet, clean, beautful landscape and gardens on property. Comfortable, roomy room - no frills. I like the open-ness in the hallways that leads to the pretty gardens outside. Very relaxing out there. Pool is ok but who cares when you can walk to the beach?! Stayed here summer of 07 with reasonable rates. Seems the rates have went up. I'd definitely return if I got a good rate. If not, I will try the other top rated San Juan B&B's on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: NeilSimpson
Reviews.Content: Great location, reasonable prices, clean rooms. The roof top hot tube was a let down, but the ease of the location and the great staff made up for that. Parking is tough, only four spots available. All in all, not much to gripe about. Solid stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for before or after cruise”
Reviews.Author: je4son
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Coral Princess after my cruise and another place before. Coral Princess wins, hands down. First, quiet, with no road noise. Second, clean, comfortable room. Third: location. It is about the same distance between my cruise ship room and the bow of the boat as it is from my rome at the Coral Princess and the beach, where you can rent $3 lounge chairs on the beach.and enjoy drinks from the Marriott. Condado restaurants and shops are all around. Also, I took advantage of the local Walgreens for some necessaries and a cheap beach towel. (4) Nice outdoor area: covered with fans so it was pleasant while I worked, even during midday. (5) FREE internet. (6) I was pleasantly surprised to find a plate of cheese, grapes and pretzels on Monday, (6) Friendly staff; happy to lend their computer to print boarding pass. (7) Free food, coffee and juice in the morning. In fact, the juice and coffee was available later, too. Great value for before or after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but charmless and expensive”
Reviews.Author: myosotis
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are the location, very close to the local amenities, the cleanliness, and the fact that it was a small building, not an eyesore tower on the beach. Also, there is free wifi in every room, which is nice, except that the signal was coming and going. Our room was very clean, the bed was small but comfortable. Overall our room was pretty cramped, albeit clean and functional it lacked any charm or character. The same was true for the common areas. Functional, clean, but pretty cold and completely charmless. The staff was efficient, but not particularly kind. Breakfast was ok if you are not a big morning eater. Considering the size of our room and the service I would say this hotel is definitely overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST AMAZING HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: leiinyleiin
Reviews.Content: OMG , when i planned my trip to puerto rico i was suppose to stay with family with my friend and somthing came up and we had to look for a last minute hotel , and we searched many hotel prices and viewed alot also finally we came across the coral princes inn and we thought the prices were reasonable and the hotel looked nice , we loved it a taxi from the air port was only 16 dollars and the hotel staff were one of the most amazing people i've ever dealt with , its clean and home like feeling they helped my friend and i get to places on the bus and btw the bus is only 75 cents ! thanks to them we got to enjoy our trip and save money as well , im planning a trip back to pr with my husband and kids and i know exactly where i am staying !

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want..”
Reviews.Author: svilhelmsen
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to PR. We plan to return often. The people were so nice. I was never afraid, and I would walk back/forth to the casinos at all hours. This hotel could not have been better for us. However, some people may find the rooms a little small, and the parking is sparse and it is two blocks to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: GeeGee49
Reviews.Content: The breakfast and 24 hour coffee and juice bar is what attracted us at first. Our room was small but had TV, refrigerator and very clean. The bed was soft and we like a firmer mattress, but for the price, the patio with the palms to relax in we will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we Needed”
Reviews.Author: snickerseg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for a few days before a cruise. The room was very small but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom (and the room) was very clean. It was super hot while we were there so we can report that the in-room air conditioning was in good working order. You can easily make your room into a freezer if you so desire. We enjoyed the small pool very much though it is definitely small. The lounge chairs are configured oddly to fit around the pool but we were lucky and had the whole pool to ourselves. This hotel has wonderful common areas including a library and small eating area where they serve continental breakfast. It was remarkable that, no matter what time of day you wandered this hotel, someone was cleaning something... pools, plants, kitchen, laundry... one day they even painted the stairway. The attention to upkeep was unbelievable, this was a really clean place. The staff was also very helpful. We asked how to get to old San Juan and the taught us how to get there by bus which was either free or just a small fare (maybe $1 each?) which saved us a lot of money in cab fare. Also we asked where to eat local food and they referred us to a great restaurant down the street. There is some shopping, including a drug store, and beach access nearby the hotel but the area seemed a bit sketchy... some stores "buzzed you in" even during the day, so we tried not to go there after dark. The beach had a similar vibe.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LittleUkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights but wished it were longer. This place has so many tiny touches from the cool marble floors to floor to ceiling closet space, oh my! A pool table w/kitchenette and balcony. A few different common area with quiet little spots to read, kick-back & relax. Enjoyed the plants and listening to the birds sing.Tip* start the hot tub early, takes a while to warm up. Beach 2 blocks away. Great food w/i walking distance. Breakfast: muffins, pasteries & such was filling and the coffee was to die for...trust me on the coffee- it was excellent! It's all in the details. Th owner must LOVE this place because it certainly shows. Overall, It was a pleasant surprise. 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “For a leisure stay, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: fant-o-sea
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms for 4 couples for 3 nights prior to a cruise after a lot of Internet comparison searching and couldn't have been happier with our decision. - clean rooms, delightful and very helpful staff, packed with little surprises (hot tub, pool, rec room, very complete free breakfasts, two block walk to the beach, convenient city bus stop locations, nearby quality restaurants and on and on) and all at a reasonable price. Thank you Tripadvisor for your website. We would otherwise have probably been stuck with a big name, less fun, more expensive choice. PS. Take a cab from the airport. Don't even think about driving around San Juan and Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel w/convenient access to beach & Condado”
Reviews.Author: aeackerm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a week and out expectations were exceeded by this recently updated boutique hotel- 3 blocks to beach access by the Marriott resort, 2 blocks to a 24hr Walgreens, and Condado beach resorts, shopping, restaurants, etc in both directions on the street. As 2 20-something girls, we felt very safe at the hotel and walking at night in the surrounding Condado area. Most of the guests were young couples with a few young families- quiet area & AC units in rooms. There is a common area "penthouse level" with kitchen, pool table, tv, couches, and rooftop hot tub which we always had to ourselves. Although there are only 4 parking spots out front, we drove down Ashford a bit and were always able to find free on-street parking, you'll get some practice fine tuning your parallel parking skills! There's really not much to do within walking distance besides lay on the beach or become EXTREMELY frusturated by the local buses- you need a rental car if you plan on doing san juan right. beach towels, wifi, 24hr juice & espresso machine were nice bonuses- although the pool is small, we had no problem sneaking into surrounding resorts and using theirs

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a short stayover”
Reviews.Author: IrelandKilkennycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night post cruise with 1 double room and a room with 2 beds, Very nicely laid out with areas to sit and outdoor area for simple breskfast, Rates were reasonable and close walk to the beach for which we were offered towels which was a bonus, Enjoyed a lovely swim at the beach which would not be too safe for small children as quite big waves. Staff helpful with directions etc. Taxi to airport was â‚¬23 for the 4 of us with bags so not too bad. One problem with room 23 was the noise of the air conditioning unit which made a lot of noise through the night, whereas room12 had a very quiet machine. the staff did offer room 24 but still noisy enough. Otherwise a great budget hotel with good location and Old San Juan is well worth a visit,

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...Coral princess rules!”
Reviews.Author: Adam_Laura07
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just returned from our short stay in San Juan. We were very happy with the hotel, staff and ammenities. Nice room, comfortable bed and good bathroom. The hotel has both a rooftop area with a jacuzzi and a pool on the ground floor. The location of this hotel worked out to be extremelly convenient, being in Condado and very close to the highway. Our only inconvenience was the parking situation since they only had 4 spots which oftentimes were all occupeid. Aside from that, we would certainly recommend this hotel to others and return on another occasion.

Reviews.Title: “These people are dishonest- don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: unhappyontrip
Reviews.Content: This company is dishonest. We stayed at the hotel for two nights and cancelled a third night. We checked when we registered to make sure the third night was cancelled and were told it was. Then they charged our credit card. They have refused to issue a credit, even though the whole process is documented. DON'T STAY HERE. CHOOSE ANOTHER PLACE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but beware of hidden charges.”
Reviews.Author: 2litg8rs
Reviews.Content: The Coral Princess is a clean hotel. But, the staff was not helpful and they charged me hidden fees on checkout. They refused to waive them and I could not dispute them with my credit card because the Inn classified them as "operational expenses." Also, the Inn is not conveniently located to very many places. If you do stay here, beware of hidden charges and don't stay for more than 1-2 days because you will quickly become bored with the area.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny, Sensual, Sexy San Juan”
Reviews.Author: playaguya
Reviews.Content: I don't know the state of your relationships, but if they're healthy, a stay at the Coral Princess should only make them better. What a fine place! So clean, such a great vibe...We've stayed in a lot of cool spots, but this one is right up there with the rest. For starters, the staff is superb and could not have been more helpful. When the rental car agency couldn't come and pick us up at the hotel, we were driven there. When we had trouble printing our boarding passes, they made sure we got it done. Etc, etc. There are many pockets of open-air gathering spots sprinkled through the hotel, which we loved. There were chairs, coffee tables and a loveseat in one such spot right outside our room (#24), where we would go for at least part of every night to watch the moon and stars, drink some wine, and talk. There is also a rooftop patio, with lots of chairs and a hot tub. We liked that too, and of course it also added to the romance of the stay. Same for the garden breakfast area. Open-air, a lot of plants and color, some sunshine...a nice way to start each day. There is also a well-decorated common reading room with a lot of seating - and a pool table - but we didn't use any of that. Nor did we use the pool, which is in the shade in the afternoon. White tile floors throughout, which gave a very clean feel, including our room. Inside #24, a black-and-tan color scheme against the white tile, which worked really well for us...as did the oh-so-comfy and soft bed. Great neighborhood too. Safe at all hours, so close to everything we needed, and right between the airport and Old San Juan. I'll go slightly off-track here and comment on the photos one of the previous reviewers posted. I'm going to guess he's a bit naive and inexperienced...and I'll leave it at that. He posted 5 pix, I think - and THREE of those were NOT by the Coral Princess. They were taken on Ashford, the main street in the Condado, and at least three blocks away from the hotel. If you keep going down Ashford a few more blocks, you'll come to Vuitton, Cartier, and several other exclusive boutique stores. So yes, photos can be deceiving. It got to where we'd make a game of it - "Find the Danger." Never could, but it was worth a laugh. One final comment. Another reviewer described the breakfast as having a "coffee dispenser." That's a bit like saying a Porsche is "a car." While the overall breakfast was probably the weakest part of our stay, the WMF 1400 they use is a first-class machine, and puts out the very best coffee we have ever had. I don't think that's what they're serving up at Burger King., and if you love coffee, you're in for a treat. If we ever make it back to SJ, we'll definitely stay at the Coral Princess...

Reviews.Title: “Feb 27-28 2009 - Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Opus100
Reviews.Content: My wife, sister and brother-in-law stayed here before our cruise. I read the reviews here and decided for the price this hotel would be fine. And it was, the price was great. Many other hotels in San Juan wanted more the $300 per night. We stayed two nights here for less than $200. The Condado area is ok, some graffiti but you see that everywhere in San Juan. It is close to the beach and some resturants. We ate in two of the local resturants and found them to be very over priced. We found the Walgreens near by to be a good place to get supplies before heading to the ship. The breakfest was good, pastieries, fruit, yogurt, ham and cheese, with coffee and juices. The place was clean and the staff friendly. Luis was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel staff helped us through a medical emergency and beyond”
Reviews.Author: haldridge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked for two nights at the coral princess inn and we absolutely loved the atmosphere, decor and our room. The flowers and plants were gorgeous in the outdoor seating areas. I loved having access to the coffee/latte machine and the juice machine all the time. The continental breakfast was good. The night before we were to depart, my husband's lung collapsed in the middle of the night and he couldn't breathe. It was very scary and Roberto at the front desk called an ambulance and his presence calmed me. He translated for us to the paramedics and I am grateful for his great help. My husband was in the hospital for five days and the staff at the coral princess was so very kind and concerned. They extended my stay and helped me by translating, giving me numerous directions and advice. We stayed on and off at the coral princess for another month because my husband couldn't fly for a month, doctors orders. The manager Luis gave us rides to doctor appointments out of the goodness of his heart and the owner gave us a discount on our bill considering our unfortunate circumstances. The entire staff helped us, and I couldn't think of a better place to be stuck! Thank you Coral princess Inn staff !!! We are grateful. Oh and if you like spicy food try the hot sauce with about anything at Cafe del angel! We bought two bottles to bring home with us! Yum!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute little quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReyDar64
Reviews.Content: the front staff is extremely helpfull and very nice. The breakfast area was small but had lots of delicious goodies to eat, ie: crossants, yougurt, cold cuts, fresh juices, cookies, danishes, cream cheese, butter. It was really good. All though the hotel is not beach front we managed to sneak into the Marriot (I believe that was the name) a few blocks away. Walking distance. We sat and drank in their pool and relaxed on the beach. The front desk staff gave us really good directions to Fajardo (the port to go to Culebra). Culebra is a MUST see.. get to the port early and buy your tix for the fairy. The beach is amazing.. the only thing is I wish I would have stayed the night there and then jumped on the fairy the next day. Feel free to ask me any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Instead of All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: EduardTravels
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel... but more along the line of a B&B. Quieter than staying in Old San Juan and nice if you don't want to be locked into a Hilton, Marriott or Radisson all inclusive property. We stayed for 4 nights. During our stay all rooms received new comforters. The room was fine. We wanted a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced place to sleep. All of those needs were met. Our one complaint was low water pressure and temperature variation in the shower. That is the only reason why we couldn't give a higher rating on the room. The other review comments of the neighborhood are factual: there is graffiti, etc. - but unfortunately that is everywhere in the world. At no time did we feel unsafe. There is a 24 hour Walgreens around the corner; plenty of great places to eat and drink and just a couple blocks off of the beach. The hotel staff was very helpful about restaurants and driving directions (GREAT tip to take the toll road to El Yunque - thanks again). Breakfast was good; nothing fancy: cereal, canned and fresh fruit, ham, cheese, instant oatmeal, croissants and an awesome coffee/cappuccino/hot chocolate maker. The pool is tiny, the rooftop patio has a hot tub and there is an impressive amount of plants everywhere on the grounds. We were fortunate to get a parking spot every night in front of the property; parking on the busy street might have been difficult. In summary, good not great but we felt like a good value for a quick getaway long week-end. We would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: BARNCA
Reviews.Content: We loved this charming hotel in the Condado Beach area. In a residential area within a few blocks of shopping and the beach. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Very clean. Charming.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE staff and people -- DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: 413Geek
Reviews.Content: We had a flight cancelation last minute and this hotel would not let us adjust our stay at all. They were rude and we are still trying to get our money back for the night we missed due to flight delays. There are many other small hotels in San Juan. Don't stay here!! RUDE STAFF!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: David9
Reviews.Content: Firstly I have to disagree with the last reviewer's comments on the area - it was no more threatening than I expected . yes there was graffiti but you find that everywhere nowdays and dunkin donuts was the only place I experienced that you had to be buzzed into of all the shops in the Condado district. We walked around happily night and day and felt quite at ease - perhaps it depends on your definition of a nice area!! The hotel is great, very good value when you look at alternatives like the Marriott. Breakfast was excellent and in a delightful courtyard. Not enough seats for everyone so it was a bit of a scramble to find somewhere to sit, however. The only complaint I would have would be about internal noise in the hotel. Our friends room was in a corridor which had people walking up and down most of the night and was noisy. We overlooked a seating area which was used by smokers late into the night. The swimming pool hours are advertised as from 8am but no one stopped kids larking about in it much before then. Rooms are big enough - maybe small by US standards but on a par with UK hotel rooms and plenty of space for a few nights stay. Mini bar was useful and bathroom with jacuzzi bath very nice. Overall its a friendly hotel, with some character, in a decent location, limited free parking and really helpful staff who are happy to recommend local restaurants etc. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing stay at Coral Princess..”
Reviews.Author: twilight43
Reviews.Content: After reading so many positive reviews I was honestly shocked to see the state of the hotel. To begin the hotel is in a very bad neighborhood. Think grafitti everywhere, and barbed wire fences/razor fences. To top it off even to go into the local Dunkin Donuts in the area you need to be buzzed in mid day. The area reminded me of a Grand Theft auto game. Check in in the hotel was fine, as was the hotel management but from the moment of stepping into our room this was the kind of place where we checked every corner for roaches. While we didnt' find any the room was just run down. The shower/jacuzzi was dirty and rusted. The wall paper was peeling off. There were big cracks in the wall. The one redeaming factor seems to be the breakfast area which was lovely. Stay at the Marriott up the street. MUCH nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Spot in the Heart of Condado”
Reviews.Author: laborman1
Reviews.Content: Based on the preponderance of TA reviews, my wife and I booked this hotel for 4 nights in January, 2009. We were not disappointed. We were not expecting a huge, luxurious room for such a modest price. But the room was more than adequate. It was clean, modern, truly quiet, and the mini-bar fridge was useable to keep some restaurant leftovers fresh overnight. The jacuzzi was an added bonus. The breakfast was also more than adequate, served in a delightful garden setting. We were also not expecting an olympic-size swimming pool for the price and, again, it was more than adequate for a refreshing dip. They have 4 free parking spaces in the front. We got one for our first 2 nights, parked on the street for free the 3rd night and only had to pay the last night in a secure lot down the street. The front desk staff was very helpful in advising us of easy bus service to Old San Juan and recommending things to see and do. The Condado area can get truly noisy at night. I think the locals purchase their stereo boom boxes first and then the cars as the accessory. While the Coral Princess is only a block from the main drag and all its restaurants, stores, casinos, etc., it really is a quiet oasis and a relative bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 3stacksandarock
Reviews.Content: After getting hosed by the taxi system in San Juan it was refreshing to check into Corral Princess. The staff was super friendly and had plenty of tips on how to see the city and places to go that won't cost you a fortune. It is close to the sites. Tons of restaurants are 1 block over, yet we felt it was quiet enough that we had no idea we were in the midst of it. The staff recommended that we take the Riviera(I think) walk into Old San Juan. It took us about an hour, but was well worth the trip and we stopped many times for photos and to check things out. We took the bus back from OSJ right to our door. The room is small, but clean and hip. I liked the look and the air conditioner worked well. I'm really impressed with this place and would stay there again. If you are going to go to San Juan you should stay at the Corral Princess.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: suiza_salsera
Reviews.Content: The Coral Princess Inn is a small hotel right in Condado and can be recommended. What we liked about the hotel: - nice, spacious and clean rooms - complimentary breakfast, although the breakfast was quite simple - perfect location right in condado - nice roof top terrace with whirlpool - It is a safe place with somebody at the reception for 24 hours - free parking in front of the hotel (if available, first come first serve) What we did not like so much: - not all the front desk employees were very kind, a lady did not even look at us when we entered in the evening and opened the door without checking if we were hotel guests. We recommend the hotel but won't stay there anymore because we did not like the area of Condado. It's ok for a night or two but definitely not worth to spend more time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice common area, rooms a bit small”
Reviews.Author: tara_c48
Reviews.Content: The location was great, right in Condado and within walking distance of everything. The common areas of the hotel were very nice, pretty good breakfast in the morning and good coffee. My only complaint is that the rooms (at least the one we were in) were very small. They were still nice inside however. Take advantage of the awesome community spaces, pools and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Coral Princess!”
Reviews.Author: mimi703
Reviews.Content: We had a destination wedding in San Juan, Puerto Rico in August 2008. We had about 40 guests, most of which stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for about a week. The Customer Service we received was absolutely stellar! The property is clean, modern...beautiful, it had a bed and breakfast feel, 2 blocks from Condado Beach AND affordable for our guests! It was great for families, the children loved it as well. With so many guests arriving at different days and times as well as some room changes, the staff were always accomodating and happy to assist with anything they could. I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples looking for a romantic getaway and families looking for an affordable option in the Condado area of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Coral Princess Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sallyf425
Reviews.Content: We booked the Coral Princess Inn based upon the reviews on this site. We were going on a cruise which left on Sunday November 16 but we wanted to have some time in San Juan prior to the cruise. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They arranged for a trip to the bioluminescent bay for us. The accomodations were quite nice. The room was quiet and clean. They actually upgraded us to a larger room upon arrival. Our room had an LCD TV mounted on the wall and a Wi-Fi connection. The hotel is centrally located so we didn't have far to walk to the beach (about two blocks) or to nearby stores. (Walgreen's was right on the corner) They offered a continental breakfast in the morning where you could eat outside on a lovely patio. There also is a small inground pool at the Coral Princess Inn. We would most certainly stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel to couples and singles.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay... cleanliness, hospitality, convenience, and bearly affordabl”
Reviews.Author: DreamyOahu
Reviews.Content: Coral Princess Inn is hands down one of the best experiences when it comes to the following: 1.) Customer service â€“ excellent!!! 2.) Cleanliness â€“ excellent cleanlinessâ€¦ zero complaints! 3.) Comfort â€“ very good. They could use newer and better quality mattresses though. A harder mattress is preferred. 4.) Value for moneyâ€¦ the room should go for U$110.00 + tax. Thatâ€™s plenty for this hotel given the location, time of year, and overall what one receives in exchange. Thank you Luis, thank you Karina, and thank you the support staff at thip your property for making my stay refreshing. The hot water works, the Internet works, and air-conditioner. In addition, a full panel of Cable TV ... comprehensive. This hotel gets a Grade A. They just need to lower their prices to not exceed U$110.00 out the door. Even U$125.00 out the door is ok. U$155.00 is too much even during high season.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: BajaMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in 11/08 for 2 nights pre-cruise and then again 3 nights post-cruise. What a wonderful little inn this is! Warm hospitality, clean, quiet and centrally located. Rooms may be a little on the small side, but are well appointed and are very clean and well maintained. Their continental breakfast is very good - not just toast & coffee - and exceeded our expectations. Front desk staff and management seemed to go out of their way to make us feel welcome and to provide restaurant and sightseeing hints and opinions. I would recommend this nice little inn to anyone who is NOT looking for the swim-up bars (and $400/night rate) of the "resort" properties.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrennie
Reviews.Content: While looking for a nice hotel at a reasonable rate. I found this one. I am a travel agent who was looking for something in a good location and a great value for the price. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights after arriving in San Juan after a cruise from New York City I read the reviews on trip advisor. So I booked 3 rooms at the hotel for 6 people. It was everything I thought it would be after reading the reviews and seeing pictures of the property. They gave us 3 rooms near each other on the same floor. We had arrived a bit early for check-in from the ship. The staff was very accomodating and held our luggage until our rooms were ready. . We were able to walk to area reataurants for dinner and to Walgreens to get drinks and snacks since we were there for 2 days. The beach was a short walk, just 2 blocks away. The hotel was very relaxing, clean and quiet, relaxing pool, with decent continetal breakfast. I would recommend this property to other travelers and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, very nice staff....Wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: chaunn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico. When planning the trip we searched on line for hotels, when we came across the Coral Princess Inn, we read the reviews, looked at the photos & booked the room. It sounded like just what we were looking for...and I must say "We were absolutely happy with our stay" It is very cozy & not anything like a big hotel..which was what we were looking for. Very clean, and nice decor throughout the Inn. The staff was attentive and when we needed assistance they were very helpful. Rooms were kept at a very nice temperature, since it was HOT & Humid. Beds were comfortable, flat screen tv, jacuzzi tub, and again nice furniture. Lots of potted plants, game room, little library, pool, hot tub and areas where you can just sit outside if you'd like and relax. The location is great...one block from Ashford st. We were able to walk to the park or beach in about 5min. enjoy the shops, restuarants and or Casinos.. on Ashford St. I'd stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Worthy Alternative to Oceanfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lazydayz-Tampa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights pre-cruise. Taxi from Airport is under $20 and to Pan American Pier was under $15. Staff was helpful. Room was big enough, with minibar and TV. Excellent bathroom - marble tile and full-size tub. When we noticed there was no safe in the room, the front desk arranged to have one placed in our room. Location is very convenient to beach, Marriott Stellaris, restaurants and is located on the bus route to Old San Juan (bus was free, as was trolley in OSJ). This is an excellent place to stay for a short visit if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your hotel. While the public areas are nice, most are small. Pool area was crowded with four people. Rooftop jacuzzi is very nice, as is the "complimentary" breakfast (note that the hotel added a $10 convenience charge on top of room rate and taxes for breakfast, access to phone and pool, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a one night stay at the Coral Princess Inn after our cruise. We were looking forward to staying at this hotel as the reviews were all very good. We arrived at the hotel prior to check in and were told that our rooms would be ready by 1:00 and that we could put our luggage in the luggage room. We did so and headed out for lunch. The hotel is located in a residential area and has tons of restaurants and stores near by. There is a Walgreens walking distance which is also very nice. After lunch we checked into our room. We were given room #2. The room felt like a room in your home. It was very comfortable. The room was not huge ( I bruised up my leg walking around the bed) but very nicely decorated and very clean. There is a snack fridge in the room and actually they do not overcharge you for anything in it. The bathroom was also a very nice size. There was a flat screen t.v. on the wall and the bed was very comfortable. We did not take advantage of the complimentary breakfast but the breakfast area and the rest of the grounds were very nice. We would both definitely stay at the Coral Princess Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: skylukeDublin
Reviews.Content: We booked this travel as a last minute so we have been ready for some troubles. But the place suprised us very well! It's lovely place with great staff who really cares about your needs. It's serously great place to go for week relax

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: bcbcbc
Reviews.Content: Our group (3 middle-aged couples) stayed here two nights pre-cruise in March (admittedly, this review is late!). We have to travel on a budget, and, after reading the Tripadvisor reviews, decided to give it a try. We were more than satisfied. The rooms were not fancy but clean. We loved the "public" areas. The continental breakfast was served in a lovely courtyard area--pretty and peaceful and a great way to "gear up" for your day. The rooftop terrace was perfect for "winding down" at night after a long day of sightseeing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We did have some problems getting our reservations straightened out (in advance of our arrival) but the staff was extremely apologetic and finally fixed the problem. The location was convenient. Of course, we would have loved to have had a beachfront hotel with an ocean view, but for the price, we could not have asked for more. We are looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay...”
Reviews.Author: kk85
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT! The staff extremely nice from the beginning till the end. Very helpful with giving us ideas for site seeing, restaurants , attractions, etc. Condado Beach two blocks from hotel and a short bus ride to Old San Juan. Very quiet hotel and very cozy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely...”
Reviews.Author: Love2travellonely
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely boutique style hotel just for one night. I was conducting my travel alone and felt very safe. The staff was fantastic, the room was very clean....Rooms were similar to others I have stayed in Europe(maybe small for some people but extremely clean and comfortable). Very close to the beach and stores. Loved this place and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: madzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for 2 days prior to our cruise and had a wonderful time. The room was clean and cozy, the rooftop terrace was great to relax and offered a hot tub. There was a comfortable outdoor sitting area on the 2nd floor and a small pool around the side. The front desk staff were friendly and held our luggage as we went off to old San Juan for the day before boarding, the maids on the other hand were'nt so pleasant. All in all it's worth the stay and we would consider going back

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: FloridaProfessor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess from July 9th until the 14th. First, the staff is incredibly helpful, andswers questions, and gave us storage space for our luggage, hailed our cabs for us, all at a one person desk. Housekeeping is excellent as well. The rooms are nice, well described in the pictures posted on this website. The breakfast is passable, the coffee is excellent. It is close to all the action in Condado-- a good place to eat around the corner, a couple of blocks from most of the casinos and place to eat. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SwissMr
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay here during a trade show in San Juan. Very reasonably priced and immaculately clean hotel, just perfectly off the main hustle and bustle of the area. All the nightlife you want is just a walk away. What most impressed me was how comfortable the accommodations are and impressively clean and neat. Breakfast is nice, staff is very friendly, and I woke up to a smile every day.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess--A Respite before Returning to Reality”
Reviews.Author: StickSister
Reviews.Content: Staying here after a cruise was a restful bridge before returning home. We disembarked the ship and arrived at the hotel before we could check in, but there was a room for storing our luggage and a restroom so we could change and enjoy the small pool and the breezeway where we relaxed until our room was ready. Marcia, the desk clerk, was extremely helpful and friendly. Our attractive room was very comfortable with a much welcome working ac and ceiling fan. The stairs were difficult to navigate with our luggage, but that is the only negative I could post. The room was very clean as was the bath. It felt like a place of retreat and warmth and I would have enjoyed staying another day just lazing around and looking at the beautiful orchids in bloom in the walkway area. This was not an ornate or extravagant hotel--but one with its own charm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: BrnzBarbie22
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on the Coral Princess, I was pleased to find this hotel delivers what most positive reviews had to say. Overall, it was a very charming hotel that will definitely stay on my short list of favorites in the San Juan area. I was traveling single and I stayed in room 19. It was one of the smaller rooms, but still very adequate. The room was very clean and room service was dependable. The ceiling fan worked great - so much that I could go without the air condition at night. Here are a few things I didn't see in other reviews that might be helpful. There is 24 hour security at the front desk, someone has to buzz you in at all times of the day. I felt very secure, but it was inconvenient one night about 3am when I had to wait about 5 minutes for the attendent to return to the desk. They have a very convenient room 11, where you can leave your bags before or after checkout. This room is also equiped with a bathroom and shower so you can get cleaned up before heading to the airport if you have a late flight. There is a refrigerator in each room, but it is fully stocked and the hotel charges very "convenient" prices for their refreshments. There was a Walgreens around the corner. I bought my own refreshements, but they still attempted to charge me for items from the wet bar at the end of my stay. The only complaint I had would be a general hotel gripe: the room door was not very soundproof and you can hear noise out in the hallway. There were a couple of times I was awakened by the child across the hall, but that did not take away from the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay marred only by credit card problem”
Reviews.Author: bugleTA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for the second half of my trip after reading some reviews here. The hotel itself has a charming, homey feeling and I much preferred it to my first overpriced boutique hotel . The room was very clean and had a cordless phone, small TV, high-speed wired internet, and a drink fridge. Everything worked well, no problems with infrastructure. Room was tiny but I opted for the cheapest ($99) one, was perfectly happy given what I paid. The hotel has lots of little common areas inside and out where you can sit and read, socialize, whatever. Staff was friendly and helpful, they let me use their soap when I needed to do laundry. At checkout there was a place to store my luggage until my plane left, unfortunately they give access to this unattended area to all guests so if you're really worried about your stuff getting stolen I wouldn't recommend it. I loved the area as it is a mix of hotels, businesses, and residential. There are a few down home restaurants up the block, a Walgreens around the corner, and you really are 4 min from the beach. This would have been a five-star review BUT in checking my credit card bill online a week after I stayed I discovered a $1500 overcharge that had cleared (not just held). I called them the next day. They were apologetic and blamed a systems error and in fact had already put through a refund before I called. The refund did indeed show up the next day with a entry date from before I made my call. I believe this was an honest mistake, but it still was quite a shock. Would it stop me from coming back? I don't think so, I enjoyed my stay too much at half the price of other hotels, and thought they handled their mistake as well as possible. I've attached photos of the hotel, forgot to take one of the room!

Reviews.Title: “A princess in commoners clothing”
Reviews.Author: Travelsof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess for two nights "pre cruise" and found it just fine. We were given the penthouse suite which was huge! We looked out on a terrace with hot tub. ( they need to chlorinate the tub it was green) We also had two other rooms in the hotel and they were also fine. Bathrooms neat and tidy. Public areas neat and clean. The pool was small and it would be nice if it was heated ( it wasn't green). Staff friendly. Location great although the beach is not that great. The neighbourhood to the south is run down, but new development is comming.Location to the port is great, as its about a 15 minute drive by cab. We rented a van for two days from Charlie car which was great value. Get a GPS and there is no trouble getting around. There is limited parking but the hotel has a deal with a lot down the street with 24 hr security which is fine (spend the extra coin and get the full insurance package at the car rental place the local drivers are nuts, We had no issues but just the same who needs hassles) Charlie car will pickyou up at the airport and drop you off at the port. For 6 people for two days taxi fares would have been more than the rental. Anyway back to the hotel.... breakfast included friut, toast, cereal,juice coffe, lots of stuff though no "bacon and two" over all value when compared to the big chains excellent imagine the Holiday Inn Express wants $275.00 to $300,00 per night why would you not stay here! The place is quaint, location good, rooms clean, well run and secure Its not the Taj Mahal but its a definite will stay again location.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess - Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: AMBUWS29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess from May 2-4, 2008 for a weekend getaway. - Location: Ideally situated a block from Condado Beach and near many small restaurants (loved Cafe Del Angel). Easy bus ride on the B21 to Old San Juan. - Cleanliness: Mostly very clean. Bathroom was spotless. Only complaints were that the fan in our room was covered in dust and the rooftop hot tub's water smelled funky and needed a cleaning. - Room: Room 16 is small, but clean and quiet, on the second floor overlooking the lovely courtyard with plants and a small, but very clean pool. It has a jacuzzi tub. - Breakfast: Breakfast was adequate, but nothing to write home about. - Service: The staff was very helpful, even letting us store our stuff in a room with a shower on the last day -- our flight didn't leave until late in the day. Overall, Coral Princess was a great choice for the price. I would stay here again. The only complaints were the dirty hot tub and fan.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: vvv3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights based on the good reviews on this site. Was one of the best deals in San Juan, even with the substantial taxes/fees added (which are listed in the confirmation email as a final price). The rooms were larger than I expected from what I had read. Small flat-screen TV with a bunch of channels for pre-bed dozing off. The pool is small but useful. The rooftop hot tub is hit or miss as it wasn't always working. Breakfast was basic (from Costco) but enough to get you going in the morning. The staff was very helpful and one maintenance issue that appeared was resolved immediately. It was possible to find parking always either in front of the hotel or on side streets so never had to pay extra. And the location is very convenient for Condado, which seems to be rapidly expanding. Lots of restaurants and shops around, including a very useful Walgreens one block away. Cab fare to downtown San Juan was $12 if you don't feel like driving (didn't try the bus). Overall, this hotel is a good value in a good location, so I would definitely recommend it for visitors to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice in Condado”
Reviews.Author: knoxfencer
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan for a mix of business and sightseeing. This was ideal. The inn is close to the beach, restaurants, convenience stores, a pharmacy, casinos, and trendy shopping. The staff became our friends--they were very open and helpful. Old San Juan is an easy 10-minute, 75-cent bus ride away (buses are not on predictable schedules, though). You would be hard pressed to find a more reasonable price in this area. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely inn”
Reviews.Author: pjfarkel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on great reviews on TripAdvisor for a two night after cruise stay. We were very pleased with the location. There were local restaurants all around. Good food and prices. We arrived at 11AM with a 3 PM check-in. We were able to store our luggage and go into Old San Juan. Be sure to take the bus. A cab is $15 and a bus is .75 - but you MUST have 3 quarters - the driver cannot make change and won't. It is bus B21. Leave the hotel to the left, go to the corner, go left, go to the light by Walgreens, cross it, cross again to your right and there is the bus stop. Sometimes it comes right away, but you may have to wait 30-45 min. Sometimes it goes straight to Old San Juan and sometimes it seems it is going in circles. Back to the hotel. We had Room 2 on the ground level. The hotel is probably one of the cleanest I have ever stayed at. There is a breakfast room (ok continental - the coffee was great), a library, and on floor 3 a sitting area and pool table. There is only air conditioning in the hotel rooms, not the shared areas. The small pool in on the ground level and the spa is on the roof. It is a little portable type. We could not get the water to heat. The room was furnished in a spare, modern way. There was a hair dryer and ample towels. We did not have any hot water problems. The only problem we had was the bed frame. It had legs that stuck outward. We kept banging our toes into it and crying out...finally wrapped towels around them. For $135 it was worth it. Great location, clean, wonderful staff, and beautiful gardens. I will stay there should I be in San Juan again. I will also recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent atmosphere at Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: graceCP
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 stayed for 3 nights at the Coral Princess Inn,in early April.It is small and quaint but clean and in a good location.The staff were informative and competent.The rooms were clean but really tiny;our suitcases had to be pushed into corners between the bed and the wall ,but we overlooked that small inconvenience since there were so many positive things.While our room,(room 3) was tiny,(with a tiny window over the bed that looked out onto a corridor)one of the other couples had room 4,which was much bigger for the same rate.It had a window that looked outside.The couple that had room 8 near the breakfast area also ended up in cramped quarters,but like us,considered it a minor inconvenience.The breakfast(which was included with the cost of the room)was more than adequate for our needs and the casual atmosphere was lovely.We could make our own toast/bagels,tea/etc.,choose what we wanted(cheese slices,ham slices,pastries,yogurt,fruit,etc)and then sit in the courtyard while we ate,and listened to the birdsong.We absolutely loved it!The pool was very small but the beach was only a few minutes away;right across the road.On the third floor there is a hot tub that is open till 9 P.M. (though the staff allowed my friends and I to stay in until 11,which was considerate).The food at the nearby Cafe Angel(try the mofongo if you want a taste of the national dish)was excellent;reasonably priced and huge portions.Also the Black Angus Steakhouse serves the best steaks that you could ever ask for.There is a Walgreens around the corner.If you want to go to Old San Juan or the mall(The Plaza of the Americas)you don't need to waste your money on a cab;the B21 bus runs right near the inn and drops you off there as well(every 20 minutes).It costs just .75 cents each way.The exact change is required.Overall,I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is budget conscious and just wants somewhere clean and homey to stay for a short time.It is no Hilton,but then you don't pay Hilton prices either. At 125.00 a night it's not bad,as rates go in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “The value just wasn't there...”
Reviews.Author: gypsywmn
Reviews.Content: I saw all of the good reviews on trip advisor for this hotel and started to search around for prices. I found them listed on hotels.com with a price of $115 per night, but no mention of the bed size, and we wanted a queen or bigger. I decided to contact the hotel directly and they offered me a queen bed at $135 a night, which seemed a little high, but I decided the extra $20 per night would be okay. Watch out for the additional fees, though. They charged an additional $9.00 per day as a "maintenance fee" or something like that, and there is a 14% tax on top of that. We ended up paying $682 for 4 nights, or $170 per night. Now, I was looking for a small, quaint hotel that would bring with it the charm of the local community, and a sense that we were experiencing a part of Puerto Rico. This hotel just didn't offer that. This was a $100 per night hotel at best. For $170 a night, we shouldn't have had the following problems: The first night there, the water would only turn on cold. There were 2 of us, and we turned the knobs every which way trying to get hot water in the shower. Finally, we asked at the desk. They agreed to look at it in the morning while we had breakfast. After, they brought us in, and "showed us" how to turn the knob and said the hot water was working all along. There is no way it was working prior to that. Why couldn't they just apologize for having to turn on the water heater? In addition, after breakfast, we brought our coffee back into the room with us while we were getting ready. When they cleaned the room, they didn't remove the empty, used coffee cups. For the price we were paying, I would expect the room to be perfect when we returned for the evening. I ended up having to bring 2 days of coffee cups back out to the breakfast area myself. I know these things seem small, and I would overlook them for a less expensive hotel, but I know there are other hotels in the area that provide better service for the same price. (I had previously stayed at the Wind Chimes Inn and would have booked there again, if they weren't all filled up.) The good things: the courtyard for breakfast was beautiful, but don't expect anything very healthy (yogurt with lots of sugar, pastries, and processed cheese and ham... they also had cereal, but only cornflakes.) The bed was the right size, but it was just outside the courtyard, so when people would congregate for breakfast, they woke us up every morning. No need to set an alarm! The rooms were cleaned well except for the coffee cup issue, and the location was great. If you are going to stay here, I would ask NOT to have a room near the courtyard, and be careful about pricing. I see another post here that states a room with a king bed was only $125 a night. I don't know why my price was higher. They also "recommend" that you tip the maid $3 per day. I usually tip the maid, anyway, but I just felt like they were nickle and diming me with this suggested tip as well. Make it $173 per night. I have never given a bad review to a hotel on trip advisor before, and I still highly recommend Wind Chimes Inn if you are looking for a hotel in the Condado area. I felt the service and the people there were wonderful, and I didn't feel like I was getting less value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location while visiting San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ponsib
Reviews.Content: My family of four recently stayed at the Coral Princess Inn which is conveniently located in Condado. It is easy to catch a bus or cab to Old San Juan from this location. The beach is a short walk away and there are many restaurants to choose from. Our room with one queen size bed was very small, especially when we added the roll away mattress. If I knew how small the room was I would have reserved a different one. The room was clean however and we didn't have problems with the hot water supply when we wanted it. The property is maintained nicely with many tropical plants. The area where breakfast is served is very nice. They offer the standard continental food and drinks. They also have a piano for the guests and a quiet reading room. The pool is very small but my kids still enjoyed it very much. They also have a hot tub on the upper level but you need to walk through the penthouse suite to get to it. Overall our experience was good while staying here and I would select it again if we return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “We all wish to be in hot water--at least in a hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: FirstDuck
Reviews.Content: For me one of the basics of any hotel is hot water--well, when my wife and I stayed there the end of March there was none at any time of day or night that I turned on a faucet--maybe warm (maybe not), but never hot. the water pressure was also so low that it took 20 minutes of full-force (???) to just barely clear the jets in the whirlpool tub, but since the water was the temperature it was, I stopped there and never did fill it. I did complain at the desk and, of course, you know what the result of that was--we'll have someone check it, but, of course, if anyone did, it made no difference. I could say some things were ok, but some things are always ok. for the price, definitely should have been better.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and a great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Rob1975
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Coral Princess. It's in a great location in Condado a short walk to the beach and very close to great restaurants and shopping. A quick cab ride to Old San Juan. The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess a let-down”
Reviews.Author: joelsmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Penthouse suite for one quick night, and on first impression it was very cool! Definitely a smooth decor: very modern. The whole hotel has a random chic appearance with antique furniture blended with bold colorful paintings and modern lines. Only upon settling in did we begin to be disappointed. The toilet paper, a priority for my D.H., was the cheapest quality one could purchase, the shower was plumbed directly into the jacuzzi tub, which was a little awkward to step in or out of, there were cheap soaps and, a female's favorite, "conditioning shampoo". I don't know a female that doesn't appreciate conditioner!! There weren't even kleenex in the room! The cheap t.p. had to suffice! There were doors that opened directly onto the roof-top deck that had no instructions and were impossible to open. The a.c. was an individual unit mounted on the wall controlled by a remote that, apparently, had been dropped so the LCD screen was unreadable. I spent the night either roasting or freezing not being able to find a happy medium. Another disappointment for me was that the hotel was a $12 (one way) cab fare away from Old San Juan. The last, but not least, missing commodity in our PENThouse sute was an alarm clock!!!! All that said, the bed was very comfy, the staff friendly and the hotel fairly clean. Probably wouldn't stay there again, or wouldn't pay *$200* dollars for maybe what a lesser room would've offered.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but felt scammed when i left.”
Reviews.Author: Max S
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in Coral Princess last 3 days, really nothing special, I looked next door at the Consulate hotel, a few more bucks and itâ€™s a lot nicer. Location on Condado is excellent. Rooms showed wear and tear, air con works either ice box mode or nothing. Hotel was not forthright about there true room rate, and at end of stay they added 10 bucks a day for nothing. When I asked about it, I was told it was for the Internet and TV which on web says is included. Bottom-line, I would be careful these guys seem to just want to nickel and dime, which is too bad, I guess they think no one tells anyone about these little extras.

Reviews.Title: “the informal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: philpetrus
Reviews.Content: very nice experience in this small hotel, would say rather guest house. The room (suite) was very comfortable, located at the rear, so more quiet. Breakfast in the patio with a lot of exotic plants, is a kind of refreshing simplicity. One thing i want to add about our San Juan experience is the lack of serious concerning the common transportation, i mean bus : we have waited about 45 minutes for a bus to the Old San Juan on a saturday morning and finally we had to take a taxi. And don't forget to talk about the cost before, usually 12 dollars, otherway you could be charge untill 16 or 18 dollars. It's a shame and as i have discussed with a loco people, the taxi syndicate is powerfull and they are opposed to the creation of a direct line from the airport to downtown ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Size, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dyableau
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Coral Princess Inn. The hotel itself and the service were great! Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure that our stay was the most enjoyable that it could be. The room (#15) was clean and in good condition. The self-service breakfast was good and had enough variety to keep us satisfied. The hotel is located 2 blocks from the beach, and just one block from everything on Ashford. The 3rd floor deck was very nice to be out on. The pool was a little small, but we were never really at the hotel during the day, so that didn't matter much to us. We were pleased with staying in Condado, seeing as it was nestled right in the middle of OSJ and Isla Verde. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone looking to get away from the larger resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: mairead_ny
Reviews.Content: I was not at all impressed by this hotel or its location. My friend and I stayed there 2 nights and due to a booking error had to switch rooms after the first night. The first room supposedly had a queen sized bed (was actually a full) and the shower had no hot water and very little water pressure. The second room was better but not as great as the reviews lead me to expect. Location: Condado, at least where this hotel is located, is run down and the beach nearby is nothing to write home about. It's a 20 minute bus ride to Old San Juan - that's if the bus comes at all. My friend and I waited 40 minutes one day and finally got in a dollar van ($2 per person for 5+ people). A private taxi will cost you around $16. Overall, a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: Shanra92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess for four nights before our cruise, and for an additional night after the cruise. The hotel is small and charming...exactly what we wanted! If you want a hotel with charm, that's in a good location, and for a great price...this is the place to stay. Yes, the rooms are a little small, but we weren't staying in San Juan to hang out in the room! We loved the beautiful patio that is surrounded by flowers...it was a great place for breakfast. The staff was very helpful in helping us with transportation and making recommendations. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - but it is OK”
Reviews.Author: 1allsop
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at the Coral Princess in, we had great expectations based on the fantastic reviews we saw on tripadvisor. Mind you, not that the Hotel was bad, on the contrary: it is clean and the rooms are ok. Nothing more. I cannot honestly say that I'll tell my grandchildren stories about my magnificent stay at the Coral Pricess Inn as many other users . Said that, I would recommend it my friends, Price and location are good and hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: imsupafly
Reviews.Content: This was the first of four hotels we booked for our cross-island trip to Puerto Rico, it definitely set the bar for the others to follow! Right near a Walgreens, a short walk to Condado Beach and ocean walkway, and a short drive to old San Juan. It was actually better to stay outside of the San Juan area b/c of the large volume of tourists off of multiple cruise liners drinking and some sketchy characters ready to take advantage of tourists. The place is beautiful and friendly during the day though, lots of families flying kites by the fort. The rooms at the Coral Inn although small, were comfortable and priced right (unlike other larger hotels) It had more of a boutique feel, lots of plants that kept the hotel cool and relaxing. The upper level had a common area w/ a pool table and the rooftop had a jacuzzi tub. The only negative is parking, there is only maybe 4 spots which is bad if you have a rental car, they suggest you go to a nearby lot and pay the fee which they would discount, we could not find that lot! (the road signs were in spanish, we quickly picked up what they meant, although getting from the rental place to the hotel via the highway was very interesting...lol!) We were so eager to get into the clear blue water at the beach which was gorgeous. Later in our trip, we were told that that stretch of beach was known for shark sightings! My suggestion....don't swim out too far and avoid the rip tides! Overall, this small hotel is underrated and probably deserves more stars than the more known and frequented hotels in the area. If you're looking for a clean comfortable place to come back to after a long day and don't need an ocean view, this is a good choice. We will come back to the Coral Princess Inn the next time we visit Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel in Condado!”
Reviews.Author: cellowu
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is really nice! Just one thing: check the air-condition first when you enter your room. I was first assigned to the very front room of the second floor ( I forgot the number, is it 12?), but the AC did not work well. Of course I asked to change to another room and the staff did it. Otherwise, I found this hotel lovely and fantastic! The breakfast is simple, however, I have no complaints on it!

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: rmrose59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before our cruise and chose this hotel based on the positive tripadvisor reviews. Even then, our expectations were exceeded. We were told upon arrival that the room we had booked was upgraded to PH1 which was a huge suite with jacuzzi, and walkout to roof patio and hot tub outside. It was the perfect start to our holiday, especially after a full day of travelling. The next day, we walked over to Candado beach, and enjoyed some cocktails from the Marriott. Also, the hotel staff allowed us to store our luggage at the hotel in that our cruise was leaving later in the day. There is no need for us to search for where we will be staying next visit to San Juan as we believe we have found the best San Juan has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Bumpa2328
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a cruise. The room and staff were very good and the breakfast was very adequate. Rather than take a cab to Old San Juan there is a bus stop about a block away and for $.75 take the B21 bus to the end of the line and you are in Old San Juan. On the return trip get the bus at the terminal, again $.75 where you got off, and ask the driver to let you off at the Marriott. You will be almost in front of the Coral Princess. The bus driver doesn't make change.

Reviews.Title: “Great little inn close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: LauraGuth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at this inn. It is just one block off the main street in Condada, meaning it's close to the shopping, restuarants, casinos and beach. Our room was on the small side, but very comfortable. Our room did have a tub/shower combo and the tub was a small whirlpool tub. The only complaint I have and it's not a big one is with the shower water. The pressure was low and it would go from comfortable to hot to cold and back and forth. Our room also had a fridge that was prestocked with water &sodas ($1 each), beer ($2 each), and wine ($25 each). There was also room to add your own beverages. The front desk were very friendly and helpful with their suggestions. The continental breakfast was sufficient and consisted of cereal, croissants, and various other pastries. The location was great and the price was affordable. If we return to San Juan, we will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Guanica8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed four nights at the Coral Princess Inn in El Condado, Puerto Rico. We found it on our own, and it is a great place! Our room was clean and roomy, the continental breakfast was quite adequate, the service was helpful and friendly, there is a small pool, a spa, and comfortable reading rooms. We very much enjoyed our stay. Several restaurants, a Walgreens, and the beach are within walking distance. Parking is a bit tight as it is with most hotels in the area, but overall, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Born_yesterday
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife and small daughter for 8 days at the end of December. This is a clean and well-kept hotel with modern furniture in the rooms, flat-screen TV's with over 100 free cable channels, and a wine fridge in every room. A basic continental breakfast is included in the price. There is a jacuzzi in a nice terrace patio in the third floor that is open until 9 pm in the evening. There is also a small pool in the first floor of the hotel, but it's not very sunny there. As far as we can tell, this is not a chain hotel, which is good because the staff were that much more friendly. We asked for a crib for our daughter and were provided with one free of charge. There is a very good Argentinian restaurant called Buenos Ayres just down the street with very tasty food and large portions at a moderate price ($18 to $25 per main dish). The beach is two blocks away. NOTE OF CAUTION: if you go to San Juan (or most other places on the north shore) during the winter months from December to March, the ocean rough - the waves are strong and the undertow is powerful. While we were in Condado beach we saw an emergency situation in which a person got too far out from the shore and had to be rescued by several other people. Afterwards we were told by some locals that this (and worse) happens several times each winter. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get room Number 8”
Reviews.Author: ski35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coral Princess on our way onto a cruise. We arrived at midnight the hotel the lobby; although small was tastefully decorated. We were given room # 8 which is right beside the breakfast area. The room was small and the noise from the breakfast area started up at 5:00 am. As we got in late I was not impressed. I went to the main desk and the clerk basically said that was just too bad. I was not happy after traveling all day and not getting any sleep in the room I was not happy with there customer service and would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great...”
Reviews.Author: cruzr4ever
Reviews.Content: We booked the Coral Princess for one night pre-cruise. Upon arriving to the Inn, they told us we were upgraded to the pent house suite. Wow- we're never that lucky. Large, spacious room , lots of marble, jacuzzi/shower combo. View isn't great, Condado is up and coming, some of the buildings are rough. We found a neat little resturant nearby called Latin Star. Yum. The staff at the Coral Princess are very knowledgable and friendly. They held our luggage the following morning after checkout so we could check out the area, and go to the beach. The beach by the way was rough, and not conducive to swimming. There are some impressive stores also very near, Ferragamo, Vuitton, Dior, etc if your budget allows. The complimentary breakfast was just as described by others. Plenty of choice, and a nice atmosphere in which to enjoy. Would stay with them again. About 15 minutes to the cruise pier via taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: weekapaug
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all of the stunning reviews this place got. It is very very average. Cons: The rooms are extremely small....felt more like a tiney bedroom than a hotel room. At first glance the room looked clean, however I felt like I could not walk around and shower without flip flops. Our sink was clogged and took a while to drain each time we used it. Breakfast was TERRIBLE. Basically it's a tray of ham and cheese, yogurt, croissant (which had mold on it) and juice. Pros: Front desk was nice and helpful. They allowed us to shower and change in the hotel when we got back from the beach after we checked out (had a late flight) Location was pretty good. About 3 blocks from an ok beach. Condado beach is not a typical Carribean beach. Some trash scattered around, water is not calm...lots of waves. No big deal...just an FYI. Doing this trip again I would stay at The Marriott (one block away from Coral Princess). It's beach front and much nicer inside.

Reviews.Title: “very nice inn”
Reviews.Author: kimSxm
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to say that this website...(tripadvisor) is really helpfulI.... learned about this hotel here at tripadvisor...seeing that it has such good reviews...I checked out their website and emailed them from there for any availability...Coral Princess Inn is a really nice place. Me and my husband spent 3 nights here and we really enjoyed our stay. My husband even thanked me for finding such a nice clean hotel that's centrally located that suits our budget. The hotel is very clean. Receptionists are nice and helpful. And the location is just perfect...very close to a lot of restaurants, the beach and old san juan. It was our first time in Puerto Rico, and I'm glad that we stayed here... We ate at the Cherry Blossoms japanese/chinese restaurant...it was the freshest sushi we had...and the service is very good. Our second night...we did the biobay kayak tour in fajardo...everyone should try this ...it felt like it was a dream...the water was very warm eventhough it was a breezy night...it was along drive though to fajardo. I will really recommend this place to eveybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GiacR
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean and affordable, however the air conditioners do not have temperature sensors, so they run all night long. However, if your room is by the breakfast area, that will be a saving grace. It can get loud early in the morning. The location was great, most times you can share a cab with others going to Old San Juan (plan on $15 each way...10 minute ride). The bus stop is close and it is .075 cents, but I am not sure how reliable they are...one couple waited over an hour. The breakfast was like any normal continental breakfast...nothing spectacular. There are lots of good restaurants in Condado too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: EWHawk
Reviews.Content: Date: Oct. 8, 2007 Reviewer: E Hawk, South Carolina, USA My wife and I stayed overnight at the Coral Princess while waiting on a cruise. We wish we could have stayed longer. The hotel is an excellent value, and the staff could not have been more pleasant. The only negative is that the rooms are a bit small. But, they are VERY comfortable, and totally clean. The A/C worked perfectly, which is an important item judging by reviews of other places. Internet service is available in the room, and the TV, while small, has plenty of channels and great reception. The area offers so much to do, you may not watch much. We didn't. The area is loaded with restaurants. We'd never been to Puerto Rico, and wanted to try local dishes. The staff recommended the Cafe d'Angel (I hope I spelled it right.), which was very close by. It was superb! Try the mifungo. You won't regret it. The hotel also serves a Continental Breakfast which was very good. The Condado Beach is only an easy 2 minute walk. Shopping is nearby, as you are close to a main thoroughfare. We felt comfortable walking in the area, even at night. Everyone we met was friendly and helpful, and no one seemed to mind speaking English. Some reviewers had different opinions on that, and perhaps we were simply more fortunate. I think tho', if you are pleasant to the people there, they will respond the same. As I said, we only stayed overnight, so we can't give a complete description of everything. I do know that if we return to San Juan (which we hope to do), we definitely plan on staying at the Coral Princess again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise! A must-stay in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia_Guy
Reviews.Content: WOW! The Coral Princess Inn was more than we imagined! My husband I stayed at the Coral Princess our first week of our honeymoon and we could not have been more pleased. When we checked in, Janisse greeted us with a smile and informed us that we had been upgraded to the King Suite since it was our honeymoon! (I communicated with the hotel via email before our visit and found everyone to be extremely helpful). Janisse and Glenda were particularly helpful and pleasant during our entire stay!! We expected the rooms to be extremely small, however, found our room to be more than ample. We were in room #24 which is on the second floor in the back area of the hotel. We definitely recommend requesting one of these rooms. The floors are marble throughout the room and bathroom. The bathroom had a shower/tub combo and the tub had jacuzzi jets which was a pleasant surprise as well. The closet/wardrobe has drawers and provides limited space for hanging clothes. The courtyard area was beautiful and the continental breakfast each morning was more than sufficient (croissants, ham, cheese, waffles, oatmeal, juices). The room had a mini fridge stocked with beer, water and wine. The bottles of water were only $1 and the beer was $2 which is much less you would expect for a minibar. One note - they do not have a full size ironing board in your room, so be prepared to use a small tabletop board if you must iron. The location of the hotel is perfect - we ate at 2 great restaurants on Magdalena (hotel's street): Cieto Lindo (Mexican) and Ramiros (fine dining). The beach is about a 3 minute walk straight up from the hotel. Walgreens, as everyone mentioned is right around the corner and open 24 hours. The bus (B21) drops you off almost right in front of the hotel. Note: if you ride the buses make certain to have change as they don't accept bills or credit cards. So, all said and done, we definitely recommend this hotel and if we return to San Juan will stay again at the Coral Princess Inn. Enjoy! Guy & Cynthia Willis, Oklahoma

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel but the rooms are tiny!”
Reviews.Author: wendy949
