Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the Coral Princess was very enjoyable as the location and restaurants in the near vicinity are great. The continental breakfast offered in the morning is very adequate and the surroundings and decor are very pleasant. The hotel staff are also very pleasant and obliging. The only downside to the hotel is the size of the rooms - even for a boutique hotel they are tiny! There is hardly room for 2 people to move around the room and you certainly wouldn't want to spend any length of time just hanging in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent location at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: ankh1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the main reason my wife and I enjoyed our trip to Puerto Rico. It was our first time there, August 4th thru 10th, and probably our last. We chose this hotel because of all the great reviews and its in between all the places we wanted to visit. We visited the caves on the west side and biobay on the east side and the rain forest - which is a must. And Old San Juan too which is just a bunch of shopping except for the two forts. First off, we picked up our rental car and drove towards the hotel. People in Puerto Rico tend to drive fast and change lanes often. Growing up in a big city, I'm used to congestion but changing lanes without signals and very often is a little unnerving. Anyway, we found that we missed our turnoff for the hotel and ended up in Old San Juan. No big deal, the street turns around there due to ocean and takes you right back to Condado and basically straight to the hotel on the one way street. They only have 4 spaces in front of hotel or parking at a lot one block down. We arrived around 1 pm and all the spaces were empty. (We only had to park in the $10 lot one day). Check in was fast and courteous. No problems. Had a room on 2nd floor and perfect size for two people. Nice little refrig. for stowing leftovers and pop purchased at Walgreens right around the corner. Simple breakdown. Hotel was very good price and great location. Only 4 free parking spaces and usually filled up by 5 pm. $10 daily parking one block away if you show ticket to front desk. Walgreens one block away to meet all essentials. Beach two blocks away and very nice with good waves. Good choice of restaurants within walking distance. Recommend Via Appia for italian and Piu Bella for a great selection of sandwiches. Plenty of police around and never felt worried about safety. If you look for change on the ground, you will be happy, we found two dollar bills, about 30 pennies, a nickel, about 5 dimes and a sterling silver ring. Its always good to be aware of your surroundings. Adds to the adventure of life and helps the pocket book. Buses are hit and miss. I'd recommend a taxi for old San Juan or short drive with rental car but make sure you park in free spot. Not well marked and saw alot of tickets. $75 dollar ticket. (Gas was .70 a liter) breakfast included and had meat, bread, pastry, oatmeal, cereal, juice, yogurt and some other things. Perfect filler before heading out on day trips. Pool is small but clean. Hot tub has alot of jets. Plenty of nooks to read books in or chat. Chaise lounges on 3rd floor for sunning. Room was cleaned around 2:30 pm. Front desk always glad to help. If I ever wanted to go back to Puerto Rico, I'd definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We want to keep this Place All to ourselves...Go ahead stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: livi1212
Reviews.Content: WOW...The 1st word that comes to mind..a true Jewel..The Staff Top Notch...The Room...LOVED it!!!...THE Decor...Like I said wow..

Reviews.Title: “cozy, affordable and close to the best of PR”
Reviews.Author: travelKC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this little hotel for three days of our honeymoon after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and I must say, we were not disappointed. Some of the reviews had been mixed, and we had trouble deciding upon an affordable hotel in the San Juan area. We knew we wanted to stay in a boutique hotel, not a huge resort full of families and this fit the bill. The hotel is conveniently located to lots of shops and restaurants and it's just a short trip to Old San Juan where we spent several of our days. The rooms are aiming for a contemporary style and the bathrooms were nicely sized. The one disappointment was that our room was not at all near ready upon our arrival, despite my confirming our arrival time prior to our trip. The attendant at the front desk tried to be accomodating and put our bags in the hotel office while we wandered around. We came back a little while later and our room still was not ready, and the maid was standing around, not cleaning. Finally, the room was ready and the clerk did give us a discounted rate for our trouble. Despite the rocky start, our visit was great. THe small pool in the side yard is charming, but don't expect to be able to swim laps. The rooftop deck was great, though i've heard it's not accessible if someone has rented the penthouse (which is on the same floor). We attempted to soak in the hottub one evening, but the chemicals weren't balanced and it wasn't particularly enticing for that reason. Breakfast was perfect--coffee and croissants. Just a little continental treat. This place was a great bang for the buck, especially if you're like us and spend all of your time out sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Caution!!! Make Sure You Don't Have to Cancel Your Reservation!”
Reviews.Author: atlbusnman
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service with cancelation of booking! Make sure you are going to stay at this hotel because if not they will not cancel your booking and will charge your credit card for full payment. I travel for business on a regular basis and have never had such an issue with cancelation. I was to stay at the hotel this past February and contacted the hotel via phone to cancel the reservation outside the booking cancelation policy timeline. The hotel representative informed me that I had to cancel via my travel agent. I left my name and requeseted for the hotel manger to contact me back. The hotel never called back. I tried to cancel my reseratation via the online booking agent and was directed back to the hotel to cancel. I contacted the hotel again and spoke to the manager, Louis, and was again directed back to the booking agent. Booking agent said to contact hotel again. Finally out of desparation emailed the hotel to cancel the reservation. The hotel took advantage of all this processing time and let the reservation cancelation time lapse and then charged me for full stay. Make sure you are definately going to commit to visiting this hotel when making a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL! DEFINITELY STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Vacation07
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my vacation in Puerto Rico. June 29th through July 8. We stayed at 3 different hotels so we could explore the whole island and ALL 3 hotels were great because of using trip advisor. ALWAYS use trip advisor even if hotels.com gives it 5 star. My sister, friends and I stayed at Lazy Parrot, Wyndham Rio Mar Resort and Coral Princess. This hotel is so so so nice!!! The location is great the appearance on outside and inside is great. Great staff. Its only about 25 rooms and the colros of the place is so warm and inviting. Cream colors, exotic flowers and plants.It has a modern, boutique type design to the place. When you first walk in, it hot because the way its designed the doors and windows are open but believe me, the AC DOES WORK WELL because it was freezing when we first walked in. Breakfast was good! The room was really nice inside. Cable tv/ internet/ minibar with cokes, wine and beer. Room service was great. The colors in the room was a mint green with dark brown wood furniture. The walls were a mint green. On the 3rd level, there is a full size kitchen and pool table in this living area for all guest to use. Its where the 2 suites are but anyone can use it. The location is great!!! I can't say that enough. You can walk to the beach with no problem. Touristic area where police is walking around or ridnig bikes. I always felt safe. There is a walgreens around the corner which is great since walgreens does cash back option and in PR there is not a Bank of America. We walked to many shops and resturants. Gucci, Louis, etc...a very upscale area. Downtownish but not crowded or trafficy. DEFINITELY A MUST STAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Frequent-Flyer-Mommy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times now and each time I have had a positive experience. My last time was in December 2006. After having just returned from Puerto Rico and stayed at the Villa Del Sol (HORRIBLE) I realized how important it is to write reviews so other travelers know what to expect. I have 2 children (4yr old and 2yr old) and although this is not really a hotel geared for children they have been friendly and helpful. it is meant to be a quiet boutique style hotel so if you have small children you might want to keep this in mind. The common areas are all pretty and intimate. The rooms are tastefully decorated however they are starting to show some wear. A new coat of paint would remedy this. They are on the smaller side by US standards but more than adequate. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: andyctree
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped off in San Juan on our way through the Carribean this past summer, and choose the Coral Princess because of how highly it was rated. And it lived up to all of the reviews. I had an amazing stay here. I only wish it was longer. The room was very nice, and clean. My wife especially like the jets in the tub. It was very close to the beach, and within walking distances of almost everything. The breakfast was fantastic. I would definetly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess is terrific”
Reviews.Author: ladolcevitabequia
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Coral Princess after reading reviews right here...we were not disappointed...the staff were terrific, esp. Janisse and Glinda at the front desk, they were both extremely helpful....the room was terrific, we had a penthouse and it was lovely...great location, convenient to the buses, shopping, restaurants, rental car places, etc...the breakfast was a little disappointing in that there were only fresh bananas two mornings, the other fruit was tinned, but they have croissants, pastries, toast, cereal, yogurt, orange juice, coffee, tea, milk, sliced ham...the bar fridge in the room came in very handy for keeping water cold for our next days ventures...we'd stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: LeftenantMonterey_CA
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a small intimate hotel nestled in a city neighborhood, versus the high rises on the beach with casinos etc, this is an excellent choice. We spent the last night of our Vieques-Culebra vacation at the Coral Princess in the Condado neighborhood of San Juan. It's two blocks from the beach and shops, and five or ten minutes from the airport. Room with Queen bed was $115 but taxes made it about $142. The hotel was renovated about 6 years ago with Mexican tiles in the courtyard and marble in the bath, colorful art throughout. Nice grotto with palms, pool, and breafast area (included in the room price). Staff was friendly and helpful recommedning an excellent restaurant a couple blocks away "Marisqueria Miro" where we dined on fabulous Catalonian seafood with wonderful Spanish red wine (Arzuage Crianza 2004) recommended by our lively waiter Marcello. Good bed. Good Value. We really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravellerVera
Reviews.Content: Check in desk is in a corridor. We had to move out of the way 3 times to let other guests/staff members in and out of the hotel. After check-in we battled our way through the potted jungle (difficult to pass down the passageway without getting your eye poked by palm fronds) to our room. There was a long black hair in the sink, the bathroom door would not latch shut. Having been told that this was a quiet hotel, we were not pleased to have somebody above our room seemingly moving furniture about and a bunch of people well within hearing distance having conversations until well after 11.30pm. The next day we went out and about, returning to our room after 2.00pm to find that the room had not been serviced. The maid finally came at 3.00pm in the middle of our siesta! The third day when we returned to our room we found that the furniture, and all of our possessions, had been moved around the room and the bedside lights had been changed, one of the old ones being left outside the door. As this was our last day it surely would have made better sense to wait 24 hours until we had checked out? Breakfast buffet was ok but not brilliant. On the 2 occasions we requested a taxi/cab one came promptly. On our last visit to San Juan we stayed at the Comfort Inn a few streets away. This was just as conveniently located and was definitely better value for money. If we return to San Juan in the future we will stay at the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as everyone says...”
Reviews.Author: SnCollins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four days after a vacation in Vieques. The hotel is okay from the outside and located in a nice, mostly residential neighborhood. It truly is one block from a very pretty beach, and is close to a lot of the restaurants and bars, along with casinos/ATM's/Internet cafes, etc in Condado. It is a $12.00 cab ride to Old San Juan, or there is rumored to be a trolley and buses, but we saw no trolleys (ever) and only a few buses. We found the taxis, though more expensive, to be much more convenient. Their rates are set in the tourist zones of Condado, OSJ, Isla Verde, etc. The rate to the airport is $17.00. Regarding the hotel, we were surprised to see how small everything was. The pictures made it look bigger and from the reviews I read, I didn't recall reading this. Rooms: Our room was the smallest room I had ever stayed in by far. We saw other rooms on the first floor while the maids were cleaning and all were very small. We stayed in Room 6. We paid $153 a night with taxes and other fees. I judged that it was about 11'x12', plus a VERY small bathroom. The jacuzzi tub is a bathtub, only large enough for one person, with a couple of jets. We had one queen bed, a desk, and a minibar in the room. No storage for suitcases, very little room to hang or store clothes. There was one piece of nice art and that is the best thing I can say about the room. The bed was average and the linens were scratchy. By far the worst thing about the room was that it was terribly loud. It is located, along with several other rooms, right off the pool, the breakfast area, and the area where the maids park their cleaning supply cart for the entire morning. If you plan on sleeping past 6:30 in the morning at this hotel, don't stay there, or ask for a quieter room on the second or third floor. The first two mornings we were awakened by plates in the breakfast area, and then by our upstairs 'neighbors' sliding around chairs and walking around in high heels. Very frustrating. Keep in mind this is a small hotel and you are literally paying for a bedroom, not an actual hotel room. The living areas are nice, and they apparently expect you to your time in them or outside the hotel. Service: Housekeeping does a very nice job. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Check-in was easy. Living Areas: There is a lovely patio off of the reception area and some of the rooms. The pool and breakfast area are off the back side of the patio. The pool is extremely small, has four chairs, and is surrounded by barbed walls. It's not overly usable, but will keep you cool. On the third floor there is a nice kitchen w/ frig, microwave, etc that can be used by guest, a pool table, dining table, and an outside patio with a table/chairs and hot tub. Dining/Drinks: There is a minifridge in the room with beer/wine/soda. The prices are very reasonable, although we never used it. The breakfast is from 7:00-10:00 I believe, and is yogurt, fruit, ceral, lunchmeat, croissants, coffee, and orange juice. There are several restaurants around the hotel that are average. Overall our impression of the restaurants in San Juan was not good. We had the worst meal I've ever had anywhere at Mofongos, down along the water at the cruise piers in Old San Juan. We paid $70 for two of the worst meals I've ever seen and my husband was very sick that night after dinner. Excursions: We rented a car from Avis, just down the street, for $55 a day including insurance and drove ourselves out to see the Camuy Caves (note they are not open on Monday or Tuesday). The caves are absolutely amazing and shouldn't be missed! It is $12.00 pp to get in and $3.00 to park. Plan on waiting unless all trolleys are up and running (unlikely). The Marriott offers this same tour for $120 a person, or there are independent companies that charge $60-$70pp. We also saw the Oricebo Observatory and Museum. Definitely worth it also, but might be very difficult for those who are "out of shape" or handicapped....it's 500+ steps to get up to the museum and overlook. I believe it was $5.00 per person to get into the museum. Overall, the hotel is really just average. If you plan on being up very early and don't mind SMALL spaces, the hotel might be okay for you. If I were to go back, I would choose the Hotel Milano in Old San Juan (it's cheaper and in a better location, not to mention nicer) or one of the hotels on the beach in Condado and pay the difference. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dcmath
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed at the Coral Princess for 5 nights, it was a really cute small hotel ,with art all over. The rooms we're small, but we hardly stayed in the rooms because we we're so busy exploring the island. The hotel offred a continental breakfast every morning, which was crossants and juice , the had banana's one day which , we're the best I ever had. The hotel is in avery busy section of the Condado area . Parking is non exsistant, we lucked up a couple of nights to find parking in front of the hotel. The downside of the hotel is the MOSQUITO infestation , We had mosquito's in our room, we woke with bites all over. SO off is a must. Overall we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and choice”
Reviews.Author: edwis
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here after first 3 choices were full - glad it worked that way- this is quaint boutique style place, all refreshed, less than 2 blocks from beach and the Marriott resort/casino. If you love higher priced places, over priced food/drinks/ lobby, then stay at Marriott or such. this is a comfortable, all staff friendly and very accomocating. nice breakfast in tropical setting, small but private pool, easy walk to good food places. safe and secure. Very happy with stay here. will do again

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: sucharj
Reviews.Content: I have to say it, I was a little down when I finally saw the hotel. After I read all the reviews on this site I was expecting something really great for the price. At the end, it was OK, nothing more. The problem is that in Puerto Rico there are no cheap good value hotels. So this is a good option if budget is to consider. My room was almost 160$ a night including taxes (125$ base rate), I would not pay that much in another city for what it is. It is OK if what you need is a room to pass by while you are getting on a cruise, or if you plan ONLY to sleep in there. I suggest you take a look at the candid travel pics of this hotel to know what you will get. Pros: Well located (hart of Condado) Clean room Nice public places and very nice tropical gardening all around the place LCD TV with lots of channels Free internet in the room (Thereâ€™s no Business center so you will need your laptop or use one of the front desk PCs) Nice minibar (only beverages) Cons: There was no water pressure at all on the shower witch made really difficult the job. They say they have 4 free parking slots but were always full, I think the hotel staff also use them. The pool is just not functional, it is around walls in a very small area. The continental breakfast was a down.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: siamesecat2965
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before and night after our cruise (May 5 and 13). Nice, clean, no frills hotel. Rooms are comfortable, although not overly large, but with nice flat panel tvs, jacuzzi tubs, lots of nice fluffy towels, etc. Each room also has a wine chiller, stocked with water, soda ($1 each) and space to keep your own drinks cool. Staff was VERY accomodating. Held our luggage after check-out while we played tourist in Old San Juan, and also on our return after the cruise. Arrived before 9am after cruise, and they not only held the luggage, but offered breakfast, bottled water, and allowed us to sit by the pool. Staff is very friendly and helpful, will call you a cab, recommend places to eat, etc. Area has lots of restaurants, plus 24 hour Walgreens around the corner. About 2 blocks away is an internet cafe, which i used to check in for my flight and print boarding pass. The beach is about 3 blocks, and the bus to OSJ (.75 each way) picks you up around the corner, and the return stop is across the street. prices were lower than some of the big resorts closer to the pier, and i believe it was about $16 to the pier by taxi, well worth it, in my opinion. Didn't use the pool or hot tub, but they are clean and well kept...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rbmotox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn the night before our cruise. The hotel is small and clean. It's a no frills hotel with decent beds and the rooms are VERY quiet. It's a short walk to the beach. The staff was friendly and helpful. It's very near the cruise dock, so near that I timed our trip to the ship. From the time we left the hotel to the time we were in our cabin was exactly 30 minutes. 10 to 15 minutes maximum in the taxi and about the same to get checked in with RCCL. You could spend more at nearby hotels if you need something more. For us this hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: ae82
Reviews.Content: After doing weeks and weeks of seaching for a hotel in San Juan, my girlfriend and I picked the Coral Princess Inn. Hotel: We stayed on the first floor. The hotel is very clean, and has a great atmosphere. We had a Queen sized bed in our room, and found that there was ample space for our 2 suitcases. You get a small wardrobe which was very handy. There's also a small fridge. The bathroom isn't large, but nor is it cramped. Breakfast was great, and we had many items to pick from. It was cheaper for us to book directly through the hotel. Staff: Very friendly and helpful. Customer service was excellent. Can't ask for much more. Location: About 2 blocks from the beach, and there are many great restaurants nearby. They aren't cheap, but perfect for a nice dinner. There is also a nearby Walgreens which was very convenient. We only took walks on the beach at night, so I have no idea how "nice" Condado beach is. The hotel property is also easily accessible from the highway. Watch out for rush-hour San Juan traffic. Here's a hint: Go to east (Fajardo, etc) during the weekday. Save going west for weekends. We found that to work very well for us. Parking: We had a rental car all 4 days of our trip. There are 3 spots infront of the hotel, and only 1 night we were lucky enough to get it. Otherwise, we parked at a nearby parking lot down the street for $10 a day. It's steep, but expected. Overall: It's great that this hotel isn't a large hotel with bustling with tourists. We loved how "at home" you feel once you've setteled in. Very unique, and I would definitely be a return visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night last year after a cruise and would definitely recommend it to anyone. The hotel was in a nice location near to the beach and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. The room itself was very clean and a fine size for us and the pool and hottub were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: la_globetrotteuse
Reviews.Content: I read pretty much all the reviews for hotels in PR, plus Vieques and decided to stay in Coral Princess, I was there mid april and I didn't find the hotel to be as great as all the reviews I'd read. It's a nice simple hotel if you're on a budget, in an excellent location.Restaurants and supermarkets are within walking distance. Great for someone who doesn't have a car. Breakfast wasn't fantastic. Some of the staff were really friendly but not all. The air con like most hotels in the Condado area only have an off and on setting and cos this hotel was swarming with mosquitos at the time I went, you have two options, to freeze or get bitten so I chose to freeze! If your looking for a good price, basic accommodation and a great location, this is the place for you

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: lakesideliving
Reviews.Content: My travel agent recommended this place. We needed a place to stay one night after finishing a 7 night cruise. Definitely a gem. Somehow we were given the Penthouse 1. Fantastic room! Spacious, tiled in marble, walk in closet, double sinks, separate toilet and bidet area, and separate jacuzzi tub area. Doors open to a balcony, which leads to the outdoor hot tub. Wine cooler in room stocked with beer and wine at an additional charge. Weight bench and flat screen TV. Having never been to San Juan or Condado, I was surprised of the area in general. Lots of bars on windows of surrounding buildings. Some buildings completely run down. If you are used to city living, this may not bother you. But if you have to stay in San Juan, don't miss this place. Much more charm than a general chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific inn, newly renovated and charming!”
Reviews.Author: bluegrassky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night as we returned to San Juan from a cruise and it was excellent. Our room and bathroom were large and the common areas beautifully decorated. Floors throughout are tile and there are many art pieces on the walls and in specially designed niches. On the main floor is a garden and patio area which is simply breathtaking, with orchids and other tropical plants. Once away from the front desk, you would hardly know you were still in the middle of a large city. There is also a small pool which has been built into a secluded area; a small elevator; and in the back of the main floor, a piano, a breakfast bar, and a microwave. Our room had a refrigerator and internet access. Personally, I would probably not choose this inn if I was traveling with children, mainly because the atmosphere seems better suited to couples or solo travelers. Some areas would also be difficult to navigate with a stroller or extra luggage. The Old Town is a short drive or taxi ride away, and there are a number of good restaurants within walking distance. There is a US post office and a drugstore with grocery items about a block away. The staff was exceptionally accommodating and followed up with us immediately on an item we had left behind. We would definitely recommend this inn to anyone looking for an oasis in the middle of San Juan...it was the perfect end to our vacation. S. Rey-Barreau

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful outdoor spaces in the middle of Condado”
Reviews.Author: dgdvm
Reviews.Content: Most of our vacation in Puerto Rico was spent in areas other than San Juan, so we really only needed a day here and there before and after the flight. I found it extremely difficult to find any place in March that would take reservations for under 3 days. The Coral Princess allowed us to book a one day and a two day stay at the beginning and end of our trip, and were very nice over the phone. Our room was small, but no smaller than anywhere we stayed in Puerto Rico. It was clean and smartly decorated, and each room contained a wine refrigerator with wine, beer, soda, water, etc on the honor bar principle. There was a small kitchenette downstairs and upstairs to use if you were staying awhile, a piano for guests to use in the bar area, and a lovely sitting room/library that I wish I had time to use. Their ourdoor spaces were gorgeous with big plants and flowers everywhere - almost enough to make you forget you were in the middle of a big city. The rooftop deck has a hottub and the top floor also has a pool table in case your weather is bad. My only complaint is that we were in a room off a long hallway and the walls are thin -if you have noisy people who like to cackle and squeal in the hallway it will be a little noisy - my mantra - always bring earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: chadmc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed several nights here with my wife, son and his girlfriend. Here's my take on the place: pros: very clean rooms nice staff reasonable continental breakfast interesting lay out (rooms for pool, cards, etc.) wireless internet cons: the night desk clerk (as friendly as a cold sore) rooms a little small a little noisy suggestions for the hotel: upgrade linens add glasses rather than plastic cups larger towels better safebox access We picked Condado based on several reviews...but it seems a bit run down. We couldn't tell if it was on it's way down or up. Police presence was impressive, though couldn't tell if this was in response to a threat that we were unaware of. The beach was 'ok".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and interesting hotel! STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Mark2211
Reviews.Content: What a find! Although the hotel is not in the old town, it is still in the nice area of Condodo. Whilst this is a touristy area, don't let that put you off - it is a nice, safe and relaxing area. The hotel has a very nice feel to it, with nice rooms, a number of nice patio areas and a small pool. It does not have a bar or anywhere to eat but do not let that put you off as you there are plenty around. It has a B&B feel to it whilst having everything you need to relax and enjoy your stay. The staff are first class (they organised me a great trip to the rain forest) and the rooms are have everything you need. I was traveling alone yet they made me feel most welcome on my trip. Well done the Coral Princess Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Drifting_clouds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after spending a few nights at the dismal pit known as the Iberia Hotel. What a wonderful relief it was to move here! For only about $50 more the experience was a huge step up. The Coral was modern and well appointed. Lots of attractive plants and everything seemed airy and open. The room had a nice king bed, a fridge, a flat screen TV and a jetted tub. The breakfast was served buffet style outside and was an unexpected treat as we didn't know that was included. We had stayed at the Caribe Hilton in SJ a few weeks before and for more than double the price had no breakfast, so this breakfast was a nice addition and had a big selection. The pool is small but nice to jump into when you get hot walking the streets shopping. The staff was attentive to questions but not chatty. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: travellin4work
Reviews.Content: My travel agent recommended this little gem. Located in a suburb 10 minutes for Old San Juan close to the beach and numerous great resturants the Coral Princess was a sharp contrast to the large resort we had stayed in on the first part of our vacation. We had a large, clean room with a well stocked mini bar ($2 for a tin of the local brew) that was only three minutes walk to some great local eateries that the front desk staff directed us to. Taxi to Old San Juan is about $14 and the bus is .75

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: milril44
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to San Juan, going by the mostly positive reviews here, I found the Coral Princess Inn to be almost perfect. We stayed in room 15 which was fairly large, clean and adequate. Marble floors and bathroom, mini fridge, a/c and ceiling fan, flat panel tv's. The upstairs open lounge area was very nice, although we didn't get a chance to use it. The pool, which we did use, was small, but very nice. They stored our luggage until our room was ready. The included breakfast was nice. The day time desk person was knowledgeable about the area, but the evening person was not so much. The beach was only two blocks away. Taxi to the airport seemed to cost about $15 + bag fees. Taxi to Old San Juan is $12. I can highly recommend Via Appia on Ashford Ave, it is a Italian and pizza neighborhood joint filled with locals and the food and service are excellent. Walgreens was close by and very handy. I only have two complaints. The hotel is in the Condado area. There is not a whole lot in the Condado area aside from a three-four block stretch of restaurants and stores on Ashford Ave. If you wandered even a block or two outside of the touristy area, it got really seedy and there were a lot of homeless beggars around. The other complaint is that the water pressure in the shower was non-existent, a very weak spray and the water kept changing temperature throughout the shower, so you were either freezing or scalded repeatedly. Aside from these two problems, the Coral Princess Inn would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Five star”
Reviews.Author: farmer000000
Reviews.Content: Well what a wonderful little hotel. The room was clean and quiet,and the staff was very helpfull. We stayed here two days before our cruise. The cruise did not leave until well after our check out and they have a place where you can safely put your bags.I will stay here next time I am in San Juan. I booked here because of the reviews I read here and there all right. FIVE STAR *****

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: G+10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights after a cruise. We arrived at the hotel about 11:00 am, and our room was not ready. They allowed us to put our luggage in a room so we could go walk about until our room was ready. We went to eat at a place right around the corner. Stopped in at Walgreens for some tanning lotion, and then we headed back to the hotel about 1:00 pm. They got us into our room. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. They have a frig in the room that has soda, water, beer, and wine for very affordable prices. $2 for beer and $1 for water. You could also place items in there that you brought yourself. We got changed and hit the beach 2 blocks away. Clean and spacious beach. Rented two chairs. We took a bio-luminescense bay tour that night. The breakfasts in the morning were sufficient and just like many others have commented on. The second day we went on an El Yunque tour and then tanned on the top floor of the hotel where the hot tub is located. Very relaxing. The pool is very small and hard to get any sun. We went to the Marriott for drinks that evening and dinner at the Japanese restaurant next door to the Marriott. Certainly not an upscale hotel (we actually got picked up for one of our tours at the Ritz-Carlton...NICE), but it was clean, pretty and affordable. If you aren't looking for a resort, this hotel is right for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “stay...stay...stay, without a doubt”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbug101
Reviews.Content: We took the red eye and got to the hotel at 10:30 am. Our room was not ready, however we were able to store our luggage, change, and doze/read out by the pool. They came to get us when the room was ready. It was lovely. The bed was very comfortable. We even had a jetted tub. The hot/cold water was sensitive, but we never ran out of either. The front desk area is small, but not a problem. They arranged for us to go sailing, recommended restaraunts with good Puerto Rican food, and booked massages for us. The grounds are very lush, there are even orchids gowing on the plants. It is within walking distance for everything good in Condando. We stayed a few days before a cruise and liked it so much that we are thinking of booking another visit for our whole family. We stayed our last night of the trip at a big hotel in Old San Juan. I wish we stayed at the Coral Princess...it's a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NestorMitrea
Reviews.Content: We bracketed our PR vacation with a stay here on our arrival and departure from San Juan - two days at the start and one at the finish. This is an extremely clean hotel - with some sweet touches that take it from the mundane to something quite special. We rate it as excellent for it's class. They have little outdoor sitting areas spread around the building. If you are traveling with small children we highly recommend getting a room that is off of one of these courtyards. We put the kids to bed and were able to sit outside in the courtyard until we tired. Having checked in and out twice we can attest to the fact that the rooms aren't all the same size. Some are quite small and others are quite comfortable... I think it is the luck of the draw. We recommend room 25. Someone else mentioned it and we heartily agree... breakfast needs some protein... boiled eggs or peanut butter or something else simple. The kids were hungry not too soon after we ate. The Cafe Del Angel around the corner is lovely for authentic Puerto Rican food and very casual. Ramiro's is across the street a ways and truly unbelievable for fine dining - expect to pay a lot for a dinner there but you will not be disappointed. The desk staff were subdued but polite... no complaints there. One thing - if you are renting a car at the airport and driving in to the hotel, be prepared... Magdalena Street is small and off the main road it was, initially, almost impossible to find. We finally had to follow a sweet lady in her car to the hotel. Once we got the lay of the land, it wasn't hard to get around though. The plants that line the main floor walkways are lush and fragrant, they turn a simple walk to breakfast into a tropical experience. The pool was small but clean. Our kids seemed to think it was the best pool ever... All in all a perfect mid-priced inn. If we go back to San Juan we will definitely stay at this inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cozy, but small. Do not expect luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Prodigal_Hoosier
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Coral Princess. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very small. The bed not particularly comfortable. The sheets were anything but crisp. The pillows were small and flat. The best part of the Inn is outside the room. The environs are warm and cozy, and secluded. There seemed to be few people about, but the Inn was full. Breakfast was totally lame. We will only return to the Coral Princess if we are going with a group of friends or family. The third floor has a nice, roomy area with a large dinner table, sofas, and a full kitchen that would be great for evening get togethers with friends to swap stories from the day of site seeing and beach going. The nearby beach was clean and provided us plenty of room even during this spring break week. I highly recommend the area and the beach, but will choose a more full featured hotel on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice property-great location”
Reviews.Author: travelgal50
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I recently spent 2 nights at the Inn pre-cruise. We found the previous reviews to be accurate. The Inn is similar to staying in a villa witha private pool, multiple sitting areas, a reading room, rooftop terrace etc. The location is excellent- close to restaurants ( angel cafe for puerto rican food, Danne's for Italian), the beach ( about a block and one half), salons (pedicure/manicure), and multiple shopping venues. There is a great little gelato place right around the corner that is good for a light lunch. My daughter basically had the pool all to herself which was great after a day of sightseeing . The breakfast was more than adequate with croissants, cold cereal, yogurt, ham, cheese, pastries, juices, and wonderful coffee. The room itself was a bit small ( we had 2 double beds, a whirlpool tub, flat screen TV, microwave, and small fridge, but was certainly adequate to our needs. The mattresses on the beds were a bit uncomfortable and should probably be replaced. Other than that we found our stay at the Inn to be pleasant and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maximum_Mary
Reviews.Content: Very well located Inn. Their attitude is refreshing and very accomodating (willing to please), especially Janisse Roldes at reception desk. We stayed for 2 nights - March 6 & 7 of 2007 and they were very willing to help us in any way they could. Which was so refreshing after staying in Fajardo. We enjoyed our stay while we toured Old San Juan. The only suggestion is that they add "peanut butter" to the continental breakfast - you need the protein for walking in "Old San Juan"! Very clean accomodation and good location - we would stay here again - felt safe and welcome. Mary - Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay!”
Reviews.Author: thekyndone
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay at the Coral Princess, and what a wonderful time we had at this property. We arrived late on a Monday night and found our very clean room still waiting for us. Breakfast each morning was more than sufficient; great coffee, too. The staff was extremely helpful with all of our requests. My children(9 and 5 years old) were perfectly content with the pool on the days we did not go to the beach. They also loved the roof top jacuzzi and pool table. For the week we where there, my wife commented that "the inn felt like our own private condo." The restaurants nearby (cielito lindo and via appia; where our favorites) were all fine for a young family. Overall, we loved the Coral Princess and can't wait to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Cute - but...........”
Reviews.Author: sf123
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews through trip advisor we booked a three night pre-cruise stay at the Coral Princess Inn. The hotel is very cute and very, very clean with lots of nice areas around the hotel for sitting and relaxing. The breakfast area was very nice. I will say though that we had the smallest hotel room (#8) we have ever stayed in. There was a double bed with barely enough room to walk around it - in fact, we both banged our shins on the corners of the bed several times. There was no closet, only a small armoire with 2 hangers. We did not unpack our suitcases - there was no room. We thought we better get used to it as we were going to an inside cabin on the ship - but believe me, that was way bigger! On the last day, we were able to store our bags in a locked room for the afternoon with a bunch of other luggage (very convenient). All in all, it is a cute hotel...........fine to stay in for a night or two, but I sure wouldn't plan a weeks holiday there - at least not in that room. The $120 US night charge, with taxes, ended up costing $181.71 per night Cdn. - reasonable I guess for Puerto Rico, but................

Reviews.Title: “King and Queen at the Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRican
Reviews.Content: Quaint, charming, and in a great location. After a hot (and fun) day of walking around Old San Juan, we went back to the Coral Princess and got in the rooftop hot tub. We had it all to ourselves and those foot massage jets in the bottom of the hot tub were the perfect remedy to our sore feet. Afterwards, we played a game of pool in the upstairs suite, which is open to all guests. I wish we'd had stayed longer than two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jonsdivetravel
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after reading the reviews of another hotel we had already booked for the two night stay after our cruise. The reviews of the other hotel were so bad and this one so good for just a few dollars more that we weren't sure what we would find. We were very pleasantly suprised to find it just as described in the reviews and in their webwsite. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The common area upstairs is just great if you have friends stop over to say hi or just to relax with a good book. The front desk clerks are extremely helpful and always pleasant. For all the amenities available here at such a great price, I would not hesitate to book it again. The only drawback was the hot and cold water flucuates back and forth when taking a shower but being only two blocks from the beach and resaurants certainly makes up for the minor inconvienence.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: kot_in_boots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem among the generic â€œinnsâ€� and the monstrous high rises. It is clear that the owners make an effort to create a memorable and comfortable place to stay for a reasonable price. It is decorated with dark wood furniture, marble floors, and authentic oil on canvas artwork. The breakfast area where bagels, tea, coffee, and pastries are served, is partially outdoors. The rooftop, which is directly connected to the two suites on the top floor, has lounging chairs and a hot tub. The service is excellent. The reason why Coral Princess can't quite compete with top dollar hotels is because it lacks views and occasionally has mismatched furniture pieces, however the ambiance sufficiently makes up for all that. It is located on a safe, quite and well lit street one block south and parallel to Ashford av. walking distance to Condado beach, the Marriott hotel (best casino), and the restaurant where the original mojitos are still served.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical surroundings in a quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: sundaynewz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Coral Princess Inn (Feb. 16-19). It was a cozy inn with a carribbean feel. I loved the tiled walkways with all of the tropical plants surrounding us. The pool and jacuzzi were small, but refreshing. Our room had a comfortable bed, and was just the right size for two people. The complimentary breakfast included fruit, yogurt and pastries and the friendly staff was very knowledgable about the area. Condado beach was only 2 blocks away and the bus stop to Old San Juan was just across the street (you can ride the bus to the city for 75 cents exact change). It was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: Foxboro
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Coral Princess ( Feb 10-14th). As many others have stated, it is a great little boutique hotel in a convenient area. We liked the hotel and were glad that we stayed there. All of the staff were excellent and very helpful. The weather was sunny and in the 80â€™s every day. Having read all the reviews, there were a few things that we didnâ€™t expect. The rooms are small and have no closets, only a half sized armoire. There are no security safes in the room, you have to rent them. There were none available our whole stay. The pool only has space for about three sun recliners. When the hotel is at capacity the breakfast area can get very crowded and seating is a problem. All in all it is a nice little property within walking distance to three beaches: Condado (great for kids), Ocean Park (long stretch of sand with warm water but rough surf) and the beach around the corner that has chairs for rent. It is also central to all the night life. The area seemed very safe to us.

Reviews.Title: “just right!”
Reviews.Author: lcosette
Reviews.Content: Coral Princess Inn was the perfect little hotel for us. It was in a great location, about 3 blocks from the beach, 2 blocks from walgreens, 2 blocks from the bus to old san juan, and surrounded by lots of restaurants and shops. There are also other larger hotels, such as the mariott, nearby if you want to take advantages of things such as spa services or casinos. We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for 5 nights, and the price was incredibly reasonable for what we received. The room was small, but was clean and the bathroom and floor were marble, which was nice. We had cable and high-speed internet access. There are many places to sit, and a nice walkway with lots of plants. The hotel has a small pool and hot tub which we didn't use, and breakfast every morning from 7-9 which i never woke up early enough to use, but my friend said the breakfast was 'okay'. This is not a luxury hotel, so don't expect lots of amenities. But you can expect all of the basics a hotel should have. overall, i'd definitely stay here again because of the location, cleanliness, friendly staff and mostly because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Inn”
Reviews.Author: Hombregrandedearuba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn last weekend, after reading several reviews on this site. The location is great, extremely central in the Condado area, just 1,5 block away from the Marriott Hotel, and two blocks from the beach. Walgreens is right around the corner, for any little groceries. Being a manager in a 4-Star Renaissance hotel in the Caribbean, I can say that I know where I'm talking about: The hotel has a small reception, with staff that is helpful, and are willing to do an extra step for you. The 25 rooms are among 3 floors, of which the topfloor is the nicest, with the biggest rooms(suites), some sort of living room(nicely maintained), a pooltable, and a outside area with loungchairs and a jacuzzi. On the ground floor, where our room was located, the place is full of plants, (maybe even too full), which gives a very comfortable cozy atmosphere. Breakfast happens there, on nicely maintained furniture. The room we were in was Nr.10, which is actually a room for disabled, so we had no jacuzzi but a shower, which worked out OK. The hotel was full, so there was no choice as to stay in that room. The rooms have a fridge, microwave, a TV, a good airco-unit, but no cutlery in the drawers under the microwave... The fridge was filled with some beverages , which were very cheap ($1,- for Soda, $2,- for beer). The turndown service was up to 4/5 star standard, with daily refreshment of towels, etc... Moreover, which is in my opinion the most important, the place was clean and well maintained, both inside as outside the rooms! The breakfast, which is included, consists daily(!) of: OJ, Coffee, Milk, Flakes, Croissants, 3 kinds of pastries, ham/cheese, yoghurts, marmelade, bananas. Good enough to start your day with. But for a week stay it would be a little boring. The one little difficulty is parking, with only four spots in front of the hotel. My Puerto Rican friend had to park her car everytime on parking lot Magdalena, which is one block away, and is $10,65 for 24 hours. That's the best deal you can get closeby, or you might wanna choose to go and find yourself a spot in the nearby streets. If you are used to big hotels and robotic service, go to those places, and pay double of what you pay here; a nice, cozy and clean(!) place, on a great location and TOP value for money. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value/location”
Reviews.Author: bigfol
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, quiet, but close to the beach, shopping, restaurants, casinos, and it felt very safe on the streets at night. It's been mentioned before, but the 24-hour walgreens a block away was great! The staff were friendly, not super-awesome, but nice enough. The rooms were good, but since it's a low-rise, you're not likely to get a view or natural light in your room. Continental breakfast was superb, mostly due to the beautiful terraced patio in the hotel courtyard. Definately reccomend as a nice, clean, safe, budget accomodation in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Inn”
Reviews.Author: SOAP
Reviews.Content: Corel Princess is a cute little hotel with charming furnishings, decent dÃ©cor and wonderful staff and itâ€™s all worth the price of $125 a night (without taxes). Located on a one way street a mile from the main 26 freeway, itâ€™s a short walk to many restaurants in Condado and a block away from Walgreens and the beach. Jose, the desk clerk was a very nice, amiable, very helpful, polite and accommodating. There is a small shallow swimming pool on the first floor, a Jacuzzi and pool table on the 3rd floor and a piano on the 1st floor. Deli meats, toast, croissants, bananas and yogurt are available for breakfast which is served from 6-10am each morning. There is cable and a fridge in the room which useful for stocking up on snacks and my only very minor issue was the shower which seems to change from hot to cold constantly so we resorted to talking baths in the nice Jacuzzi style bath tubs in the rooms. If you are renting a car there are only a couple of spaces available outside the hotel (which were always in use), but we were able to find parking spots each day across the street from the hotel so never had to pay to park. I am truly a fussy traveler and it took me several months of researching before I settled for this charmer (thanks to previous posts!!) and it was truly worth the money. The rooms are rather small (not as small as some in Europe) and I took a peek into 3 other rooms which are all similar in size and dÃ©cor. Overall itâ€™s a charming little find!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beth_n_shiloh
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at this hotel and we loved it. We loved the hot tub on the roof and spent almost every night up there for sunset. The staff was superb. They helped us with directions, restaurant recommendations, and set up a tour of El Yunque for us. My boyfriend especially appreciated Jose's help. The room was really nice and clean and was a bit small but we spent very little time in it. Yes, the water temperature does fluctuate a bit, but honestly, it's not a big deal. Our room had a fridge where you could purchase cheap bottles of water and soda. My boyfriend thought there was a bit too much hallway noise, but compared to other hotels I've stayed at I think it was pretty minimal. There was a continental breakfast which was completely purchased things from Costco, but it was adequate. And they served it until 10:00 which was nice. Finally, the pool is small, but was very cute and nice. It is shaded in the afternoon, which was nice for me with my fair skin. There were plenty of nice outdoor spaces to relax, a reading room, a pool table, a kitchen, and laundry facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Little Princess”
Reviews.Author: Kort
Reviews.Content: Fun modern boutique property with many common areas. Hotel is about five years old. Short on info in room but the staff is very helpful. Great artwork and attention to landscape and design. Pool is tiny but usable. Fairly quiet in the rooms given that its all hard surfaces - stone, tile, etc. Recommend for adults. Taxi to airport $14; to Old San Juan $12. A $120 room is $150 with taxes. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: littledaisies
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay at. The room was very clean and nice. The hotel staff were very friendly. I loved it and would go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combo - Hip hotel without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: seg110
Reviews.Content: This is a BEAUTIFUL hotel without any of the "too cool" attitude you might expect from a property with original artwork all over. The staff is friendly but not overbearing, the rooms are very clean, bright, and provide enough space for two people and their luggage spread all over. The courtyard garden is truly exquisite - really a pleasure to walk through and sit in. Coral Princess Inn is a great hotel that is very affordable. There are a few parking spots in front, which is nice because the street parking is limited. Breakfast is everything you need it to be: coffee, juice, pastries, croissants, ham, cheese, bread, cereal, fruit. There is a toaster as well as microwave. The hotel also provide a unique 3rd floor suite that everyone can use. We enjoyed the jacuzzi as well as the pool table. The hotel also has a cute pool. All this in a EXTREMELY well-priced, boutique style hotel. It is literally 1 block to Condado beach which has really soft sand and big waves. Great for body surfing or boogey boarding, You are also around the corner from Ashford Avenue, which is the main drag in Condado. I would recommend taking a taxi (about $13) to Old San Juan for the day and walking around. It is really enjoyable to see the old architecture and forts, and there are fantastic shops there. I really recommend this hotel because it is between Old San Juan and the airport, yet has excellent beaches and won't break the bank while still providing continental breakfast. I will be staying here again, definitely, and so should you!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Stay”
Reviews.Author: chasmccabe
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Coral Princess Inn for a one night stay on Thankgiving evening. While the room was small, it was comfortable, and apart from a touchy hot/cold shower head (which we informed the staff of, who dealt with it asap) we enjoyed our short stay. The breakfast was great, we were right around the corner from Ashford (the main drag) and one block further was the beach. After arriving around 4 pm, we were in the water dodging the big waves at 4:30 pm. A great place to stay for a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrRhythm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. We booked it after reading reviews here, and going to the website. We were really impressed. What a great deal. For the cost it is an absolutely beautiful little hotel in the Condado district where all the great restaurants are. It is a block from the beach, and has lots of convenient stores/businesses nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Honestly, when you walk around the place, for the money it's really nice. Outdoor plant-lined walkways lead to rooms. Once inside, it is lined with marble floors and once upstairs, it is like a penthouse suite. There is a pool table and full kitchen area that looks like an expensive condo. There is a pool on the second floor, and there is a jacuzzi on the roof overlooking the city. The guy at the desk told us this was supposed to be a luxury condo at one point, but the owner decided to make it a hotel. This is why the inside looks like an upscale condo. Our room was large, with huge closets, a sitting area, and a really large marble covered bathroom. All in all this place was a surprising gem and a total amazing deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: SagarMung
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a weekend stay in San Juan. It is located on Calle Magdalena, which runs parallel to the main avenue, Calle Ashford. It's therefore close to all of the restaurants, bars, clubs, etc., but still quiet. There are about four to six parking spots available in front of the hotel, depending on how well the cars are squeezed together. There is street parking on side streets if you are up for looking, but you'll do yourself a favor by having a compact car. Parking rules in the area are marked, though sparingly, and since many people park illegally, you can't pick spots based on where others have parked. The hotel entrance is controlled by an electronic latch, so you must buzz in to enter. The front desk is staffed 24 hours, giving additional security. The staff was incredibly helpful and spoke both English and Spanish fluently. Hotel rooms are arranged around a small courtyard. We stayed in a "Corporate Executive Queen". There was also a night table, dresser, TV, armoire, small fridge, microwave, and kitchenette sink. The bathroom also had a bath tub with jets. There was an internet router with a wired connection available, though we did not use it. The air conditioner and fan were powerful enough to get it cold (actually chilly). The continental breakfast was great, with yogurt, cinnamon and apple loaves, hamm, cheese, croissants, tea, and of course coffee. There is also a small in-ground pool on the property, though it could get crowded fairly quickly. The in-room fridge is stocked with water and soda for $1 each and beer for $2 each, which is only slightly more expensive than the same items at the Walgreen's right around the corner, but much cheaper than buying from vendors on the beach. The hotel is located in the Condado/Santurce area of San Juan, close to many restaurants and amenities. The beach is also only five minutes by foot, though we walked east a bit to find a less rocky portion. As another reviewer mentioned, the taxes add quite a bit to the published rate, but this is a result of local laws, not the hotel or the booking agency. On the whole, we had a good time at the hotel, and it served as a relaxing place to come back to every night. Our only complaint was that checkout time was at 11 a.m. instead of the usual noon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, Great Service, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: D&DWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Coral Princess and we enjoyed our stay. This is the perfect stop for the budget traveler. One thing to keep in mind when traveling in Puerto Rico tourist taxes add up. We didn't find out until we arrived at the hotel. The Expedia price said $99.00/night but with taxes it averaged out $140/ night. This is no fault of the hotel. We booked a room with a double bed for the two of us. It's small but we didn't plan on staying in the hotel much. There is free internet via ethernet cable. Apparently there is wireless but it was not working during our stay. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. There is a ceiling fan and a remote to the air conditioning unit. (The only reason I mention this is because it took some time to figure it out.) The only complaint about the room is the showerhead. It wasn't very strong but it's a very minor detail. As mentioned before on this site there are not many amenities but that did not bother us. The free breakfast was nice. There were fresh bananas, cereal, pastries, yogurt, and croissants. The front desk is very helpful. F.Y.I- If you plan on taking a bus to Old San Juan you need to take B21 and it does not seem to have a schedule. We waited 45 mins one day. The good thing is that it only costs 75 cents one way to Old San Juan. Otherwise expect to pay $12.00+ for cab fare. The beach is a block and a half away. There is plenty to eat in the surround neighborhood particularly on Ashford Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected cancellation penalty”
Reviews.Author: Dolly645
Reviews.Content: Coral Princess Hotel is a charming hotel with good location and a friendly, conscientious staff. BUT HEADS UP-if you do not cancel nine days prior to arrival you will be charged for the entire stay not a one night deposit. If you wish to leave early you will be charged for the entire stay. Also I booked a rate of $115 daily and later learned it did not include a combined daily charge of $8.72 (internet/continental breakfast/cable TV/etc.

Reviews.Title: “cozy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: balog
Reviews.Content: spent 7 nights recently ; no problems; nice room w/ king size bed - smallish, yet cozy...jacuzzi in bathroom...quiet room; clean..nice, small pool...breakfast v. good; workers very helpful, especially for breakfast...nice jacuzzi on roof...close to ALL...2 blks from beach...near restaurants, walgreens, etc..overall v. good experience; will return...

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bitbytravelbug
Reviews.Content: Based on other Tripadvisor reviews, I booked a room for the night of 9/2 prior to a cruise. 15 min. ride from the airport. After a long flight from San Francisco, we checked in, threw on our suits, and were on the beach in 5 min. Beautiful garden setting. The hotel also has original artwork, and a library with books, chess, and board games if you are so inclined. We had room 24, which was quite spacious, and afforded us our own "private" patio outside our wing, with couch, chairs, and coffee table. Luis was full of helpful information. We wanted to eat at a typical Puerto Rican restaurant, and he suggested several within walking distance. We chose Cafe el Angel, and had a delicious dinner of mofongo (pounded, seasoned green plantain) stuffed with seafood. The included breakfast is juice, coffee, toast, danish and cereal. It is served in a very nice outside breakfast area. We enjoyed our breakfast while chatting with fellow guests from the US, Canada, U.K. and Germany. When it came time to go to the cruise pier, Luis called a cab for us, which arrived in about 3 min. 10 min. later, we were at the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Little Inn”
Reviews.Author: senarita
Reviews.Content: I always check on tripadvisor before I stay anywhere. This was a cute small inn that is perfect if you just want a room. If you want entertainment and large swimming pools then the Marriott would be a better choice. They offer a free breakfast bar every morning in a quaint & beautiful courtyard. Luis was extremly helpful several time to us. The walk to the beautiful beach was only 11/2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cozy Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and my partner stayed there at the end of June. The room was small but nicely decorated and extremely clean. The staff was friendly, very helpful and spoke english. The pool area was small but sufficient and they had a nice sun deck. The hotel is centrally located to everything, casino's, beaches, stores, restaurant, clubs. We would definitely stay there again on our next visit to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 6/29-7/5. It was perfect! Price was right! The breakfast was great! It was nice to stay at a small hotel and not have to deal with all the "typical" tourists. It was close to a great beach and lots of restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again if we return to PR.

Reviews.Title: “OK but HEI is a little better”
Reviews.Author: Crusinlions
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Coral Princess for 2 nights in June 2006 prior to our cruise. I was a little disappointed with the place. We stayed at Holiday Inn Express last year and really enjoyed it. The people at the Coral Princess were very nice and helpful. The room was clean. The breakfast left alot to be desired. The hottub was broke. The pool was small but nice. The price was not bad. Overall I would stay again if HEI was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and economical choice in Condado area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely public areas. Good complimentary breakfast in the garden. Service was excellent - all the people at the desk were polite and friendly. Rooms were OK, more plain than the public areas, but with great air conditioning and enjoyed the jacuzzi tub. Everything was clean. Bed linens weren't "luxe" but certainly sufficient. Hotel is a 15 dollar cab ride from airport, and a 2 minute walk from the Marriott, where you can use their casino and beach. Walgreens around the corner convenient for those things you forgot. All in all an excellent choice for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great B & B Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff-Linda
Reviews.Content: We loved our short stay at the Coral Princess in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The rooms were clean and tidy, quite roomy, and the overhead fan was wonderfully quiet so we didn't have to use the AC. Breakfast was included in the price and we really enjoyed the covered, outdoor patio where most people in the hotel congregated each morning to eat and chat. They also have nice areas where you can sit (inside and out) to just relax and read, or chat with others. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had spoken with people staying in other hotels in the area and felt we got the best value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCSM
Reviews.Content: we weren't at this hotel long - we got there at almost midnight and left at 7am the next morning for a snorkeling trip. then we returned at 5pm to pick up our stuff we had stored and left for our cruise. the hotel was nice though. a good budget place- though we were surprised about the taxes. we got a rate of 95 dollars, but with tax it was almost 140! that was surprising, but oh well. what can you do? the rooms are super super small. we could barely fit our two suitecases in there and still move around. the floor is a concrete tile and cold, but seemed clean. the bed looked a little sketchy - very worn linens - but was comfortable. but perhaps that was because i was so tired! :) the bathroom was small, but clean with a decent sized shower. the continental breakfast was better than basic, i though. we had ham and cheese croissant - very nice to start the day. they also had yogurt, juice and coffee. i was happy. the common area is beautiful and the staff is very helpful (stored our luggage all day and called taxis for us). the only thing is, the hotel is hard to get to because of traffic. it is on a one way street that is very congested. we wasted a lot of time stuck in taxis. and it is still 15 dollars to either old san juan or the pan american pier for the cruise. but as long as you know that, no biggie.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint and cultural!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for 3 days before our cruise departed from San Juan- At first, I was a bit skeptical, but once I entered the lobby, I loved it! The lobby is a bit small and crowded ( especially if you arrive early and need to put your luggage down), but the room was clean and tidy! The water pressure was great! The personnel all spoke very good English and were very helpful. The outdoor terrace areas were surrounded by lush flowers and not much noise could be heard from the street. Very different from the high rise hotels down the block on Condado Beach. The continental breakfast was more than sufficient! Best of all, the location is great! One block away is the main street where there are tons of eateries, casinos and shops! We were able to walk through the Marriott and layout on their beach with no questions asked. Also won $700 on the dollar slots! We felt very safe also, especially having two teenage daughters. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfy, but can be a little bit noisy. If you're going to Old San Juan, get ready for a $10+ cab ride. Also, the continental breakfast was mediocre. All things considered, though, it was an extremely economical place to stay in San Juan and the staff was amazingly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the Coral Princess for 2 nights in May, and were 100% satisfied. Of couse, it is not the Hilton, but I felt the $125/night we paid was a steal. The room was small, but very clean with tasteful decor. The bathroom was good sized, included a jacuzzi tub, and appeared to have been recently remodelled. The common areas of this hotel were absolutely beautiful. The complimentary breakfast was basic, but good. There is a small pool (which you should not need since the beach is two blocks away!) and on the third floor, a hot tub. The third floor also has a large, home-like common area with kitchen, living, dining, and pool table. We did not use this, but it looked really nice. The beach is so close, and the Marriott casino is right around the bend. This hotel has prime location and is a great place to stay if you don't want to pay the money for a busy resort-hotel. Cab rides into Old San Juan were short, less than ten minutes, and relatively cheap (I think it was 12 for both of us). Plaza Las Americas is about a 5 minute cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place & Staff”
Reviews.Author: FlintHillsKansan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a night, prior to our cruise. It was a very unique hotel which is within walking distance of a lot of things. The hotel was clean and quiet. The staff were very helpful. I asked several questions and was given a few recommendations on places to go (within walking distance). All turned out to be great places. Can't go wrong at this small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small quiet inn at the heart of Condado”
Reviews.Author: tlcall01
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quite inn, just a walk away from the beach and fine dining, then The Coral Princess Inn is for you. We found San Juan and Old San Juan to be crazy-- a lot of traffic and congestion. While The Coral Princess Inn is in the heart of Condado, it is quite and has a nice little court yard and pool. The staff were very friendly and even mailed my phone charger back to the states after I left it there!

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed...”
Reviews.Author: 1hockeywife
Reviews.Content: A couple weeks ago, my husband and I had to overnight in San Juan before an early flight- after much research and reading reviews on Tripadvisor- I Chose The Coral Princess Inn- ( I must say that I have used Tripadvisor many times and truly trust the site based on the reviews I have gotten in the past and have not been dissapointed thus far) We chose CPI based on the location (10 minutes from the Airport) and several positive reviews on the website. There were a few negative reviews- but I chocked that up to Extra picky travelers. But I must say I was VERY dissapointed in the Coral Princess Inn- the rooms were very dirty-thank goodness there is no carpet-I can't imagine how dirty the carpet would have been-but the back of the door in the bathroom was filthy- the front side of the tub was grimy- and all of the electrical cords in the room had a thick layer of dust and grime on them- just to mention a few areas that caught my attention. Oh yes, and the air coming from the A/C unit smelled moldy & musty. The ceiling had water stains and cracks on it from a water leak in the past...Maybe- the suites are nicer- we did not see any other room options when there... I must say the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. They call themselves a"boutique" hotel and I do think the public areas were lovely- though, we didn't spend much time in them- and I think the original idea for the place was great- but, It was overall very dirty- and needs to be updated- The rooms need a fresh coat of paint and a DEEP cleaning! So, I am sorry to report that we were dissapointed in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PatCoty
Reviews.Content: The Coral Princess Inn was a breath of fresh air for us. I happened upon it while searching for a pre-cruise hotel with consistent good reviews here on Trip Advisor. Coral Princess Inn was everything we expected and more. The rooms were large and extremely clean. We had an executive room which was a bit larger than the standard for $10.00 more. Some may call the furnishings a bit austere, but for us, they were comfortable and just enough. The staff at Coral Princess Inn were friendly and so helpful. Desk Clerk, Jason, recommended at great restaurant for lunch just a block from the hotel and on our way back from the beach (a mere 2 blocks away!). The "included" breakfast was a terrific way to start the day, and was plentiful and very fresh. The small courtyard area was filled with tropical plants and flowering orchids, which continued the Caribbean atmosphere. The third floor had a lovely seating area and hot tub, as well as a small lap pool on the second floor. Suites were located on the 3rd floor and looked beautiful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for clean, affordable, friendly, "non-chain" lodging in San Juan. We're looking forward to our next visit to the Coral Princess Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: NanciAndLoren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on our way from Oregon to Grenada in late February, 2006. The room was comfortable and clean, the staff very friendly and helpful (and spoke perfect English), the hotel itself was quaint and comfortable, with well kept gardens and the location was fabulous - especially in consideration of the reasonable rate we paid. After checking out, they securely stored our luggage until it was time to leave for the airport, so we were free to roam the beach and city for the day. We would stay here again, without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Alison T
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 children) stayed at the Coral Princess in February. Overall it was quite a good experience. Our room had two double beds and was fairly small. The wardrobe was about 2ft wide by 2ft high, so a little small for the four of us. The bathroom was small and basic, but the kids loved the jacuzzi bath. There wasn't a coffee maker in the room which was a pity. There wasn't a room safe or iron/ironing board either. The guy on reception tried the 'hard sell' on excursions and kept phoning the room to see if we had made a decision! The tiny swimming pool was in the shade all afternoon, but the small hot tub on the roof was in a sun trap and was great. Breakfast was OK, nothing special, but quite edible. The aircon in the room was very noisy, but it was too warm to sleep without it. Would only recommend this hotel for a couple of nights at most. I would go back, but my husband wouldn't!

Reviews.Title: “If only the rooms were as nice as the public spaces”
Reviews.Author: ansafae
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending two separate nights at the Coral Princess. One night before a cruise and one night after. The hotel itself is very cute. Lots of beautiful greenary, and lovely orchids all over the lower courtyard area. The outdoor sitting area on the second floor landing was a great place to sit down and enjoy a cup of coffee and a nice conversation area (except for the noisy trucks going by). The roof top hottub was nice, but the temp is way to low to be enjoyed in the evening, needed to be much warmer. The pool (which is at ground level) was very small but refreshing on a hot day. Sadly the public spaces are much much nicer than the rooms. We had a double room booked for four adults and a ton of luggage (we were cruising after all). We barely fit. There was just enough room to suffle by the sides of the beds and a slightly larger gap between them. There was good lighting, but it would have been nice if the blubs had been covered, not bare. No troubles with the shower, but the tub was missing it's plug and the staff had trouble locating one that fit. Ended up stuffing a face cloth in the drain and filling the tub anyway. The room was clean and personally I didn't mind the marble floor. $1 for phone calls seemed a bit steep, but it was a cordless phone so you could go and sit outside and chat, that was nice.
