Had a bit of trouble figuring out the air conditioning controls, but that was fine. The room is nice a quiet at night, rarely heard the traffic at all. Location was awesome. Condado is a cute area (lots of hurricane damage on a couple of older hotels makes it look a bit run down in places). But there are lots of good restaurants and small (expensive) shops near by. Dunkin Donuts is a block over and had GREAT coffee, just don't be in a hurry when you go they are very very very s-l-o-w. The beach is about 2 blocks away (less than 5 min walk) and is very beautiful. We paid $180 for the double room with 4 adults. At bit steep by my standards for what we got, but reasonable for high season in San Juan. It is way different from what I would expect from a Canadian or US hotel in that price range, but hey this is the island mon! Breakfast was nice lots of pastries, ceral, toast, juice etc. The people were very friendly and helpful. The location Great! Would I stay there again? Yes but only for a night, two at most.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: weaversmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coral Princess for 2 days and three nights after our cruise to see San Juan and relax. We found it to be everything we needed. The continental breakfast was better than expected also. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They went way out of their way to try to help us get an Eco Tour. They also recommended two very good restaurants for dinner. The hotel is conveniently located in San Juan within blocks and walking distance of the beach, busses, night life and rental cars. We would recommend the Coral Princess to anyone going to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Find”
Reviews.Author: mrvlv
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent one night here before a cruise and found the Coral Princess to be a quaint spot. The location is good, and for just a night or two, it's a great bargain. The artwork is gorgeous, the staff is pleasant and accomodating, and I loved the furniture designs. Others traveling with us were not thrilled with the small rooms, but my immediate group received a complimentary upgrade to one of the penthouse suites, and we were just fine. The whole upstairs area is great for entertaining if you have visitors while staying there. Overall, Coral Princess reminds me of European hotels--small with friendly staff and not too many extras. Not a 4 star, but I would definitely stay again, and I would recommend it for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “pretty standard, good location”
Reviews.Author: ledio
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Coral Princess Inn on November 2005. The hotel has a very good location and the area is quiet and decent. We are not the type of people to whine about the change of sheets and spots on the walls, but there seemed to be a major problem with their air conditioning at the room we were staying in.We got that little room no 12 for 99 USD per night on the second floor. The temperature in the room was never under 32 degrees celcius and we found it hard to sleep sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night before and one night after our cruise. The first night was fine, not what I expected from all the good reviews but was "acceptable" for a night. After the cruise we go to check in for our second night and was told that we didn't have a reservation, BUT that we were charged a no show for a night that was 2 days before our cruise and the desk clerk admitted it was hotel error. I was given a letter saying my card would be credited. I waited 1 week and the account was never credited, I emailed them after that and after another week of waiting I had to file a fraudelant charge claim with my bank and get a new debit card. I never received any kind of response from this hotel at all and even had expedia.com contact them. Also the second night since my reservation was lost we were stuck in a room on the backside of the hotel and were up until 2 a.m. because the building next door was having some kind of party. Sorry for the rant.

Reviews.Title: “A bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Sneezie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last night during our trip to catch an early morning flight the next day. (We stayed near the rainforest the rest of the trip). The location is very convenient to Rt 26 which takes you to San Juan to the west, and the airport to the east. Having read all the raves on Tripadvisor prior to our arrival, however, I was slightly disappointed by the hotel. Our room was small (about 12x12). With a queen size bed, a desk and a TV cabinet, it felt crammed. I looked at two other rooms - one about the same size as ours with a queen size bed, and another that's bigger with a king size bed, for $20 more. I was told that all the rooms with queen beds are small. Since we were only staying for one night, we decided to keep our room. There was an unclean feel to the room that I couldn't quite place. Perhaps it was the heavy grain marble floor, or the dullness of it. For a new hotel, the furnishing was unexpectedly worn: the headboard rattled with the slightest movement in bed, and the paint on the desk was worn to bare wood in a few places. Perhaps what got to me the most was the dubious little black balls of lint/dirt in the bedsheet. We paid $130 with tax for one night. For longer stays, I recommend paying extra for a bigger room. However, for the same price, you could do better with some of the B&B's or vacation rentals in the Condado/Ocean Park/Isla Verde area. A last word about parking - there are four parking spaces in front of the hotel, one of which is handicap reserved parking. If those are taken, parking is available at a nearby hotel for $10 every 24 hrs, or you may be able to find a spot on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for 3 days during October. The room was clean and well maintained. One thing we will remember about the room is that AC was freezing!!! But that isn't a bad thing. The CPI is in walking distance to all of Condado as well as on the bus route for taking a trip to Old San Juan or to Isle de Verde. Great price too!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this one!”
Reviews.Author: gwalt
Reviews.Content: The Coral Princess is a fabulous, boutique hotel in the Condado, only a block away from the beach. Lots of beautifully appointed common areas, rooftop setup perfect for sunset cocktails, and lovely, albeit small, pool area. Short walk to the beautiful beach and great restaraunts. If you want the expensive, mega-resort experience, go ahead and book a room at Dorado, but you could just as well be in Miami. If you want to experience the lovely hospitality and culture of Puerto Rico, book the Coral Princess at a quarter of the price, and still get first class rooms and friendly, attentive service. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Questionable Location”
Reviews.Author: frostypurplemanatee
Reviews.Content: The Coral Princess was clean and attractive. The pool is small but appealing and the hot tub was great. We were there during the low tourism season, so often we were the only ones using the tub and pool. The continental breakfast was nice, and the staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel is only about a $15 cab ride to and from the airport and about $10 to the cruise pier. The downfall of this hotel is the fact the it is surrounded by pretty dumpy places next door and across the street. In fact, I was concerned about going outside after dark the first night we were there. Even though we did venture out after dark subsequently, I still felt insecure once we got off the main drag (Condado) which is about 4 blocks away. This is not the fault of the hotel obviously, but it is something to consider if you are picky about the neighborhood where you stay. We were there 3 nights, and I would not want to stay there longer than that. We probably will not return to PR, but if we did I would not stay in this hotel again because of the condition of the surrounding buildings/area. I highly reccomend other hotels on the main strip because the area is much nicer. Also, the beach was beautiful. It was about 4 blocks away. However, no swimming is permitted because of heavy seas and sharp rocky terrain. If you are a beach person, I would double check to see if you can stay at a hotel with beach access.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews I decided to stay four nights at the Coral Princess Inn. Staff was helpful but pool was very small. Breakfast was OK nothing to rave about. Beach was a couple of blocks away and the local students drink and party during the day so there was no relaxation time. You can rent chairs and umbrellas for $3.00. The bus ride into San Juan is .25 cents but you often have to wait 45 minutes to an hour or more. Basically if I did not pay upfront I would have stayed at a better location. The area was not tourist friendly some local restaurants staff were rude and very overpriced average meal for two between $60 and $80. Next time Iâ€™ll stay in Old San Juan or Isle Verde. Also the hotel charges $8.00 per day service fee.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Surprise”
Reviews.Author: GoldenRetrevier
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms were so clean and the hotel is so quaint. There are outdoor terrace areas with great landscaping and we just loved staying here. The free breakfast was more than we expected and the staff was so friendly and helpful. The beach is only a few blocks away and we felt safe when we were walking. A great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess is the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: LaBoricuaCubana
Reviews.Content: Coral Princess Inn is a very nice hotel in an ideal location. The staff is friendly, the rooms are extremely clean and cool, and the parking is not too far away. Obviously it would be ideal if it had parking right at the hotel but the walk is not even five minutes so it doesn't really take away from the hotel. We didn't swim in the pool but we saw it and it looked very clean. We did not check out the jacuzzi either. It's not a far drive from Old San Juan and as previous posts have mentioned, you can take a cab or the bus. I recommend this hotel whole heartedly....We will definetely stay there again, we loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Puerto Rico during the week of 6/20 to 6/25. We stayed at the Coral Princess Inn. We canot stop raving about the hotel. We had nice comfortable, clean rooms. The rooms had a little refrigerator with a small freezer. The continential breakfast is great too. There is a nice patio in the back to enjoy your breakfast. The front desk is very friendly and informatative. The hotel is located in Condado San Juan. It is near shops, restaurants and transportation. There is a bus stop across the street. Also there is access to the other hotel if interested in going to the casinos. Condado Beach is a block 1/2 away. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean friendly & stylish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a cruise which started & ended in San Juan & used the Coral Princess as our base before & after. Excellent small & friendly hotel. I tried it after reading so many positive reviews on this site & I was not disappointed! We were lucky enough to have the top floor suite as an upgrade on the first night (before the cruise) and took full advantage of the roof terrace, indoor & outdoor jacquzzis, and a pool table in the living room. Great! On our return we had a standard room but found you can still use the terrace, tubs & pool table...and you have a whirlpool bath in every room anyway!. The breakfast buffet (continental style) was a treat in the lovely airy covered patio on the ground floor, with a good selection of cereals, juice,ham cheese pastries etc. And there's a small but clean & level swimming pool with no deep end, so great if you are a nervous swimmer. Just one downside...the taxi fare to the port cost us around $15-$20 each way, even though it's not that far. So a portside hotel, may be more expensive but at least you would be on site for the cruise. But if you just want to get into Old Town San Juan (which is beautiful) then take the frequent quick & clean buses....it's just 25cents per person!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel from 5/6 thru 5/9.. We had a top floor suite. The room was very large with a large bathroom (very clean). We had a mini refrig in our room which came in very handy..As stated in the other reviews parking can be an issue, however, in the Condado area you really do not need a car to get around..So simply get a parking spot and leave your car there..The bus stop to Old San Juan is a short walk away, as well as, all restaurants..My only complaints and they were minor were the room did not have tissues and maid service did not make-up the room until 4:00pm each day. Breakfast was simple and basic but very filling and fresh. Desk management was very friendly and very helpful with directions and suggesting and making restaurant reservations.. I have stayed at the Wind Chimes hotel in the past and would recommend the Coral Princess over it and I would definetly stay at the Coral Princess again.

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality made a rainy week pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Greetings! My wife and I booked from May 13th 2005 thru the 19th.From the moment we arrived Manager Luis and his staff made our stay extremely pleasant during an entire week of rain. His assistant, (wish I could remember her name, a short haired angel) went out of her way to help us recommending excellent restaurants, tours tips etc. We felt very comfortable and relaxed here, with personalized service. We were on a bus stop headed to the Plaza American mall when we heard a driver honking his horn, turned out to be Luis and he gave us a ride to the mall...that was cool! Surrounded by some big busy hotel-casinos,this building itself is so beautiful, marble floors,very clean, oil paintings all over,trees and exotic plants ,complimentary breakfast every day and a comfortable room with icy-cold AC's. A stones throw from everything I highly recommend this Inn. I am soooo glad we did not end up in one of the larger hotels.We will return hopefully the sun will be out! Peace...DJ Ray and Donna, NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A+++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Coral Princess Inn for 2 days prior to going on a cruise in April 2005. I must say I have stayed in many hotels some very expensive and well known but none ever as great as this one. The staff was great and the room was very nice and inexpensive. The hotel is decorated in non typical hotel furnishing but ones that I would decorate my own home with. The floors and bathroom walls are marble and extremly clean. I would go back to San Juan and stay at the Coral Princess Inn anyday over the well know hotels. The upper level patio was great. I would advise anyone going to San Juan, PR to definatly book with them.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Haven”
Reviews.Author: fireblade600
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a forced layover on our way from the US to BVI on our honeymoon. The front desk was very polite, informative, helpful, courteous, and trustworthy. My wife actually forgot her wallet on the chair in the lobby and they held it until we came back through the lobby. The hotel was locked at all times so not just anyone can come in and they know immediately who you are, your name, and you're best interest. The rooms were average to small but clean. The beach is 2 blocks away but i was cautioned that it might not be the safest place. The water was rough and the beach was 'busy' with tourist, locals, vendors, and in my opinion not very relaxing, but we obviously weren't there for the beach anyway. It didn't seem to me like there was much around to see or do otherwise. We took a bus to old san juan which was about a good 40 minute ride during 'happy hour'. We lucked out b/c there was a festival there which was alot of fun. The local buses are dirt cheap and pick up / stop a block away from the coral princess (near the pharmacy which i believe is open 24hrs). Taking a taxi could cost you a fortune and renting a car is a complete waste of money b/c you will literally get run off the road if you try to drive against those locals. I'm not kidding when i say they drive on the sidewalks and they drive full throttle / full horn. Even riding on the bus was like being in a scene from the movie 'Speed'. If you're looking for a fancy hotel or a quaint little B&B this boutique hotel is neither. Rather, I think of this place as a 'safe haven' when traveling. I would go back there again b/c it's relatively close to the airport (20 minute taxi ride which the hotel arranges for you), fairly priced, and feels safe, however i would also like to try el Convento which consistently gets good reviews or somewhere in Old San Juan (b/c there's more to walk around and see, shop, dine, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Perki
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed one night at this wonderful inn, prior to a cruise. We found the people at the front desk to be very helpful. Our plane landed at 7:00pm and it was just about 7:30pm when we checked in and we were hungry. The lady behind the desk gave us several choices of places all just a block away and of course told us where the Wal-greens was as we forgot a couple of items and needed to get a lighter since they now won't allow them on airplanes. We had Room #17 with a King bed and cost us $165 all taxes, etc included, I think it was $135/$145 or something like that before taxes. Room was very clean, bed was confortable and had plenty to choose from on the TV. I took a shower that night so I could sleep in a little the next morning and not sure if everyone was showering to go out to dinner or what but the temperature of the water kept going from very hot to cold to perfectly warm so I had to keep moving in and out of the water - water pressure was great though. The next morning my husband took a shower and he didn't have this problem so not sure what the reason was that it acted this way with me but just thought I'd mention it as an FYI. At checkout there was another couple ahead of who were disputing phone charges that came up on their bill, they even occured prior to them checking into the hotel so knew they were incorrect. Management credited them so they didn't have to pay and then when we got our bill the same thing happened! Of course we didn't have to pay either but make sure you look at your final bill just in case. Even with these little items I would stay here again in a heartbeat - the character of the building, common areas and rooms was wonderful, you can stay at a cookie cutter hotel anywhere, we wanted something more of a local feel and I would say this has it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The rooms & bathrooms were very clean, cleaner than a hospital OR! Though the cheapest (99$) room is quite small and congested if you are staying more than a few nights. Great breakfast included, fun to talk with the other friendly customers. If you want to sleep late, ask for a room away from the breakfast area. Has a small pool, rooftop Jacuji (needs maintainance). Is less than 5 mins walk to the beach 7We stayed for 3 nights. The rooms & bathrooms were very clean, cleaner than a hospital OR! Though the cheapest (99$) room is quite small and congested if you are staying more than a few nights. Great breakfast included, fun to talk with the other friendly customers. If you want to sleep late, ask for a room away from the breakfast area. less than 5 minutes to walk to the beach & in the heart of Condado. Very friendly staff & awesome owner! Best Feature: Very clean Need Improvement: parking

Reviews.Title: “Verify your check out time!”
Reviews.Author: iramcynyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean, pleasant and close to a lovely beach, restaurants and shops. However, we had three complaints. Firstly, unlike the other hotels where we stayed in Puerto Rico (Coral Princess was the third one after a few weeks of traveling throughout the island), there was no bathroom/shower facility to use after the beach once we had checked out. It was our last day and we wanted to go for one last dip in the sea after we had checked out but could not do so since they did not have this amenity. Typically hotels near beaches have this facility, so were a bit surprised. Secondly, parking is impossible to find, so the hotel will direct you to a private parking lot service up the street where you have to pay ten dollars to park per day. The money was not an issue, but unloading and loading the suitcases before moving the cars was (two cars and six girls - a lot of luggage!). And lastly, we were given a printed confirmation before we even got there that our check-out time was at noon. We planned our day accordingly only to be told at the last minute that we had to check out at eleven, which led to an unpleasant argument with the front-desk staff and a scramble to collect our things after breakfast. Overall I would say that after the other hotels we had experienced in Puerto Rico, the Coral Princess was not impressive. But it is definitely less expensive, and if you know what to expect in advance regarding parking, showers and check-out times, it should work out well.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden paradise in middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I make the reservation for this hotel I have no idea of the hidden paradise that I found in the middle of the city. This small hotel offers more than I expected. It has beautiful rooms with floors in marble and each bath has a jacuzzi bathtubs!! It has a enchanting patio with tropical flowers, terracota tiles and a marvlous mobiliary, a little but confortable pool and very kind personnel. Definitively I will visit this great place again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: McC60
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Coral Princess (Mar 21-24,'05). We really liked the place - cute, quaint, nice dipping pool, lovely gardens and very nice staff. Our room was very small, but ok for just a few nights. This is a great location to bus (that goes to Old SJ for .25), restaurants, etc. There is a Wal-Greens just around the corner for those forgotten items. We felt very comfortable walking the around even at 10-11pm. They serve a continental breakfast that is just ok. Not much to choose from and the very same every morning! For the price, $176/nt (we got shafted due to spring break), we probably would not stay there again. All in all, it was fine and it really is in a great location - the larger hotels around that area were about $100 more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts....A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, and children 8 and 11 year old) and I stayed at the Coral Princess located in Condado 2/19 and 2/20, Washington's Birthday weekend, prior to our cruise. We waited till the last minute and were scrambling a week before to find a place to stay. Nothing was available, no Marriott, no Wyndham, nothing. After looking on line at what was available (not very appealing) , I tried calling some of the highly rated smaller hotels and asking for vacancy or advice where to stay. Two calls led me to the Coral Princess. The only vacancy they had was the penthouse, which cost less than a room at the Marriott a block away. Right upon our arrival we were thrilled. We loved the rooftop hot tub. We loved the kitchen and dining area (we were so tired the first night, we brought back take out) The hotel was very clean!! The marble floor tiles in the room were a nice touch. We loved the continental breakfast on the downstairs patio. The hotel staff was so friendly. The hotel location was excellent, very close to many restaurants and the beach. The hotel staff go out of their way to make your stay special. They even allowed us to store our bags with them after checkout so we could walk around and enjoy the day before we went to the cruise ship. On Saturday night were looking for a restaurant. "Ellen", who I think was the manager, must have spent a half hour calling various restaurants trying to get us a table. Being Washington's Birthday weekend it was tough finding getting a reservation. The restaurant she booked us at was outstanding. I looked at a lot of hotel reviews for San Juan hotels on line. There seems to be a prevailing issue with cleanliness/shabbiness/quality. That is not a problem at the Coral Princess!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of This - It May Not be What you Think”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures were beautiful and the public area wes, BUT: I have stayed at a lot of hotels/motels because I travel a lot. This was by far the VERY WORST I've ever experienced, and at a far greater cost than many. I paid $132 for a room that was so small a king size would have fit wall to wall. The bed was made to fit the room, not a single but not a double, consequently the sheets didn't fit on the homemade lumpy mattress. You couldn't walk around the bed at all, you had to kinda sidle around. All the furniture in the room was made of cheap plywood painted black! There was a hugh black plywood box by the side of the bed, to go to the bathroom you had to slide by it. Absolutly the worst - I was tired when I got there so I didn't object to what I was given, BUT IT CERTAINLY SHOULD HAVE! They didn't even have a bedside clock or facial tissues! Then as if that wasn't bad enough, the staff allowed a couple older guests to annoy the rest of the guest until after 3 in the morning. At 12:00 a.m. I called the desk to ask when the swimming pool closed. They did go down and move them out of there, but they then went to the open courtyard in the middle. They couple continued to talk very loudly, with the high-pitched giggle that some older women have. Needless to say IT WAS ANNOYING! I made another call to desk an hour later, I had to get up early to catch my flight out. They did go down and talk to them again. Well, we lost the old lady, but the old man went into the piano and doodled until after 3:00 a.m.. The front desk was on the same floor, just around the corner and they did nothing. The other guests should have been entitled to some consideration. WE DIDN'T GET IT! As I say, beware of the Coral Princess Inn - they are a scam and should not get your business! ROOM 8 - March 2, 2005

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb '05, I must admit I was not at all impressed with the general SJ area and beaches but I did enjoy my stay in the hotel. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable, my first one was very dark on the 2nd floor but I asked to be moved and they accommodated me. The staff are very friendly, everything is spotlessly clean and I enjoyed starting my day with breakfast in the charming garden. I saw lots of really bad hotels and Inns in this area that looked like they had not been renovated for many years so I was happy with my choice! I booked this hotel on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews which proved to be very accurate! I don't think I will be visiting SJ again but if I do I would definitely stay here again and thoroughly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Striving to be the best and it is!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Coral Princess Inn on Feb 25th and 26th, 2005 as well as March 6th. We were taking a cruise and knowing the potential for snow in New England, we decided to arrive two days early. As luck would have it, snow arrived on the morning of our departure. I was able to contact the hotel to let them know of our delay in arrival and they were more than accomodating in assuring us that the desk is available 24/7 to check us in since our flight to San Juan would not arrive until after midnight. Upon arrival, we were told that the guest in our room had a medical emergency and we had been upgraded to the penthouse suite. Our rating of this hotel is not because of this upgrade but instead because of the excellent customer service afforded us during our stay and the spotless and tidy cleanliness of the rooms. My wife had suffered a sprained ankle prior to arriving in San Juan and during our first morning at the Coral Princess Inn, the front desk called and wanted to know if they could run out and get us anything that we needed especially "room service".(there is no restaurant at the hotel) In addition, I came down with a sinus infection that same day which caused me great discomfort. Not only did they consider this important but they recommended that I go to the hospital emergency room, called us a cab, and promised to hold our checkout procedure as long as possible. As it turned out, we were back before 11:00 am and in time for our regular departure. And finally, I had bought some beer that I was unable take on the cruise with me but they were kind enough to hold it until my return in one week. It sure tasted good as we waited for our room to be ready on March 6th. Without question, this hotel ranks as the best hotel we have ever stayed at in our many excursions because of their continued effort to put customer service ahead of anything else. San Juan is home to many cruise ships, so book early and stay late--You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver reviewer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for two nights in early December 2004. The location is in a pleasant part of town near the beach and an easy $.25 bus ride to Old San Juan. Our room was small but attractively furnished with a nice bathroom. The breakfast was just okay, but the breakfast area was very attractive. The staff was friendly and helpful, and overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Coral Princess. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. We had never been to San Juan before, and loved the city!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: shona67
Reviews.Content: Generously service & friendly staffs. We defintely will come back next year in same penthouse room!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Pretty Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MBSNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a week at the Coral Princess. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is lovely, with more of the feel of a guesthouse than a hotel. The rooms and public areas are classy - nicely decorated rooms and outdoor public areas with beautiful ceramic tile and lush greenery. Everybody there we came in contact with was friendly and helpful when required, most especially the manager, who gave us advice and then asked follow-up questions to find out how it went. We stayed in the handicap room because it was the only one available with a kitchenette, which we needed because we had to bring our own food for lunch and dinner. It, as well as the room, is small, but we managed OK. There was sometimes a musty smell in the room, which dissipated when we turned up the air conditioner, and the hot water took a very long time to heat up (but once it did it was fine). The bathroom has the feel of a commercial bathroom, which I didn't like because it wasn't pretty, but logically it's appropriate for the room. The upside was that the room is right on the ground floor with the beautiful outdoor courtyard and breakfast area right outside. This was great because even though there is a small table in the room that we could have eaten at, instead we were easily able to take our food right outside and eat at the tables set up for the breakfast. The continental breakfast they served was fine. The neighborhood is great. There are a lot of things for tourists, but it is also somewhat residential and not tacky at all. It also felt very safe. The Walgreen's around the corner was great to have, because it is open 24 hrs. and sold just about everything you could imagine except fresh fruit, which I found in a grocery story down Ashford Ave. The beach is very close by, and is the same beach that the Marriot Hotel opens onto. It is very clean and beautiful, and you could rent lounge chairs right there for $3.00/day. We rented a car and it was very easy to get to the highway from the hotel. The parking was not a problem - in addition to the 4 hotel spots and the backup parking for $10 down the block, there was street parking, which we were able to find right across the street. I would definitely recommend Puerto Rico, the Condado neighborhood, and the Coral Princess.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for one night before a cruise of Feb. 11, 2005. The hotel was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small but clean and contained everything we needed. The hotel is two blocks from the heart of the Condado area and a 25 cent bus ride from Old San Juan. The breakfast was nothing fancy, but consisted of cold cereal, oatmeal, sweet rolls, yogurt, and fruit. Just enough to kickstart your day! I thought this hotel was an exceptional value for the money and would not hesistate to stay here again for a day or two. If you are going to stay longer, you would probably want to go with one of the bigger hotels in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mosconi
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from a 5 day stay at the Coral Princess and loved it. We stayed in the penthouse (3rd floor). The room was big (only two penthouse rooms on the 3rd floor) and cleanly kept by the staff. The room has a small balcony leading onto a roof patio with a small jacuzzi. The hotel is 1/2 block from Walgreens and two blocks from the beach. A nice Argentinian restaurant is locked within 100 feet of the hotel. The staff was friendly and very helpful in recommending bars & restaurants. This hotel is a great value if you are looking for something that cost less than the chain hotels located just a few blocks away (the Marriott is about 1 1/2 blocks). The continental breakfast was nice but nothing special....that's about the worst thing I can say about the Coral Princess. I would definitely stay there again. Also, we highly recommend taking the rainforest tour. We toured with Sunshine Tours. The guide's name was Rupert. He was very knowledgeable, a gentleman and a great conversationalist. After touring the rainforest we stopped by Loquilla beach which was okay but nothing special. The rainforest is a must, Loquilla beach is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coral Princess 1/29-2/3 and loved it. We stayed on the Penthouse (3rd floor) level and pretty much had the whole space to ourselves. It has a beautifully decorated common area with couches, tables, full kitchen, pool table and a wonderful rooftop deck with a great little jacuzzi. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was nicely done. The entire hotel is very well kept and sweet. We were close to the beach, Walgreen's and all the good restaurants, three blocks from Avis, where we rented a car several days, and a short cab ride from Old San Juan. We recommend Cieto Lindo, a very yummy & affordable Mexican restaurant just a block from the hotel on Magdalena. Be careful driving in Puerto Rico. The road signs are horrible and the drivers are worse. There are no rules in Puerto Rico!!! I recommend you buy a good road map at a book store, prior to your trip, if you plan on doing any driving. Other than that, we had an amazing time, and this hotel is the perfect resting place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel, with great service”
Reviews.Author: LAfromMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1/16 - 1/18, and found the Coral Princess to be clean and the service to be very friendly. The hotel is in a great area with lots of restaurants within a short walking distance. In particular we went to Miro's about a block and a half away, at the recommendation of the front desk. The food was excellent. There was a pool, and hot tub, however, we did not end up using them. The breakfast consisted of sweet rolls, juice, and ham and cheese. The area to eat in was clean. I loved all the orchids. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive!!!”
Reviews.Author: naylenk
Reviews.Content: I am so incredibly glad that we decided to stay at the Coral Princess Inn. It is a beautiful hotel that is kept very clean and well-decorated. We stayed for three nights in the beginning of January as part of our honeymoon. When we arrived we were told that our room was penthouse 3. We only paid $99 a night and our room and amenities were fantastic! Just outside of our room (small but very nice) we had a beautiful living room, kitchen with stainless steel appliances, a pool table and dining room. As far as I know, anyone could take advantage of these rooms. I know that several people came up to play pool. At the end of our floor was the huge deck area with hot tub that anyone can access. The breakfast in the morning was small but nice with a very relaxing setting. Another poster must have missed it because it is tucked away but there is an outdoor pool on one side of the hotel. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would recommend it to anyone heading to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly & helpful staff. The only negative comments I have are that the hot tub & sun deck are reserved for the occupants of the penthouse and someone left the window open and it left a stain on the roman shade. The room was clean, even under the bed. Free high speed internet access, cable TV which we actually watched as it rained all week (can't blame the hotel for that). Breakfast was a bit lacking, but it was free. Overall I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: PianoPicker
Reviews.Content: Clean, convenient, comfortable place to stay. The staff was helpful and friendly. They arranged a tour of El Yunque rain forest for us that was excellent. Breakfast was more than adequate. Easy walk to the beach, casinos and plenty of good restaurants. The bus to old San Juan is a block away and the return bus stop is steps away. Would recommend to friends and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChiswickTurnhamGreen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Coral Pincess Inn at the beginning of December. Overall the Inn is great - 9 out of 10. Key facts are: it's spotlessly clean everywhere. With no exceptions, the staff are incredibly nice, friendly and helpful. The place has a funky feel as it has pretty minimal decoration plus some interesting modern art by a local artist (they have her contact details at reception if you want to buy). Everything you need is very local - the local store is the Walgreens half a block away and the beach is 2 blocks away. The Inn serves a cold breakfast that is ok. Drawbacks for the new visitor: The rooms are on the small side but we were hardly there so that was fine with us. All we wanted was a clean, well air conned room with a shower that worked. Which is what you get. There is no pool. (The spa on the roof is ok but the let the whole of the top floor, incuding the spa, on day 3 and so it was out of bounds from then on). We went in December for 6 days. 3 of those days were wet with heavy rain for the majority of the time. The good news is that San Juan has enough to do for when it is rainy (unlike some other Caribbean islands). Also, the other three days were beautiful with strong sunshine and temps in 80s. The beach by the Inn is not your typical Caribbean ideal beach. It on the windward side of the island so this means you get a small bit of sand, a steep drop off, lots and lots of wind and big waves. We loved the waves (they actually made the holiday for us) but if you want tranquil, blue and 'all you can hear is waves gently washing the beach' silence go elsewhere or treck to other parts of the island. Gay-wise, the area is cool with gays but the club is 10 mins taxi ride and the (large) gay bar near the Inn (4 blocks away) was dead day and night. December is not obviously not peak gay season! I would definitely stay here if I came to PR again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and mostly helpful”
Reviews.Author: cathdav
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel two blocks from Condado Beach. The front desk had some great people and a couple that were the exception. The continental breakfast was less than average, but there are some great spots on Ashford where the food is inexpensive and excellent for breakfast......and lunch......and dinner as well. One of the great people at the front desk set up a wonderful snorkeling trip that all four of us loved. We stayed at the hotel during the winter holidays - Xmas through New Years and had a wonderful break from our crazy life.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: ya2sabe
Reviews.Content: The Coral Princess is a well kept secret that is tucked away among the larger hotels in the Condado area. I have stayed there four times, and each time has been great. The staff is great, rooms are a nice size, it's a great location, and it's clean, clean, clean. I'll definitely be staying here again the next time I am in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Charming!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay in P.R. Unfortunately only one night was spent at the Coral Princess. Even though business meetings took us to a much fancier name hotel for the rest of our stay, we kept saying that we wished we could've stayed here the entire time. The room, while small, was very clean and very pretty. Nice jacuzzi tub with lots of hot water. [The shower, however, was dissapointing - not much more than a drip!] It was quiet, the staff was super friendly and helpful, the flowers and plants were beautiful. Very near several restaurants, a Walgreen's, and the beach. Very nice breakfast, also [the cheese "fingers" pastry recommended by the attendant were yummy!]. I would love to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed Nov. 5-6 2004 with another couple in a double room prior to a cruise. The hotel is small, close to bus transportation, beach and restaurants. We found the double room to be quite small but clean. The double beds were comfortable however the room contained a strong damp odor and the front desk provided plug in air fresheners. When we stayed, there was a very loud outdoor party with music one night that prevented sleeping and since the hotel was fully booked we were unable to move. Nice continental breakfast is served in a garden courtyard. There is a outdoor dipping pool to cool off adjacent to the courtyard. Front desk staff is welcoming and helpful. We all agreed that we would probably not stay again if given other options.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Princess Coral Inn two nights in September, one before our cruise and one after. It was a wonderful place. The rooms were small, but it was a wonderful little place with no more that 50 rooms which meant the staff was more personable. Breakfeast was weak, but everything else was wonderful. We will absoutely go stay there again our next visit to San Juan.

HotelInfo.Name: Coral Princess Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1159 Magdalena Street | Condado, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
